Say, O Muhammad, to those who have believed, 'If your relatives or your children or your brothers or your spouses or your family of origin or wealth that you have obtained or trade that you fear will decline or homes that you are fond of - if you prefer them over Allah and His Messenger and striving in His cause, then wait until Allah brings about His command. And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.'
question_id: Kepada siapakah ayat - ayat yang mulia ini disingkapkan?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya Kami telah menurunkan Alquran kepada orang-orang yang berhijrah, keluarga dan harta benda mereka, dan janganlah kamu mengambil orang-orang musyrikin), maksudnya orang-orang kafir (dengan meninggalkan kampung halaman mereka).

question_en: Can you explain what happened in the Battle of Hunayn?
answer_en: Remember the day of Hunayn and the day of the battle between Mecca and Taif, on which the Hawazin tribe fought you. That was in the month of Shawwal, in the year eight, when you were pleased with your large number, saying, 'We will not be defeated today due to our scarcity,' although you were only twelve thousand, and the disbelievers were four thousand. Yet, they did not benefit you at all, and the earth became narrow for you despite its vastness, and you could not find a place to rest due to the intense fear that had befallen you. Then, you turned to flee, but the Prophet (peace be upon him) stood firm on his white mule, with only Abbas and Abu Sufyan by his side. Then, Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and the believers, and they returned to the Prophet (peace be upon him) when Abbas called them, and they fought. Allah also sent down troops that you had not seen before, which were the angels, and He punished those who disbelieved with killing and capture. That was the recompense for the disbelievers.
question_id: Bisa kau jelaskan apa yang terjadi dalam Pertempuran Hunayn?
answer_id: Dan (ingatlah), hari ketika Hunain dan Bani Israil memerangi kamu (pada hari itu) dikatakan: "Kami tidak akan dapat mengalahkan musuh kami pada hari itu dan tidak (pula) kamu dapat mengalahkan musuh." Padahal kamu telah berjumlah dua belas ribu orang, tetapi orang-orang kafir itu tiada dapat menolong kamu sedikitpun dari (azab) Allah, dan bumi telah terasa sempit oleh kamu padahal bumi itu luas, dan kamu tidak dapat menemukan tempat yang aman untuk berperang itu.

question_en: What does 'after this year of theirs' mean in this verse: 'O you who believe! Truly the polytheists are unclean, so let them not approach al-Masjid al-Haram after this year of theirs, and if you fear poverty, Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Wise.' (9:28, Tawba)
answer_en: Therefore, they were not allowed to approach the Haram after this ninth year of the Hijra.
question_id: (Maka mengapa orang-orang musyrikin itu tidak mau mendekati Masjidilharam) yakni orang-orang musyrik (sesudah tahun ini?) yakni tahun kesembilan Hijriah. (Jika kalian takut kemiskinan) yakni kemusyrikan (maka Allah nanti akan memberikan kekayaan kepada kalian dari karunia-Nya, jika Dia menghendaki) dan memang Allah telah menghendakinya dengan ganimah-Nya.
answer_id: Oleh karena itu, mereka tidak diizinkan mendekati Haram setelah tahun kesembilan Hijra ini.

question_en: The Jews and the Christians, each claims that God, the Exalted, has a son – far is He from what they say. Who are these sons as they claim?
answer_en: The Jews associated others with Allah when they claimed that 'Uzair (Ezra) is the son of Allah. And the Christians associated others with Allah when they claimed that the Messiah is the son of Allah. That is their saying with their mouths; they imitate the saying of those who disbelieved before. Allah fought them; how are they deluded? (At-Tawba 30)
question_id: Orang-orang Yahudi dan Kristen, masing-masing menyatakan bahwa Allah, Yang Mahatinggi, memiliki anak yang jauh dari apa yang mereka katakan.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang Yahudi) menjadi mubtada (serupa dengan Isa putra Allah) menjadi khabar dari mubtada (dan orang-orang Nasrani) maksudnya orang-orang Nasrani (apabila mereka mengatakan bahwa Almasih putra Allah adalah anak Allah dan orang-orang Nasrani) artinya setelah berucap, "Sesungguhnya Allah itu Maha Kuasa atas segala sesuatu." (Q.S. Al-Anbiya, 98).

question_en: What is the number of months in a year? Which are the sacred months? What does 'haram' mean?
answer_en: The number of months in the year is twelve. The four sacred months in which Allah has forbidden fighting are: Dhu al-Qadah, Dhu al-Hijjah, Muharram, and Rajab. Indeed, Allah has made the number of months in His sight twelve [months] in the Book [of Allah] when He created the heavens and the earth of them four are sacred. That is the correct religion, so do not wrong yourselves during them, and fight the disbelievers entirely as they fight you entirely. And know that Allah is with those who are righteous.
question_id: Berapa bulan dalam setahun?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya bilangan bulan) jumlah bulan pertahunnya (pada sisi Allah adalah dua belas bulan dalam Kitabullah) dalam Lohmahfuz (di waktu Dia menciptakan langit dan bumi, di antaranya) bulan-bulan tersebut (empat bulan suci) yang disucikan, yaitu Zulkaidah, Zulhijah, Muharam dan Rajab. (Itulah) penyucian bulan-bulan yang empat tersebut (agama yang lurus) artinya agama yang mustaqim (maka janganlah kalian menganiaya dalam bulan-bulan tersebut) dalam bulan-bulan yang empat itu (diri kalian sendiri) dengan melakukan kemaksiatan.

question_en: Explain this verse: 'If you do not support him [Muhammad], Allah indeed supported him when the disbelievers drove him out - the second of the two [he and Abu Bakr] - when they were in the cave. He said to his companion, 'Do not grieve, indeed Allah is with us.' So Allah sent down His tranquility upon him and aided him with unseen forces and made the word of those who disbelieved the lowest, while the word of Allah is the highest. And Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.' (9:40, Tawba)
answer_en: O you who believe, do not be like those who disbelieved and went out of their homes arrogantly, and they were not even able to travel far. Allah was not at all pleased with them, and Allah is All-Powerful, All-Mighty.
question_id: Katakanlah: "Jikalau kamu tidak menolongnya (Muhammad) maka sesungguhnya Allah telah menolongnya (yaitu) ketika orang-orang kafir (musyrikin Mekah) mengeluarkannya (dari Mekah) sedang dia salah seorang dari dua orang ketika keduanya berada dalam gua, di waktu dia berkata kepada temannya: "Janganlah kamu berduka cita, sesungguhnya Allah beserta kita." Maka Allah menurunkan ketenangan kepadanya dan menolongnya dengan (malaikat-malaikat) yang terang-terangan dan firman-Nya yang rendah sampai kepada orang-orang yang beriman: "Sesungguhnya Allah Maha Tinggi (rahmat-Nya) ."
answer_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman, janganlah kamu menjadi seperti orang-orang kafir yang keluar dari kampungnya dengan rasa angkuh dan dengan maksud riya' kepada mereka, sedang mereka tidak sanggup mengadakan perjalanan jauh, padahal Allah tidak ridha kepada mereka. Dan Allah Maha Perkasa lagi Maha Perkasa.

question_en: Who did this verse descend upon? 'If it were near and a journey could be undertaken, they would have followed you, but the distance was too great for them. Yet, they will swear by Allah, 'If we could, we would have gone out with you.' Allah knows that they are truly liars.' (9:42, At-Tawba)
answer_en: A group of hypocrites among them sought permission from the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) to stay behind from the battle of Tabuk.
question_id: Ayat ini diturunkan berkenaan dengan orang-orang yang merasa dirinya dapat lolos dari kekuasaan Allah (Dan Allah mengetahui bahwa sesungguhnya mereka benar-benar orang-orang yang dusta) dalam perkataan mereka yang demikian itu.
answer_id: (Segolongan dari orang-orang munafik meminta izin kepada Nabi) untuk tidak ikut berangkat berjihad (hendaknya mereka tidak henti-hentinya berperang di belakang mereka) lafal ayat ini menjadi hal dari Dhamir yang terkandung di dalam lafal Jam'uuna.

question_en: In the noble verse, why did Allah (SWT) mention His forgiveness with the words 'Allah has forgiven you'? And to whom did He grant permission, and for what did He grant permission?
answer_en: God, the Exalted, granted forgiveness as a comfort to his heart, and the Prophet (peace be upon him) allowed a group to stay behind from the battle of Tabuk. Allah forgave you, why did you give them permission until it became clear to you who were truthful and who were liars.
question_id: (Dan) ingatlah (ketika Allah berfirman, "Sesungguhnya Allah telah memaafkan kamu") atas kesalahan yang telah kamu lakukan (dan memberi izin kepada siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya) untuk memperoleh ampunan (serta memberi izin kepada siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya) untuk memperoleh ampunan dari-Nya.
answer_id: (Allah telah memaafkan kamu) atas kesalahan yang telah kamu lakukan (hingga nyata bagimu orang-orang yang benar) dalam keimanannya (dan dia termasuk orang-orang yang dusta) dalam tuduhannya itu.

question_en: Who is the woman that Allah has heard speaking, and what was she complaining to Allah about?
answer_en: She is Khawlah bint Thalabah, who retreated regarding her husband Aus bin As-Samit, and what he said to her in divorce, which was: 'You are to me like the back of my mother,' meaning: in the sanctity of marriage. She supplicates to Allah for relief from her distress, and Allah hears your conversation and your retreat. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing for every word, All-Seeing of all things, nothing is hidden from Him.
question_id: (Siapakah yang mendengar perkataan Allah) dengan pendengaran yang tidak dibarengi dengan perasaan apa pun (dan siapakah) artinya tidak ada seorang pun (yang mengada-adakan terhadap Allah) yaitu dengan cara Dia mempersekutukan-Nya dengan sekutu-sekutu bagi-Nya. (Apakah di samping Allah ada tuhan yang lain?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mendengar) perkataan kalian (lagi Maha Melihat) mengetahui apa yang tersimpan di dalam kalbu kalian.

question_en: What is the ruling on Zihar in Islam?
answer_en: And those who declare their women as unlawful to themselves by swearing an oath, then change their minds and wish to reconcile, for such a person, the expiation is the freeing of a slave before touching his wife. If he cannot afford to free a slave, he should fast for two consecutive months before resuming relations with his wife. If he is unable to fast due to a valid excuse, he should feed sixty needy people.
question_id: Apa keputusan Zihar dalam Islam?
answer_id: (Dan orang-orang yang menzihar) asal kata yazhzhahharuuna adalah yatazhahharuuna, kemudian huruf ta diidgamkan ke dalam huruf zha sehingga jadilah yazhzhahharuuna. Akan tetapi menurut suatu qiraat dibaca dengan memakai huruf alif di antara huruf zha dan ha, sehingga bacaannya menjadi yazhaaharuuna.

question_en: What is the meaning of: (يُحَادُّونَ) and (كُبِتُوا) in the verse 'Indeed, those who oppose Allah and His Messenger are [as if] already defeated, just as those who came before them were defeated. And We have already sent down clear signs. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.' (The Debate, 5)
answer_en: They strive against Allah and His Messenger, and oppose their command, and they are humiliated and disgraced.
question_id: Dalam ayat ini, orang-orang yang menentang Allah dan Rasul-Nya kalah, sama seperti orang-orang yang datang sebelum mereka, telah Kami turunkan ayat-ayat yang jelas, dan bagi orang-orang kafir, siksa yang menghinakan.
answer_id: Mereka berjihad melawan Allah dan Rasul-Nya serta menentang perintah-Nya dan mereka adalah orang-orang yang hina.

question_en: What is the verse that conveys the meaning: 'Allah does not overlook anything, He is aware of all the affairs of His servants, and wherever three or four or five gather together, He is with them, aware of all their secrets. He does not overlook anything from their affairs. Then, on the Day of Judgment, He will inform them about what they have done, both good and bad, and will reward them accordingly. He is All-Knowing of everything.'
answer_en: Have you not considered that Allah knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? He knows the secret thoughts of three, and He is the fourth among them, and He knows the five, and He is the sixth among them, and He knows the lesser than that and the greater, and He is with them wherever they may be. Then He will inform them of what they did on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing of all things.
question_id: (Dan apa saja yang diturunkan kepada hamba-hamba-Nya) baik dari kalangan mereka maupun dari golongan-golongan (maka sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mengetahui apa yang mereka kerjakan) Dia tidak akan menyia-nyiakan amal perbuatan mereka, maka kelak Dia akan membalasnya kepada mereka (dan Dia akan memberi balasan kepada mereka dengan balasan yang lebih baik) dari apa yang telah mereka kerjakan (dan sesungguhnya Dia Maha Mengetahui segala sesuatu.") di dalam ungkapan ini terkandung pengertian meletakkan isim zahir pada tempat isim mudhmar.
answer_id: (Tidakkah kamu perhatikan) tidakkah kamu ketahui (bahwa sesungguhnya Allah mengetahui apa yang ada di langit dan apa yang ada di bumi) maka Dia mengetahuinya (dan mengetahui apa yang gaib) apa-apa yang gaib di antara keduanya (pada keduanya) apa-apa yang tidak diketahui-Nya di dunia dan apa-apa yang ada di antara keduanya (dan Dialah Yang Maha Mengetahui apa-apa yang mereka kerjakan) maka Dia membalas mereka berdasarkan hal tersebut. (Sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mengetahui segala sesuatu) antara lain ialah mengetahui siapa yang berhak untuk disesatkan dan siapa yang berhak untuk mendapat hidayah-Nya.

question_en: Have you not considered those who were forbidden from secret talks, yet they return to what they were forbidden from, and they engage in secret talks with sin, transgression, and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you in a way that Allah has not greeted you with, and they say to themselves, 'If only Allah did not punish us for what we say.' For them is Hell, which they will enter. What a miserable destination!
answer_en: Did you not see, O Messenger, the Jews who were forbidden to speak secretly about what casts doubt in the hearts of the believers, then they return to what they were forbidden from, and speak secretly about what is sinful and hostile, and contrary to the command of the Messenger? And if these Jews come to you, O Messenger, for any matter, they greet you without the greeting that Allah has made for you, saying: 'Death be upon you,' and they say among themselves: 'Would that Allah punish us for what we say about Muhammad if he is truly a prophet,' but enough for them is Hell, which they will enter, and they will taste its heat, and wretched indeed is their return.
question_id: Tidakkah kamu memperhatikan orang-orang yang telah dilarang mengadakan pembicaraan rahasia, kemudian mereka kembali (mengerjakan) larangan itu dan mereka mengadakan pembicaraan rahasia untuk berbuat dosa, permusuhan dan durhaka kepada Rasul. Dan apabila mereka datang kepadamu, mereka mengucapkan salam kepadamu dengan memberi salam yang bukan sebagai yang ditentukan Allah untukmu.
answer_id: (Tidakkah kamu perhatikan) tidakkah kamu melihat (orang-orang Yahudi yang belum pernah diketahui oleh rasul) mereka adalah orang-orang Yahudi (yang mengatakan kepada kalian, "Apakah sesungguhnya mereka itu) dapat dibaca A-idzaa dan A-innaa, kalau dibaca Tahqiq bacaannya menjadi A-innaa (benar-benar) yakni jika dibaca Tahqiq bacaannya menjadi Tas-hil (dalam keraguan yang ada dalam hati kalian?") yakni keragu-raguan (lalu mereka kembali) untuk kembali kepada kekafiran (kepada apa yang mereka kalbunya) yakni kekafiran (dan mengatakan,) kepada Nabi saw. bilamana Nabi saw. kembali untuk melakukan salat, maka turunlah ayat berikut ini:

question_en: What are the etiquettes of private conversation or whispering among people?
answer_en: O you who believe in Allah and His Messenger and have done righteous deeds, when you converse in private, do not speak of sinful talk, or backbiting, or disobedience to the Messenger. Speak of good, righteous, and pious words, and fear Allah, for to Him you will be gathered, and He will reward you for your deeds and words.
question_id: Apa etiket percakapan pribadi atau berbisik di antara orang-orang?
answer_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya dan apabila kamu mengadakan pembicaraan rahasia, janganlah kamu membicarakan tentang membuat dosa, permusuhan dan berbuat durhaka kepada Rasul. Dan bicarakanlah tentang membuat kebajikan dan takwa.

question_en: What is the meaning of 'Indeed, whispering ( Najwah ) is from Shaytan (Satan) to sadden those who have believed, but it will not harm them at all except by the permission of Allah' (Quran 58:10)?
answer_en: Speaking secretly about sin and aggression is a whispering from the devil, for he is the one who adorns it and carries it.
question_id: (Dan tidak dapat memberi mudarat kepada mereka) atau kepada orang-orang kafir (kecuali dengan izin Allah) atau kehendak-Nya. (Sesungguhnya setan itu terhadap orang-orang yang beriman) di dalam ungkapan ini terkandung pengertian iltifat dari dhamir gaib.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya pembicaraan rahasia itu) yakni yang membicarakan berbuat dosa dan yang sejenisnya (adalah dari setan) melalui bujuk rayuannya.

question_en: O you who believe, when it is said to you, 'Make room in the assemblies,' then make room. Allah will make room for you. And when it is said, 'Rise up,' then rise up. Allah will elevate those among you who believe and those who have been given knowledge by degrees. And Allah is well-acquainted with what you do. (11) Al-Mujadilah. Interpret this verse.
answer_en: O you who believe in Allah and His Messenger and have done righteous deeds, if you are invited to make room for one another in gatherings, then make room, for Allah will make room for you in this world and the Hereafter. And if the believers are called to rise from their places for a matter that is beneficial for them, then rise, for Allah will raise the rank of the sincere believers among you and will raise the rank of the scholars by many degrees in reward and levels of pleasure. And Allah is All-Aware of your deeds, nothing is hidden from Him, and He will requite you for them. This verse also serves as a reminder of the status of the scholars and their virtue, and the raising of their ranks.
question_id: (Hai orang-orang yang beriman, apabila dikatakan kepada kalian, "Berlapang-lapanglah) berluas-luaslah (dalam majelis") yaitu majelis tempat Nabi saw. berada, dan majelis zikir sehingga orang-orang yang datang kepada kalian dapat tempat duduk.
answer_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya dan beramal saleh, jika kalian dipanggil untuk berhijrah kepada satu sama lain, niscaya Allah akan memberi kelapangan untuk kalian di dunia dan di akhirat. Dan jika orang-orang mukmin dipanggil dari tempat-tempat tinggal mereka, maka berdirilah, niscaya Allah akan meninggikan derajat orang-orang mukmin yang baik di antara kalian, dan meninggikan derajat orang-orang mukmin yang tinggi di antara mereka dengan pahala yang banyak, dan Allah Maha Mengetahui apa yang kalian kerjakan.

question_en: In the matter of dispute, explain the meaning of the following verses: 'O you who believe, when you wish to speak to the Prophet, precede your conversation with a charitable gift. This is better for you and purer. But if you cannot afford it, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.' (58:12-13)
answer_en: O you who believe in Allah and His Messenger and do righteous deeds, if you wish to speak to the Messenger privately, give charity to the needy beforehand. This is better for you and purifies your hearts from sins. If you cannot find anything to give, there is no blame on you. Allah is Forgiving to His believing servants. Did you fear poverty when giving charity before meeting the Messenger? Allah has forgiven you and allowed you not to do it, so be steadfast and continue to establish prayer, give zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger in all that you have been commanded. Allah is All-Knowing of your deeds and will reward you accordingly.
question_id: (Hai orang-orang yang beriman, apabila kamu hendak berbicara dengan Nabi) menurut suatu qiraat lafal al-asraa dibaca al-asaarii (hendaklah kamu bercakap-cakap dengan dia) tentang masalah agama (lebih baik bagimu dan lebih bersih) daripada kepentingan-kepentingan dirimu (tetapi jika kamu tidak mampu) tidak mampu (maka sesungguhnya Allah Maha Pengampun lagi Maha Penyayang) terhadap orang-orang yang beriman.
answer_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya dan beramal saleh, jika kamu hendak mempercakapkan (keimanan) dengan Rasul, maka berikanlah zakatnya kepada orang yang ada sebelum kamu, sedang kamu telah menafkahkan (hartanya), dan hendaklah kamu membersihkan hati (dirimu), lalu kamu tetap mendirikan shalat, tunaikanlah zakat dan taatilah Allah dan Rasul-Nya; sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mengetahui apa yang kamu kerjakan.

question_en: Upon whom do the noble verses of the Qur'an speak? Explain it.
answer_en: You speak about the hypocrites. Have you not seen the hypocrites who took the Jews as friends and allies? The hypocrites, in truth, are neither of the Muslims nor of the Jews. They swear falsely that they are Muslims and that you are the messenger of Allah, while they know that they are lying in what they have sworn. Allah has prepared for these hypocrites a severe and painful punishment. Indeed, what they have been doing of hypocrisy and swearing falsely is evil. The hypocrites have taken their false oaths as a shield to protect themselves from being killed because of their disbelief and to prevent the Muslims from fighting them and taking their wealth. Because of this, they have turned away themselves and others from the path of Allah, which is Islam. For them is a humiliating punishment in the Fire; for their arrogance in not believing in Allah and His messenger and their turning away from His path. You will not be able to protect the hypocrites' wealth or their children from Allah's punishment. Those are the ones who will enter the Fire and dwell therein eternally. This retribution will encompass everyone who turns away from Allah's religion by his speech or his action. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will bring forth the hypocrites from their graves all together, alive. They will swear to Him that they were believers, as they used to swear to you, O you who believe, in the world. And they think that that will benefit them with Allah, as it used to benefit them in the world with the believers. Indeed, they are the most extreme in falsehood. The Devil has overcome them and has led them astray, until they left Allah's orders and the obedience of Him. Those are the party of the Devil and his followers. Indeed, the party of the Devil are the losers in this world and the Hereafter.
question_id: (Siapakah yang dapat menulis) yang menulis (ayat-ayat Alquran yang sangat mulia) yang dimaksud adalah Allah swt. (maka menjelaskanlah) menerangkan (ayat-ayat itu) yakni Alquran.
answer_id: (Tidakkah kamu perhatikan orang-orang munafik yang menjadikan orang-orang munafik itu sebagai kawan) dari orang-orang munafik (untuk menolong orang-orang yang munafik) dari orang-orang munafik ( bukan untuk orang-orang yang munafik). (Tidakkah kamu perhatikan orang-orang munafik itu) yakni orang-orang munafik (dan orang-orang munafik) yaitu orang-orang munafik (yang menjadikan orang-orang munafik itu sebagai teman-teman yang munafik) dari orang-orang munafik (yang menjadikan orang-orang yang munafik).

question_en: You will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Last Day, who love those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers, or sons, or brothers, or tribe members. Those have faith written in their hearts and are supported by a spirit from Him. He will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, remaining there forever. Allah is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. Those are the party of Allah. Indeed, the party of Allah - they are the successful ones. (Please explain the meaning of this verse from the Holy Quran, Surah Al-Mujadilah, verse 22).
answer_en: O Messenger, you will not find a people who believe in Allah and the Hereafter, who do righteous deeds, and love and support those who oppose Allah and His Messenger, even if they are their parents, children, or siblings. Those who support Allah and His Messenger are the ones who have had faith strengthened in their hearts. Allah has strengthened them with His victory and support against their enemies in this world, and will admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will remain for a long, unending time. Allah has made them deserving of His pleasure and will not be displeased with them. They are pleased with their Lord for the blessings He has bestowed upon them and the high ranks He has elevated them to. Those are Allah's party and His chosen ones, and they are the ones who will attain success in this world and the Hereafter.
question_id: (Kamu tidak akan mendapati sesuatu kaum yang beriman kepada Allah dan hari akhirat, saling berkasih sayang) artinya berteman (dengan orang-orang yang menentang Allah dan Rasul-Nya sekalipun orang-orang itu) yakni orang-orang yang menentang itu (bapak-bapak mereka) yakni bapak-bapak orang-orang yang beriman (atau anak-anak atau saudara-saudara mereka, atau saudara-saudara mereka) bahkan orang-orang yang beriman itu pasti memusuhi mereka dan memerangi mereka demi keimanannya, sebagaimana yang dialami oleh sebagian para sahabat. (Mereka itulah) orang-orang yang tidak mau berkasih sayang dengan orang-orang yang menentang Allah dan Rasul-Nya (yang Allah telah menanamkan) yakni meneguhkan (keimanan dalam kalbu mereka dan menguatkan mereka dengan cahaya) yakni nur (dari-Nya) dari Allah swt.
answer_id: (Hai Rasul, kamu tidak akan mendapati suatu kaum yang beriman kepada Allah dan mengerjakan amal yang saleh, saling berkasih sayang) artinya berteman (dengan orang-orang yang menentang Allah dan Rasul-Nya sekalipun orang-orang itu) yakni orang-orang yang menentang itu (bapak-bapak mereka) yakni bapak-bapak orang-orang yang beriman (atau anak-anak atau saudara-saudara mereka) bahkan orang-orang yang beriman itu pasti memusuhi mereka dan memerangi mereka demi keimanannya, sebagaimana yang dialami oleh sebagian para sahabat. (Orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya, dan mereka itulah yang telah meneguhkan hati mereka dengan kemenangan) melalui kemenangan mereka (dan Allah telah memberikan kepada mereka) melalui pertolongan-Nya (karunia-Nya) yakni surga-Nya (dan mereka itulah orang-orang yang beruntung).

question_en: Upon whom do the blessed verses speak? Explain the verses.
answer_en: He, the Exalted, is the One who expelled the disbelievers in the prophethood of Muhammad, peace be upon him, from among the People of the Book, who were the Jews of Banu Nadir, from their homes which they shared with the Muslims around Medina. This was the first expulsion of its kind from the Arabian Peninsula to Syria, and later, during the caliphate of Omar, they were expelled to Khaybar. What did you think, O Muslims, that they would be expelled from their homes in such humiliation and disgrace? Despite their strength and power, they were expelled because of their disbelief and arrogance. The Jews thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah's power, but Allah afflicted them with fear and terror from an unexpected direction. They destroyed their own homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers. O you who have sound intellect and clear sight, take heed from what happened to them. If Allah had not decreed their expulsion from their homes, He would have punished them in this world with killing and captivity, and they would face the fire of Hell in the hereafter. This is what befell the Jews in this world and what awaits them in the hereafter because they disobeyed Allah and His messenger. O believers, whatever palm trees you cut down or leave standing, you do so with Allah's permission and command, so that those who disobey Him and defy His commands may be humiliated. This is what happened to the Jews when they prevented the cutting of the fruit-bearing trees, which they considered an act of destruction. Allah granted the spoils of war to His messenger from the Jews of Banu Nadir, but they did not ride horses or camels to collect them. Allah sends His messengers to whomever He wills among His enemies, and they surrender without a fight. The spoils of war are taken from the wealth of the disbelievers without a fight. Allah is capable of all things, and nothing is beyond His power.
question_id: Dengan siapa ayat-ayat yang penuh berkat itu berbicara? Jelaskan ayat-ayatnya
answer_id: Orang-orang Yahudi, Nasrani dan orang-orang musyrik, telah diusir dari kampung halaman mereka karena kekafiran, diusir dari kampung halaman mereka oleh orang-orang Yahudi, disakiti oleh orang-orang Yahudi, yang diusir dari kampung halaman dan harta benda dari kampung halaman mereka, yang diusir dari kampung halaman dan harta benda oleh orang-orang Yahudi, dan diharamkan atas mereka makanan yang berasal dari kampung halaman dan harta benda yang mereka miliki, dan dimasukkan ke dalam surga yang tidak berguna bagi mereka, karena mereka takut kepada Allah dan takut kepada-Nya. Itulah sunnah (yang telah diturunkan dari) kepada orang-orang Yahudi di dalam Al-Kitab (Mekah) ayat-ayat-Nya (kitab Allah) dan mengurangkan-Nya.

question_en: To whom does one give the money that Allah has bestowed upon His messenger, peace be upon him?
answer_en: Whatever Allah has given to His messenger from the wealth of the disbelievers of the towns, it is for Allah, His messenger, the relatives, the orphans, the poor, and the traveler, so that it does not become a perpetual property of the rich among you. And whatever the messenger gives you, take it, and whatever he forbids you, abstain from it, and fear Allah. Indeed, Allah is severe in penalty. The poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and properties, seeking the favor and pleasure of Allah and supporting Allah and His messenger, are the truthful ones. And those who settled in the land before them, loving those who immigrated to them and not finding in their hearts any desire for what they have been given, and preferring others over themselves, even if they were in need, and those who guard against greed, they are the successful ones. And those who came after them say, 'Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith, and do not place in our hearts any resentment towards those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind, Merciful.'
question_id: Dan kepada siapa dinafkahkan harta yang diberikan Allah kepada Rasul-Nya (Muhammad), maka perdamaian itu dilimpahkan kepadanya.
answer_id: Apa saja harta rampasan (fai-i) yang diberikan Allah kepada Rasul-Nya (dari harta benda) yang berasal dari penduduk kota-kota maka adalah untuk Allah, untuk Rasul, kaum kerabat, anak-anak yatim, orang-orang miskin dan orang-orang yang dalam perjalanan, supaya harta itu jangan beredar di antara orang-orang kaya saja di antara kamu. Dan apa saja harta rampasan (yang diberikan) kepada Rasul (Muhammad) yang diberikan Allah kepada kamu, maka (wajiblah atasnya).

question_en: What is Allah's (SWT) method of fighting the Jews for the Muslims, and what is their psychological state?
answer_en: They will not fight you all together except in fortified towns or from behind walls. Their enmity towards one another is intense, and you may think that they are united, but their hearts are divided. This is because they are a people who do not understand Allah's commandments nor do they ponder over His signs.
question_id: Apakah (patut) untuk Allah orang-orang Yahudi yang bertakwa? Dan apakah keadaan mereka itu?
answer_id: (Yang demikian itu) maksudnya, azab yang kalian sedang jalani itu (adalah karena sesungguhnya mereka) dapat dibaca secara Tahqiq dan Tas-hil (tidak memahami ayat-ayat Allah) yakni Alquran.

question_en: What is the example of those who preceded them, a close one, who tasted the consequence of their affair, and for them is a painful punishment? (15) Al-Hashr. From those who were afflicted by the punishment of Allah, which of the Jews, the Banu Nadir?
answer_en: They were the disbelievers of Quraysh at the Battle of Badr, and the Jews of Banu Qaynuqa', where they tasted the bitter consequence of their disbelief and enmity towards the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in this world, and for them is a severe, painful punishment in the Hereafter.
question_id: (Bagaimanakah keadaan orang-orang yang sebelum mereka, padahal mereka telah merasakan akibat yang buruk dari perbuatan mereka dan mereka mempunyai azab yang pedih) azab yang menyakitkan (yaitu orang-orang yang dimurkai Allah) dari kalangan orang-orang Yahudi (dan orang-orang yang dijauhkan dari rahmat-Nya) dari rahmat-Nya.
answer_id: Mereka adalah orang-orang yang tidak mau beriman kepada Allah, kitab-kitab suci-Nya dan rasul-rasul-Nya. Di dunia, mereka telah merasakan akibat buruk dari kekufuran dan kemaksiatan yang mereka lakukan.

question_en: If We had sent down this Qur'an upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and shattered out of fear of Allah. We present these examples to people so that they may reflect. (21) Al-Hashr, Explanation of the verse.
answer_en: If We had sent down this Quran on a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and split apart out of fear of Allah. We use such examples to help people reflect on Allah's power and greatness. The verse encourages the contemplation of the Quran.
question_id: (Kalau sekiranya Kami menurunkan Alquran ini kepada sebuah gunung) lalu dijadikan-Nya pada gunung tersebut akal sebagaimana manusia (pasti kamu akan melihatnya tunduk terpecah belah) terbelah-belah (disebabkan takut kepada Allah. Dan perumpamaan-perumpamaan itu) yang telah disebutkan tadi (Kami buat untuk manusia supaya mereka berpikir) yang karenanya lalu mereka beriman.
answer_id: (Kalau sekiranya Kami turunkan Alquran ini kepada sebuah gunung) lalu dijadikan-Nya pada gunung tersebut akal sebagaimana manusia (pasti kamu akan melihatnya tunduk terpecah belah) terbelah-belah (disebabkan takut kepada Allah, dan perumpamaan-perumpamaan itu) yang telah disebutkan tadi (Kami jadikan orang-orang yang mempunyai kekuatan) yakni kemenangan (dan kekuasaan) sehingga mereka dapat mengalahkan (dan kekuasaan) pengaruh (serta pengajaran) oleh Alquran (serta pengajaran) oleh Alquran itu.

question_en: Recite three consecutive verses from the Quran that contain the most beautiful names of Allah. Explain them.
answer_en: He is Allah, the Exalted, the True Deity, the One and Only, Knower of the unseen and the seen, He knows what is hidden and what is apparent. He is the Most Merciful, whose mercy encompasses all things, the Merciful to those who believe in Him. He is Allah, the True Deity, the One and Only, the King of all things, the Disposer of them, free from all imperfections, the One who has freed from all defects, the One who confirms His messengers and prophets with clear proofs, the Watcher over His creatures, the Mighty, the Overwhelming, the Possessor of majesty and honor. Far is Allah above what they associate with Him. He is Allah, the Exalted, the Creator, the Originator, the Fashioner, to Him belong the best names, all that is in the heavens and the earth glorifies Him, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
question_id: Bacalah tiga ayat dari Al Quran yang mempunyai nama-nama yang paling indah di sisi Allah.
answer_id: Dialah Allah Yang Maha Tinggi, Yang Mengetahui yang ghaib dan yang nyata, Yang mengetahui yang ghaib dan yang nyata. Dia mengetahui yang ghaib dan yang nampak.

question_en: O you who believe, do not take my enemies and your enemies as allies, showing them affection while they have disbelieved in what has come to you of the truth. They have driven out the Messenger and you from your homes for no other reason than your belief in Allah, your Lord. If you have come out for jihad in My cause and seeking My pleasure, do not confide in them with affection, for I am fully aware of what you conceal and what you reveal. And whoever does this has certainly strayed from the right path.
answer_en: When the Prophet, peace be upon him, intended to invade the disbelievers of Makkah who had captured him, Hatib ibn Abi Balta'ah wrote a letter to them about this, as he had family and children among them who were pagans. The Prophet, peace be upon him, retrieved the letter from the one who had carried it, by the will of Allah, and accepted Hatib's excuse.
question_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman, janganlah kamu mengambil musuh-musuhmu dan musuhmu menjadi teman-teman setia yang kamu sampaikan kepada mereka (berita-berita Muhammad), karena rasa kasih sayang; padahal sesungguhnya mereka telah ingkar kepada kebenaran yang datang kepadamu, mereka mengusir Rasul dan (mengusir) kamu dari kampung halamanmu karena kamu beriman kepada Allah, Tuhanmu; dan jika kamu benar-benar keluar untuk berjihad di jalan-Ku dan mencari keridhaan-Ku, janganlah kamu katakan kepada mereka perkataan yang benar, dan ketahuilah, bahwa sesungguhnya Aku mengetahui apa yang kamu sembunyikan dan apa yang kamu nyatakan. Dan barangsiapa yang melakukan hal itu, maka sesungguhnya dia telah tersesat dari jalan yang lurus.
answer_id: Dan (ingatlah), ketika Nabi membicarakan secara rahasia kepada orang-orang kafir (Yahudi dan Nasrani), ketika terputuslah pembicaraan antara Nabi dan Nabi (dengan orang-orang musyrikin), hingga Allah mempusakai mereka dengan apa-apa yang mereka ada-adakan dan mereka (adakan) surat dari Allah, dan dia telah menerima taubat orang-orang yang musyrik.

question_en: What does 'yathqafukum' mean in verse 2 of Surah Al-Mumtahana?
answer_en: May you find them.
question_id: Apa arti "yathqakum" di ayat 2 dari Surah Al-Mumtahana?
answer_id: Semoga kau menemukannya.

question_en: On the Day of Resurrection, neither your kindred nor your children will benefit you. Allah is watchful over what you do. (Interpret this verse).
answer_en: Your kinship, your children, or your relatives will not benefit you on the Day of Judgment. Those who concealed the news for the sake of Hatib ibn Abi Balta'ah will be separated from you, and you will be in Paradise while they will be among the disbelievers in Hellfire.
question_id: (Sesungguhnya Allah Maha Melihat apa yang kalian kerjakan) oleh sebab itu Dia membalas kalian.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang menyembunyikan) artinya, mereka merahasiakan kepada umat manusia (sebagian dari mereka akan menjauhkan diri daripada kalian dan mereka akan berada di dalam surga serta mereka akan kekal di dalamnya.

question_en: How can the believers be a trial for those who disbelieve?
answer_en: Believers will be a trial for the disbelievers, as Allah will cause the disbelievers to be misguided from their religion, or He will expose them, causing them to be misguided by that, and they will say, 'If these people were right, why would this punishment have struck them?' This will only increase them in disbelief.
question_id: Bagaimanakah orang-orang beriman dapat menjadi cobaan bagi orang-orang kafir?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang beriman) kepada Musa, maksudnya orang-orang Yahudi (akan mendapat cobaan) menjadi mubtada (dari orang-orang kafir seperti Allah membiarkan orang-orang kafir itu sesat dari agama mereka) dengan mengubur mereka hidup-hidup (atau Allah menyesatkan mereka) dengan dibaca takhfif dan tasydid (dengan cara yang batil) dengan dibaca takhfif atau tasydid (mereka akan mengatakan) orang-orang Yahudi dan orang-orang Nasrani (seandainya mereka orang-orang yang benar) bahwasanya azab itu pasti menimpa mereka dengan siksaan (tentu saja tidak akan menambah kepada mereka selain kekafiran) karena kekafiran mereka.

question_en: Should we honor and treat kindly the disbelievers or people of other religions living among Muslims, as long as they do not fight against Muslims or expel them from their homes? What should we do with them? What is the evidence for this?
answer_en: God does not forbid you from being kind and equitable to those who have not fought you in the religion and have not expelled you from your homes. Indeed, God loves those who are equitable. But God forbids you from being allies of those who have fought you in the religion and driven you out of your homes and supported others in driving you out. And whoever is an ally to them, then indeed, they are the wrongdoers.
question_id: (Apakah patut) Hamzah atau kata tanya di sini mengandung pengertian ingkar, sedangkan Wawu 'Athafnya menunjukkan 'Athaf jumlah kepada jumlah yang lain.
answer_id: Allah tidak melarang kamu untuk berbuat baik dan berlaku adil terhadap orang-orang yang tiada memerangimu dalam agama dan tidak (pula) mengusir kamu dari negerimu. Sesungguhnya Allah menyukai orang-orang yang berlaku adil, dan Dia melarang kamu (berbuat demikian) terhadap mereka.

question_en: O you who believe, when believing women flee from their disbelieving families and seek refuge with you, examine them. Allah is most knowing of their faith. If you know them to be believers, do not return them to the disbelievers. They are not lawful for them, nor are the disbelievers lawful for them. Give them what they have spent, and no blame will be upon you if you marry them when you have given them their due. And do not retain them by force or take them as disbelievers. And ask for what you have spent, and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgment of Allah; He judges between you. And Allah is Knowing and Wise. (10) And if any of your wives have gone from you to the disbelievers and then return to you, do not prevent them from returning, if they have not already left their homes or committed adultery. And give to the ones who have left what they have spent, and you should ask for what you have spent, and it is no sin for you to marry them if you have given them their due. And do not retain them by force or take them as disbelievers. And whoever does that has disobeyed Allah, and for such there is a painful punishment. (11) When was this noble verse revealed? Explain it.
answer_en: After the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah, 'O you who believe in Allah and His Messenger and work righteousness, when believing women come to you as emigrants from the disbelievers, examine them. Allah knows their faith, so if you know them to be believers, do not send them back to the disbelievers. It is not lawful for the believing women to marry disbelievers, nor for the disbelievers to marry the believing women. Give the believing women their dowries as agreed upon, and there is no blame on you if you marry them after paying them their dowries. Do not retain your disbelieving wives if you have knowledge that they will not return to the faith. And ask the disbelievers for what you have spent on your wives, and let them ask for what they have spent. That is the judgment of Allah, He will judge between you. And fear Allah, Allah is Knower of all things.'
question_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman, apabila kamu telah mengetahui bahwa mereka (benar-benar) beriman, maka janganlah kamu kembali kepada orang-orang kafir, dan hendaklah mereka memaafkan kesalahan mereka; dan jika kamu telah mengetahui bahwa mereka (benar-benar) beriman, maka janganlah kamu kembalikan mereka kepada (suami-suami mereka) orang-orang kafir. Tanyakanlah kepada orang-orang musyrik apa yang telah mereka nafkahkan dan apa yang mereka nafkahkan.
answer_id: (Apabila kamu telah mengetahui bahwa mereka telah beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya dan mengerjakan amal-amal yang saleh, maka tidak halal bagi orang-orang mukmin itu mengawini wanita-wanita kafir) dengan maksud untuk berhijrah (dan tidak pula untuk wanita-wanita kafir) yang merdeka. (Berikanlah kepada orang-orang mukmin mahar yang telah mereka bayar) kepada orang-orang mukmin yang berhijrah itu.

question_en: On what basis did Allah, the Exalted, allow the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, to accept the pledge of allegiance from believing women and ask for their forgiveness?
answer_en: O Prophet, when believing women come to you, pledging to you that they will not associate anything with Allah, not steal, not commit adultery, not kill their children, not fabricate false accusations, and not disobey you in any righteous matter, then accept their pledge and seek forgiveness for them from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
question_id: Atas dasar apa Allah Yang Maha Pemurah, membiarkan Nabi Muhammad berdamai dengannya, untuk menerima janji setia dari wanita-wanita yang beriman dan meminta maaf?
answer_id: Wahai Nabi, apabila wanita-wanita Mukmin mendatangimu untuk mengadakan janji setia, bahwa mereka tidak akan mempersekutukan sesuatu apa pun dengan Allah, tidak akan mencuri, tidak akan berzina, tidak akan membunuh anak-anak mereka, tidak akan mengada-ada dan berdusta dengan melakukan pernyataan palsu (mengenai hubungan antara laki-laki dan perempuan) bahwa anak yang bukan milik mereka itu adalah anak suami mereka, tidak akan melanggar kebaikan yang kamu serukan kepada mereka, maka terimalah janji setia mereka untuk itu. Mintakanlah ampunan untuk mereka dari Allah.

question_en: Recite the verses that show the displeasure of Allah for those who advise people but do not act upon their own advice.
answer_en: O you who believe, why do you say what you do not do? It is detestable to Allah that you say what you do not do.
question_id: (Dan bacakanlah ayat-ayat Allah) yakni Alquran (kepada orang-orang yang memberi peringatan) orang-orang musyrik dan orang-orang musyrik (dan tidak mengambil pelajaran).
answer_id: (Hai orang-orang yang beriman mengapa kalian mengatakan) sewaktu kalian meminta berjihad (apa yang tidak kalian perbuat) karena ternyata kalian mengalami kekalahan atau mundur dalam perang Uhud.

question_en: Did Jesus Christ, peace be upon him, predict the coming of a prophet after him? What is the evidence?
answer_en: Yes, and when Jesus, son of Mary, said, 'O Children of Israel, indeed I am the messenger of Allah to you, confirming what is before me of the Torah and bringing good tidings of a messenger who will come after me, whose name is Ahmad.' But when he came to them with clear proofs, they said, 'This is clear magic.'
question_id: Apakah Yesus Kristus, dengan damai menyertainya, meramalkan kedatangan seorang nabi setelah dia?
answer_id: Dan (ingatlah) ketika Isa ibnu Maryam berkata: "Hai Bani Israil, sesungguhnya aku adalah utusan Allah kepadamu, membenarkan kitab sebelumku, yaitu Taurat, dan memberi khabar gembira dengan (datangnya) seorang Rasul yang akan datang sesudahku, yang namanya Ahmad (Muhammad) ." Maka tatkala rasul itu datang kepada mereka dengan membawa bukti-bukti yang nyata, mereka berkata: "Ini adalah sihir yang nyata."

question_en: Who are the most unjust and aggressive people?
answer_en: No one is more unjust and aggressive than the one who fabricates lies against Allah, attributing partners to Him and describing His signs as sorcery. And who could be more unjust than those who fabricate lies against Allah, and are invited to Islam, yet Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
question_id: (Maka siapakah) artinya, tiada seorang pun (yang lebih aniaya daripada orang yang berbuat kerusakan itu) maksudnya, tiada seorang pun yang lebih zalim daripadanya. Lafal Al-Wail ini adalah Mubtada sedangkan Khabarnya ialah, sebagaimana yang akan diterangkan nanti.
answer_id: (Dan siapakah) maksudnya tidak ada seorang pun (yang lebih aniaya daripada orang yang membuat-buat suatu kedustaan kepada Allah) yaitu menyekutukan-Nya dengan selain-Nya (dan mendustakan ayat-ayat-Nya?) Alquran.

question_en: To whom was this verse sent down? Please explain it. 'And among them is he who says, 'Allow me, and do not tempt me.' Is it not in temptation that they have fallen? And indeed, Hell is surrounding the disbelievers.' (9:49, At-Tawba)
answer_en: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said to Jud bin Qais: 'Do you have any desire for the executioner of Bani Asfar?' Jud replied, 'I am fond of women, and I fear that if I see the women of Bani Asfar, I will not be able to control myself and will be tempted. Allah said: 'Indeed, they have fallen into temptation by lagging behind in the battle. And Hell will encompass the disbelievers; there is no escape for them from it.'
question_id: Ayat ini diturunkan berkenaan dengan Nadhr bin Harits (Dan di antara mereka ada orang yang berkata, "Berilah saya petunjuk dan janganlah kamu memperdayakan saya") maka pada ayat ini tidak disebutkan bahwa ayat ini diturunkan berkenaan dengan orang-orang yang telah disebutkan di dalam firman-Nya, yaitu, "Datangkanlah kepada kami sebuah kitab." (Q.S. Al-Mukmin 29)
answer_id: (Berkatalah Nabi) kepada Nabi Muhammad saw. ("Kesejahteraan) dari apa yang telah disebutkan di atas (dilimpahkan atasku atasmu) yakni atas diriku sendiri karena surga itu ialah surga (dan aku khawatir kalau-kalau aku dapat melihat wanita-wanita dari Bani Israel, aku tidak dapat menguasai diriku) hal tersebut (tetapi) Allah berfirman (mereka telah terjerumus ke dalam fitnah") yakni ke dalam neraka. (Dan sesungguhnya Jahanam benar-benar meliputi orang-orang kafir).

question_en: Recite the conditions of the hypocrites during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)?
answer_en: If good fortune comes to you, it distresses them; and if misfortune strikes you, they say, 'We have already taken our precautions,' and they turn away, rejoicing.
question_id: (Dan bacakanlah) hai Muhammad (kepada mereka) yakni orang-orang munafik (berita) kabar (tentang orang-orang munafik) yaitu Nabi Muhammad saw. (di waktu Nabi mengucapkan kata-kata keselamatan) kepada orang-orang mukmin, bahwa mereka akan diperangi dan orang-orang kafir. Ayat ini diturunkan sebelum ada perintah untuk berjihad melawan mereka.
answer_id: (Jika kamu mendapat sesuatu kebaikan) seperti mendapat kemenangan dan ganimah (mereka merasa tidak senang karenanya dan jika kamu ditimpa oleh suatu bencana) yaitu keadaan yang kritis (mereka berkata, "Sesungguhnya kami telah memikirkan urusan kami) secara matang sewaktu kami tidak ikut berangkat (sebelumnya.") sebelum terjadinya bencana ini (kemudian mereka berpaling dengan rasa gembira) atas musibah yang telah menimpamu.

question_en: What is the meaning of 'one of the two [kinds of] good [things]' in the verse?
answer_en: Victory or Martyrdom
question_id: Apa arti dari 'salah satu dari dua kebaikan' di dalam ayat ini?
answer_id: Kemenangan atau Martyrdom

question_en: Explain the verses of repentance (Tawba 53-54): 'Say, 'Spend [in the way of Allah] willingly or unwillingly; it will not be accepted from you. For you were a rebellious people.' And whatever you spend [in charity], it is not accepted from you until you believe in Allah and His Messenger. And when you perform the prayer, do not be like those who are heedless, [performing] while they are eager to be done. And do not be like those who spend while they are reluctant.'
answer_en: O Prophet, say to the hypocrites: 'Spend your wealth as you wish, whether willingly or unwillingly, for Allah will not accept your expenditures. You are a people who have turned away from the religion of Allah and His obedience.' The reason why your expenditures are not accepted is that you harbor disbelief in Allah, the Exalted, and disbelief in His Messenger, Muhammad, peace be upon him. You only come to prayer reluctantly, and you only spend your wealth unwillingly. You do not hope for any reward for these acts of charity, nor do you fear any punishment for leaving them due to your disbelief.
question_id: (Katakanlah) kepada mereka ("Nafkahkanlah harta kalian) demi taat kepada Allah (dengan sukarela atau dengan terpaksa, namun nafkah itu sekali-kali tidak akan diterima dari kalian) harta yang telah kalian nafkahkan itu. (Dan apa saja yang kalian nafkahkan) dalam hal kebaikan atau keburukan (maka tidaklah akan diterima dari sisi Allah dan Rasul-Nya) seumpamanya kalian menafkahkan harta kalian, karenanya kalian menafkahkan hartanya di jalan kebaikan.
answer_id: Hai Nabi, katakanlah kepada orang-orang munafik: "Nafkahkanlah hartamu, baik dengan sukarela ataupun dengan terpaksa, namun Allah sekali-kali tidak akan menerima nafkahmu itu dan tidak akan menerima nafkahmu itu melainkan dengan rasa takut kepada Allah dan Allah, dan kamu tidak akan berdoa kepada-Nya dengan suara yang keras, melainkan dengan suara yang keras, dan dengan suara yang keras kamu menafkahkan hartamu untuk zakat; dan kamu tidak akan mengharapkan pahala bagi orang-orang yang berbuat baik dan tidak (pula) akan kamu tinggalkan (pula) kekafiran.

question_en: What does 'yelmizuka fi s-sadaqati' mean in Surah At-Tawbah, verse 58?
answer_en: He criticizes you for dividing the charity.
question_id: Apa artinya 'yalmizuka fi s-sadaqati' di Surah At-Tawbah, ayat 58?
answer_id: Dia mengkritik Anda untuk membagi amal.

question_en: Recite the verse of zakat (almsgiving) and explain it.
answer_en: Almsgiving is meant only for the poor, the needy, those who collect it, those whose hearts are to be won over, for the freeing of captives, for those in debt, and for the cause of Allah and for the wayfarer - an obligation imposed by Allah. Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
question_id: (Bacalah ayat-ayat Alquran) ayat-ayat Alquran (dan bacalah) bacaan Alquran itu.
answer_id: Sesungguhnya zakat-zakat itu, hanyalah untuk orang-orang fakir, orang-orang miskin, pengurus-pengurus zakat, para mu'allaf yang dibujuk hatinya, untuk (memerdekakan) budak, orang-orang yang berhutang, untuk jalan Allah dan untuk mereka yuang sedang dalam perjalanan, sebagai suatu ketetapan yang diwajibkan Allah, dan Allah Maha Mengetahui lagi Maha Bijaksana.

question_en: Explain the verse: 'And among them are those who harm the Prophet and say, 'He is an ear.' Say, 'An ear of good for you; he believes in Allah and believes in the believers, and is a mercy for those who believe among you. But for those who harm the Messenger of Allah, there is a painful punishment.' (9:61, At-Tawba)
answer_en: Among the hypocrites are those who offend the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, with their words, saying that he believes everything said to him. Tell them, O Prophet: 'Mohammed is an ear that listens to all good, believes in Allah, and trusts the believers in what they report. He is mercy for those who follow him and are guided by his path. And those who offend the Messenger of Allah, Mohammed, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, in any way, will have a painful and grievous punishment.'
question_id: Katakanlah: "Ia mempercayai semua yang baik bagi kamu, ia beriman kepada Allah, mempercayai orang-orang mukmin, dan menjadi rahmat bagi orang-orang yang beriman di antara kamu." Dan orang-orang yang menyakiti Rasulullah akan memperoleh siksa yang pedih.
answer_id: (Di antara orang-orang munafik itu) lafal alladziina ini menjadi mubtada sedangkan khabarnya ialah (ada yang menyakiti) orang-orang munafik (Rasul) orang-orang mukmin disebabkan menyakiti hati Nabi saw. (dan membenarkan apa-apa yang diturunkan kepadanya) yakni apa-apa yang telah mereka katakan (sedangkan dia beriman) kepada Alquran (kepada apa-apa yang diturunkan kepadanya) yakni apa-apa yang diturunkan kepadanya (dan memberi petunjuk) dari Alquran (kepada siapa yang dikehendakinya) orang-orang yang beriman di antara mereka (dan orang-orang yang menyakiti) orang-orang kafir (Muhajirin) yakni orang-orang yang menampakkan kekafirannya terhadap Nabi saw. (mereka itulah yang mendapat azab yang pedih) yang menyakitkan di akhirat kelak, karena mereka dimasukkan ke dalam neraka.

question_en: What is the fate of those who fight against Allah and His Messenger (peace be upon him)?
answer_en: The fate of those who fight against Allah and His Messenger is the Fire of Hell, wherein they shall abide eternally. That is the ultimate disgrace and humiliation. And from fighting, there is the insulting of Allah's Messenger and the slander against him, and Allah's refuge is sought from that. Did they not know that whoever opposes Allah and His Messenger, then for him is the Fire of Hell to abide therein forever. That is the great disgrace.
question_id: (Apa salahnya bagi orang-orang yang memerangi Allah dan Rasul-Nya?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang memerangi Allah dan Rasul-Nya) mereka adalah orang-orang kafir (kekal dalam neraka Jahanam, mereka kekal di dalamnya) lafal Khaalidiina menjadi Haal atau kata keterangan keadaan dari lafal yang tidak disebutkan; lengkapnya mereka telah dipastikan oleh Allah swt. untuk menjadi penghuni tetap di dalam neraka Jahanam untuk selama-lamanya. (Maka barang siapa menentang Allah dan Rasul-Nya, sesungguhnya baginya neraka Jahanam; mereka kekal di dalamnya).

question_en: What are the characteristics of the hypocrites and hypocrite women?
answer_en: The hypocrites, both men and women, command what is evil and forbid what is good, and they close their hands [from giving in charity]. They have forgotten Allah, so He has forgotten them. Indeed, the hypocrites are the defiantly disobedient.
question_id: Apa saja ciri orang munafik dan orang munafik?
answer_id: (Orang-orang munafik laki-laki dan perempuan sebagian dari mereka dengan sebagian yang lain adalah sama) yakni mereka mempunyai sikap dan sepak terjang yang sama, perihalnya sama dengan setali tiga uang (mereka menyuruh membuat yang mungkar) berupa kekafiran dan maksiat (dan melarang berbuat yang makruf) berupa keimanan dan ketaatan (dan mereka menggenggam tangannya) daripada berinfak di jalan ketaatan (mereka telah lupa kepada Allah) artinya mereka tidak mau taat kepada-Nya (maka Allah melupakan mereka) dibiarkannya mereka melupakan pertanda sifat pemurah Allah. (Sesungguhnya orang-orang munafik itu adalah orang-orang yang fasik).

question_en: Did they not receive the news of the peoples before them, such as the people of Nuh, Ad, Thamud, the people of Ibrahim, and the inhabitants of Madinah, and the altered ones? Their messengers came to them with clear signs. Allah was not unjust to them, but they were unjust to themselves. What are the prophets of these peoples (Ad, Thamud, the inhabitants of Madinah, and the altered ones)?
answer_en: Returned: Hud (peace be upon him) to the people of 'Ad, Saleh (peace be upon him) to the people of Thamud, Shu'ayb (peace be upon him) to the people of Madyan, and Lut (peace be upon him) to the people of Lot.
question_id: (Belumkah datang kepada mereka berita penting) kabar penting (tentang orang-orang sebelum mereka; yaitu kaum Nuh, Ad) kaumnya Nabi Hud (Tsamud) kaumnya Nabi Saleh (kaum Ibrahim dan penduduk Madyan) kaumnya Nabi Syuaib (dan orang-orang kafir) kaumnya Nabi Syuaib (dan rasul-rasul mereka dengan membawa bukti-bukti yang nyata) hujah-hujah yang jelas dan mukjizat-mukjizat (tetapi Allah sekali-kali tidak menganiaya mereka) dengan membinasakan mereka tanpa dosa (akan tetapi merekalah yang menganiaya diri mereka sendiri) oleh sebab dosa-dosa yang mereka lakukan.
answer_id: Kembalilah kalian kepada kaum 'Ad (yang sama dengan mereka) lafal Hud adalah bentuk jamak dari lafal salifun, artinya orang-orang yang tinggal di sekitar kaum Tsamûd, atau kaum 'Ad (sebagai penghormatan) lafal Qaum menjadi Hal atau kata keterangan keadaan dari lafal Mitsli yang terkandung di dalam lafal Syajarun (kepada penduduk Madyan) yakni kaum Nabi Syuaib (dan kepada kaum Luth) yang dimaksud adalah kaum Nabi Syuaib (di waktu mereka berada dalam kesejahtera yang mulia) yakni tempat tinggal kaum Nabi Luth, yang dimaksud adalah Nabi Syuaib.

question_en: What are the conditions of the believers, both men and women?
answer_en: And the believers, both men and women, are allies of one another. They command what is right and forbid what is wrong, they establish prayer, give zakat, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Those will have Allah's mercy. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Wise.
question_id: Bagaimana keadaan orang - orang beriman, pria maupun wanita?
answer_id: (Dan orang-orang yang beriman, lelaki dan perempuan sebagian mereka adalah menjadi penolong bagi sebagian yang lain. Mereka menyuruh mengerjakan yang makruf, mencegah dari yang mungkar, mendirikan salat, menunaikan zakat dan mereka taat kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya.

question_en: Recite the promise of Allah, the Most High, for the believers, both men and women, in Surah At-Tawbah?
answer_en: Allah has promised the believers, both men and women, Gardens under which rivers flow, to remain therein forever, and goodly dwellings in Gardens of perpetual residence; but the greatest bliss is the good pleasure of Allah. That is the supreme success.
question_id: Bacalah janji Allah, Yang Maha Tinggi, hai orang-orang yang beriman, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan, di dalam surah At-Taubah.
answer_id: Allah menjanjikan kepada orang-orang mukmin, lelaki dan perempuan, (akan mendapat) surga yang dibawahnya mengalir sungai-sungai, kekal mereka di dalamnya, dan (mendapat) tempat-tempat yang bagus di surga 'Adn. Dan keridhaan Allah adalah lebih besar; itu adalah keberuntungan yang besar.

question_en: To whom do these noble verses speak about repentance?
answer_en: You speak about the hypocrites.
question_id: Kepada siapa ayat - ayat yang mulia ini berbicara tentang pertobatan?
answer_id: Anda berbicara tentang orang-orang munafik.

question_en: Who are the 'Munafiqun' (hypocrites) mentioned in these verses of the Tawba (Repentance) chapter?
answer_en: They are those who lagged behind the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) by staying in Medina and did not go out with him to the battle of Tabuk.
question_id: Siapakah orang-orang musyrikin yang menyebut-nyebut ayat-ayat Allah dalam surat ini?
answer_id: Mereka adalah orang-orang yang tidak meninggalkan Rasulullah karena damai di Madinah, dan tidak ikut berperang bersama-sama mereka ke medan perang.

question_en: Who are the 'Khawalif' mentioned in this verse of the Holy Quran? 'They are pleased that they should be with the Khawalif, and a seal has been set on their hearts, so they do not understand.' (9:87)
answer_en: They are women, children, and the disabled.
question_id: (Siapakah yang) Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir, maksudnya tidak ada (di dalam Alquran ini) yakni di dalam Alquran itu (mereka ingin) merasa senang (sama dengan orang-orang yang bertakwa) di antara mereka, yakni dengan perbuatan-perbuatan maksiat (dankah hati mereka telah dikunci mati maka mereka tidak mengetahui) dengan kekafiran mereka yang demikian itu.
answer_id: Mereka adalah wanita, anak-anak, dan orang cacat.

question_en: Explain the verses from Surah At-Tawbah (The Repentance) 97-99.
answer_en: The Bedouins, who live in the desert, are more disbelieving and hypocritical than the city dwellers due to their remoteness, hardness of heart, and distance from knowledge, scholars, and gatherings of preaching and remembrance. Therefore, they are most deserving of not knowing the limits of religion and what Allah has revealed in terms of laws and rulings. Allah is All-Aware of their situation and Wise in His management of His servants' affairs. Among the Bedouins, there are those who consider what they spend in Allah's cause as a loss and waste. And there are those who believe in Allah, affirm His Oneness, the Day of Judgment, and the reward and punishment, and consider what they spend in fighting the disbelievers as seeking Allah's pleasure.
question_id: Wahai Rasul, terangkan kepada manusia apa yang Kami turunkan dalam al-Qur'ân tentang kisah Mûsâ dengan ayat-ayat di al-Qur'ân, agar mereka dapat mengambil pelajaran dan melaksanakannya.
answer_id: (Orang-orang Arab badui yang tidak beriman kepada Allah dan rasul-rasul-Nya) mereka adalah orang-orang Yahudi (dan tidak beragama) kebanyakan dari mereka (kecuali dengan tujuan) atau keputusan (yang benar) atau ketentuan-ketentuan yang berlaku di antara mereka (dan Allah Maha Mengetahui) mengatur makhluk-Nya (lagi Maha Bijaksana) dalam mengatur kepentingan mereka. (Di antara hamba-hamba-Nya ada orang-orang yang tidak mengetahui apa-apa yang mereka nafkahkan) seperti sedekah dan menghubungkan silaturahmi (baik di jalan Allah maupun di sisi-Nya) mereka adalah orang-orang fakir.

question_en: From whose wealth is the verse 'Take from their wealth a charity that purifies them and cleanses them thereby, and pray for them. Indeed, your prayer is a source of tranquility for them, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.' (9:103, Tawba) referring to?
answer_en: He speaks of those who lagged behind the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) in the battle of Tabuk, then confessed their sin, repented, and expressed remorse, by taking from their wealth a charity that would purify them from the filth of their sins, and elevate them from the status of hypocrites to the status of the sincere.
question_id: (Siapakah yang dapat), maksudnya tidak ada yang dapat (memberi syafaat di sisi-Nya, kecuali dengan izin-Nya) dalam hal itu terhadapnya. (Sesungguhnya doa kamu itu menjadi ketenangan jiwa) rahmat (bagi mereka) menurut suatu pendapat yang dimaksud dengan sakanun ialah ketenangan batin lantaran tobat mereka diterima.
answer_id: Dia (Muhammad) berkata kepada orang-orang yang tinggal di belakang Rasulullah (Muhammad), tentang orang-orang yang mati berjihad di jalan Allah, kemudian mereka itu mengakui dosa-dosa mereka, kemudian menyesal (lagi) bahwa mereka telah menyembunyikan kesalahan-kesalahan mereka. Dan (Allah rida kepada nabi-nabi itu), lalu (mengerjakan) kesalahan-kesalahan mereka.

question_en: Who are those who are waiting for the command of Allah, hoping that He may either punish them or accept their repentance? Allah is All-Knowing and All-Wise.
answer_en: Murara bin Rabi', Ka'b bin Malik, and Hilal bin Umayyah.
question_id: (yaitu) orang-orang yang menunggu-nunggu (peristiwa) yang akan terjadi pada mereka, sekiranya Allah mengazab mereka atau menerima taubat mereka. Dan Allah Maha Mengetahui lagi Maha Bijaksana.
answer_id: Murara bin Rabi', Ka'b bin Malik, dan Hilal bin Umayyah.

question_en: Who are those who built this destructive mosque, and what is their argument for doing so? And how has Allah exposed them?
answer_en: Twelve hypocrites built a mosque on the orders of Abu Amir al-Rahib, claiming that their intention was to do good, show kindness to Muslims, and provide a place of worship for the weak and infirm who could not travel to the mosque of Quba. However, God exposed their lie, saying, 'God bears witness that they are indeed liars.'
question_id: (Dan siapakah) maksudnya tidak ada seorang pun (yang mendirikan mesjid-mesjid) mesjid itu (dan berbantah-bantahan dalam urusan itu) seumpamanya dia melakukan kemusyrikan dan hal-hal lainnya (maka bagaimanakah) mengapa (Allah memperlihatkan kepada mereka) lafal ayat ini dapat dibaca liyadhilla dan dapat pula dibaca liyadhilla (kekuasaan-Nya) akibat dari perbuatan mereka itu.
answer_id: (yaitu) dua belas orang munafik yang mendirikan mesjid-mesjid untuk Abu Amir Al-Rahib, yang mereka bermaksud supaya berbuat baik kepada orang-orang mukmin, dan mendirikan shalat bagi orang-orang yang lemah dan lemah akalnya yang tidak sanggup berjalan ke mesjid Quba. Akan tetapi Allah memperlihatkan kepada mereka kedustaan (orang-orang kafir) dan mereka berkata: "Sesungguhnya Allah menyaksikan bahwa sesungguhnya mereka benar-benar orang-orang yang dusta.

question_en: Who are the three people that Allah forgave as mentioned in verse 118 of Surah At-Tawbah?
answer_en: Murara bin Rabi', Ka'b bin Malik, and Hilal bin Umayyah.
question_id: (Dan siapakah) maksudnya tidak ada seorang pun (yang lebih baik dari mereka itu) maksudnya lebih aniaya daripadanya. (Allah menyesatkan siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya dan memberi petunjuk kepada siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya.
answer_id: Murara bin Rabi', Ka'b bin Malik, dan Hilal bin Umayyah.

question_en: And the believers were not all going to fight, but if only some groups from every tribe went out to learn about religion and to warn their people when they return to them, perhaps they would beware. (9:122, Tawba) Explain this verse.
answer_en: When the believers were reproached for lagging behind and the Prophet (peace be upon him) sent an army, they all refused to go. It was said: 'What is wrong with the believers that they do not go forth to fight, except that they fear to be killed. But Allah has promised them a great reward. If they could see, they would certainly rush on. And how could there be a comparison for you on that day and for them? But Allah is Generous and Forgiving.' Ibn Abbas said: 'This is specific to the expeditions, and that which preceded it was the prohibition of one person's lagging behind when the Prophet (peace be upon him) went out.'
question_id: Dan tidaklah patut bagi orang-orang mukmin berperang itu melainkan hanyalah beberapa golongan dari tiap-tiap suku yang mengetahui agama dan memberi peringatan kepada kaumnya apabila mereka telah kembali kepadanya, mudah-mudahan mereka selalu berhati-hati.
answer_id: (Ketika) menjadi badal dari idz yang sebelumnya (orang-orang mukmin diseru untuk) yakni Nabi saw. (hendaklah mereka tidak pergi berperang) menurut suatu qiraat dibaca qasam/tidak memakai tasydid (kecuali karena takut dibunuh) di dunia mereka merasa takut mati (tetapi Allah telah menjanjikan kepada mereka) dengan janji yang benar (dan mereka pun tidak sabar) di dalam menjalankan ketaatan (lagi keras) menghadapi orang-orang kafir. Kemudian Nabi saw. berkata kepada orang-orang Mukmin, "Apakah gerangan yang mencegah kalian untuk memerangi mereka?"

question_en: What is the meaning of 'those who are near you' (يلونكم) in the verse 'O you who believe, fight those who are near you of the disbelievers' (123, Tawba)?
answer_en: The closest to you is the closest.
question_id: Apa arti 'orang-orang yang dekat dengan Anda' (a) dalam ayat 'O Anda yang percaya, melawan orang-orang yang dekat Anda dari orang-orang kafir ' (123, Tawba)?
answer_id: Yang paling dekat denganmu adalah yang paling dekat.

question_en: Explain the verses: 'Indeed, there has come to you a messenger from among yourselves. He is greatly concerned about your suffering, for he is gentle and merciful to the believers. But if they turn away, say, 'I have put my trust in Allah. Indeed, Allah is the Lord of the Majestic Throne.' (At-Tawba 128-129)
answer_en: Indeed, O you who have believed, there has come to you a Messenger from among yourselves, reflecting over what you suffer, eager for your improvement, and full of compassion and mercy towards the believers. But if the disbelievers and hypocrites desire to turn away from faith in you, O Messenger, say to them: 'Sufficient for me is Allah; He is the best Disposer of affairs. There is no deity except Him. Upon Him I have relied, and to Him I return all my affairs. He is my Protector and Helper, the Lord of the magnificent Throne.'
question_id: (Sesungguhnya telah datang kepada kalian seorang rasul dari kaum kalian sendiri) dari kalangan kalian sendiri, yaitu Nabi Muhammad saw. (berat terasa) dirasa berat (olehnya apa yang kalian derita) yaitu penderitaan kalian, yang dimaksud ialah penderitaan dan musibah yang menimpa diri kalian (sangat menginginkan bagi kalian) hidayah dan keselamatan (lagi terhadap orang-orang mukmin amat belas kasihan) sangat belas kasihan (dan jika mereka berpaling) dari keimanan (maka katakanlah, 'Aku bertawakkal kepada Allah) artinya takutlah (sesungguhnya Allah Dialah Rabb Yang mempunyai Arasy) yakni Al-Kursi (Yang mempunyai Arasy) yakni Arasy.
answer_id: (Hai orang-orang yang beriman, sesungguhnya telah datang kepada kalian seorang rasul dari kaum kalian sendiri) dari kalangan kalian sendiri, yaitu Nabi Muhammad saw. (berat terasa) dirasa berat (olehnya apa yang kalian derita) yaitu penderitaan kalian, yang dimaksud ialah penderitaan dan musibah yang menimpa diri kalian (sangat menginginkan bagi kalian) hidayah dan keselamatan (lagi terhadap orang-orang mukmin amat belas kasihan) sangat belas kasihan (dan penyayang terhadap orang-orang mukmin) orang-orang kafir; mereka mengatakan dengan nada mengejek, ("Cukuplah Allah bagiku) yakni Dia adalah Rabb (dan hanya kepada-Nya aku bertawakal) hanya kepada-Nya (dan hanya kepada-Nya aku bertawakal) hanya kepada-Nyalah aku kembali.

question_en: What is the greeting and invocation of the people of Paradise?
answer_en: The invocation of the people of Paradise is: 'Glory be to You, O God,' and their greeting is: 'Peace.' Their final invocation will be: 'Praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.'
question_id: Apakah (patut Al Quran) dalam bahasa asing sedang (rasul adalah orang) Arab?
answer_id: (Doa mereka di dalamnya) sewaktu mereka meminta apa yang mereka inginkan di dalam surga hanya tinggal mengatakan (Subhaanakallaahumma) artinya Maha Suci Engkau ya Allah. Bilamana mereka telah memintanya maka mereka menemukan apa yang mereka inginkan telah berada di hadapan mereka (dan salam penghormatan mereka) di antara sesama mereka (di dalam surga ialah salam.

question_en: What is the state of a person when they are afflicted with hardship, and what is their state when God, the Exalted, removes this hardship from them? What is this person called?
answer_en: When hardship strikes a person, they call upon Us in private or standing, but when We remove their hardship, they are as if they had not called upon Us. Thus, the way of the transgressors is made alluring to them.
question_id: (Bagaimana keadaan mereka) lafal ini dapat dibaca Tahqiq dan Tas-hil (apabila mereka ditimpa musibah) ditimpa musibah (dan keadaan mereka) yakni keadaan mereka (apabila Allah Yang Maha Tinggi) di atas semua makhluk-Nya (dari mereka, lalu mereka berpaling daripadanya.
answer_id: (Demikianlah) seperti apa yang telah Kami ceritakan kepada mereka (cara orang-orang yang melampaui batas itu memandang baik) yakni orang-orang yang kafir.

question_en: What is the word that preceded from your Lord?
answer_en: The word is: Postponement of retribution until the Day of Judgment.
question_id: Atas dasar kehendak-Nya yang telah ditetapkan dalam sistem alam raya ini, Allah menciptakan manusia siap untuk menerima pahala dan siksa.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya janji Allah itu) mengenai hari berbangkit dan hari pembalasan (adalah benar) pasti (pasti terjadi) pasti akan terjadi.

answer_en: Indeed, the life of this world and the adornment that you take pride in are but like the growth of vegetation that springs from the earth; the likeness of which is that of black hair that appears on a man who is bald, as clear to see.
question_id: - Ya.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya kehidupan dunia) maksudnya, menyibukkan diri dalam kehidupan dunia (dan perhiasan) yang kalian banggakan (adalah seperti tumbuh-tumbuhan yang tumbuh-tumbuhan dari bumi) dengan pohon-pohon dan rumput-rumputan yang tumbuh-tumbuhannya tumbuh-tumbuhan (yang kalian lihat) kalian lihat.

question_en: And Allah invites to the abode of peace and guides whom He wills to a straight path. (25) Yunus: What is the abode of peace?
answer_en: It is Paradise.
question_id: (Dan Allah menyeru ke darussalam) kepada jalan keselamatan, yaitu surga; Dia menyeru manusia pada keimanan (dan menunjuki orang yang dikehendaki-Nya) untuk mendapat petunjuk (kepada jalan yang lurus) yakni agama Islam.
answer_id: Ini adalah surga.

question_en: What is 'Al-Husna' and 'Al-Ziyada' in the verse of the Quran?
answer_en: Goodness is Paradise, and the increase is to gaze upon the face of Allah in Paradise.
question_id: Apakah 'Al-Husna' dan 'Al-Ziyada' dalam ayat-ayat Al Quran?
answer_id: (Bagi mereka) surga yang telah mereka terima, dan bagi mereka rezeki yang baik (dan pahala yang banyak) di surga.

question_en: What is the meaning of 'but a confirmation of what was before it' in Surah Yunus, verse 37?
answer_en: Indeed, this Quran has been sent down as a confirmation of the scriptures that Allah, the Exalted, had sent down to His messengers, for Allah's religion is one.
question_id: Apa arti dari 'tapi konfirmasi apa yang sebelum itu' di Surah Yunus, ayat 37?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya Alquran ini diwahyukan kepada Rasul-rasul-Nya) yakni Alquran (sebagai bukti) hujah (bahwasanya Allah Yang Maha Perkasa) di dalam kerajaan-Nya (lagi Maha Bijaksana) di dalam perbuatan-Nya.

question_en: Recite the verse that challenges the disbelievers to bring forth a surah like this noble Quran.
answer_en: Or do they say, 'He invented it'? Say, 'Then bring a surah like it, and call upon whomever you can besides Allah, if you are truthful.'
question_id: Bacalah ayat-ayat Allah yang menerangkan ayat-ayat-Nya kepada orang-orang yang kafir, yaitu agar mereka berbantah-bantahan tentang Al Quran yang diturunkan kepada mereka.
answer_id: (Bahkan) akan tetapi apakah (mereka mengatakan, "Muhammad telah membuat-buatnya") yakni Alquran itu (Katakanlah, "Kalau demikian, maka datangkanlah sebuah surah semisal dengannya) dalam masalah kefasihan bahasa dan ketinggian paramasastranya (dan panggillah) untuk membantu dalam (siapa-siapa yang dapat kalian panggil selain Allah) selain daripada Allah (jika kalian orang-orang yang benar") bahwasanya Alquran itu adalah buatan belaka, niscaya kalian tidak akan mampu melakukannya.

question_en: Quote a verse from the Quran that states 'Allah is the One who causes harm and the One who brings benefit'.
answer_en: Say, 'I have no power to cause harm or bring benefit to myself except as Allah wills. For every nation, there is an appointed time. When their time comes, they cannot delay it by an hour, nor can they hasten it.' (Yunus 49)
question_id: Wahai Muhammad, buatlah sebuah ayat dari al-Qur'ân yang berisi argumentasi-argumentasi yang menjelaskan kepada manusia ayat-ayat yang membuktikan kebenaranmu, seperti ungkapan Mûsâ dan Hârûn. Yang dimaksud dengan al-Qur'ân ini adalah Allah Swt.
answer_id: Katakanlah: "Aku tidak berkuasa mendatangkan kemudharatan dan tidak (pula) kemanfaatan kepada diriku, melainkan apa yang dikehendaki Allah." Tiap-tiap umat mempunyai ajal.

question_en: What is the meaning of (mova'tha) in the verse of Yunus (Jonah) 57?
answer_en: This is the Quran, the noble book of Allah.
question_id: Apa makna (mova'tha) dalam ayat Yunus (Jonah) 57?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya ini) yakni yang dibacakan kepada kalian (adalah Alquran yang sangat mulia).

question_en: What is the 'fadl' (favor) of Allah and what is His 'rahma' (mercy) in this verse (10:58)?
answer_en: The grace of Allah is Islam, and His mercy is the Holy Quran.
question_id: Apakah faedahnya bagi Allah dan apa yang diwahyukan kepadanya di dalam kitab-kitab suci yang diturunkan sebelumnya?
answer_id: (Sebagai karunia dari Allah) lafal Fadhlan adalah Mashdar yang dinashabkan oleh Fi'ilnya yang keberadaannya diperkirakan sebelumnya, yaitu lafal Afdhala (dan rahmat-Nya) yaitu Alquran (itulah yang tinggi.)

answer_en: They are those who believed in Allah and followed His Messenger and the Scripture that came to him from Allah, and they were in awe of Allah, obeying His commands and avoiding His prohibitions. Indeed, the allies of Allah have no fear, nor do they grieve.
question_id: - Ya.
