answer_id: (Tidak ada dosa bagi kalian memasuki rumah yang tidak disediakan untuk didiami, yang di dalamnya ada keperluan) maksudnya, ada manfaat (bagi kalian) misalnya dijadikannya sebagai tempat tinggal sementara atau untuk keperluan yang lainnya, seperti rumah-rumah asrama dan lain sebagainya (dan Allah mengetahui apa yang kalian nyatakan) yakni semua apa yang kalian lahirkan (dan apa yang kalian sembunyikan) artinya yang kalian rahasiakan sewaktu kalian masuk ke dalam rumah yang bukan rumah kalian, termasuk maksud baik atau maksud-maksud lainnya. Pada pembahasan yang akan datang akan diceritakan, bahwa mereka para sahabat, jika mereka memasuki rumah mereka sendiri, mereka mengucapkan salam kepada diri mereka sendiri.

question_en: Recite and explain the verses that lower the gaze for believing men and women. Say to the believing men that they should lower their gaze and protect their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is aware of what they do. And say to the believing women that they should lower their gaze and protect their private parts and not display their adornment except what ordinarily appears. And they should draw their veils over their bosoms and not display their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, or their male slaves having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And they should not strike their feet to draw attention to their hidden adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you may succeed.
answer_en: O Prophet, tell the believers to lower their gaze and protect their private parts from what Allah has forbidden, except for their spouses. This is purer for them. Allah is well-aware of what they do. And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and protect their private parts, and not to display their adornments except what ordinarily appears. They should draw their veils over their bosoms and not display their adornments except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, their male servants, or those male attendants having no sexual desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not strike their feet so as to draw attention to their hidden adornments. O you believers, return to Allah in repentance, all together, so that you may succeed.
question_id: (Katakanlah kepada orang laki-laki yang beriman, "Hendaklah mereka menahan pandangannya) dari apa-apa yang tidak dihalalkan bagi mereka melihatnya.
answer_id: Hai Nabi, katakanlah kepada orang-orang mukmin: "Hendaklah mereka menahan pandangannya, dan kemaluannya, kecuali yang (terdapat) nampak dari padanya.

question_en: What is the meaning of: (Al-Ayamā) and (Imā'ikumul) in the verse 32 of Sura An-Nur?
answer_en: The Aiyamah are those who are unmarried among free men and women. Your Imams are your wives.
question_id: Apa artinya: (Al-Ayamā) dan (Imā'ikumul) di ayat 32 dari Sura An-Nur?
answer_id: (Mereka itu) yaitu kaum laki-laki yang baik dan kaum wanita yang baik, antara lain ialah Siti Aisyah dan Sofwan (adalah orang-orang yang tidak bersuami) tanpa suami (dari laki-laki dan wanita, dan istri-istri kalian adalah) lafal A'jamiina ini menjadi Hal atau kata keterangan keadaan dari lafal yang sebelumnya (kalian) lafal ayat ini menjadi Mubtada (istri-istri kalian yang perempuan.

question_en: Explain the meaning of the verse: 'And let those who cannot find a way to marry remain chaste until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a scripture for that which is binding on them, then We have sent it down to you, O Muhammad, so that you may explain to them what they differ about. And if you know of any good in them, then give them their due from the wealth that Allah has given you. And do not force your slave women to prostitution if they desire chastity to seek the life of this world. And if anyone forces them, then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.' (Quran 4:33)
answer_en: And those who are unable to marry due to poverty or other reasons should ask for chastity from what Allah has forbidden, so that Allah may enrich them from His bounty and make it easy for them to get married. And those who wish to free their slaves and maidservants by paying a sum of money to their masters, their masters should write them a deed of emancipation if they find them to be of sound mind, capable of earning a living, and righteous in their religion. And they should give them something from the money or reduce their dues. It is not permissible for you to force your slave girls into prostitution for the sake of money, when they desire chastity and you prevent them. This is indeed a great sin. And whoever forces them, Allah will be forgiving and merciful to them after they have been forced, and the sin will be upon the one who forced them.
question_id: (Dan janganlah kamu paksa budak-budak wanitamu) yaitu hamba sahaya wanita (untuk melakukan pelacuran) berbuat zina (sedangkan mereka sendiri mengingini kesucian) memelihara kehormatannya dari perbuatan zina (karena kamu hendak mencari) atau sumber (keuntungan duniawi) ayat ini diturunkan berkenaan dengan Abdullah bin Ubay, karena dia memaksakan hamba-hamba sahaya perempuannya untuk berhijrah ke negeri Syam. (Dan jika kamu mengetahui ada kebaikan pada mereka, maka bayarlah mereka) maksudnya harta-harta mereka (dengan apa yang telah diberikan Allah kepadamu) berupa zakat dan lain-lainnya (dan janganlah kamu paksa budak-budak wanitamu untuk melakukan pelacuran) memakannya.
answer_id: Dan orang-orang yang tidak mampu kawin hendaklah meminta mahar yang telah diharamkan Allah kepada mereka, dan hendaklah (memperkenankan) harta itu kepada budak-budak yang mereka miliki, dan hendaklah mereka membayar fidyah kepada budak-budak yang mereka miliki, dan hendaklah mereka membayar jizyah kepada budak-budak yang mereka miliki, jika mereka menginginkannya menurut yang patut, dan jika mereka ingini (kebajikan) harta mereka, maka hendaklah mereka membayar fidyah. Dan barangsiapa yang ingin (kafir) dari isteri-isteri mereka atau budak-budak yang mereka miliki, maka hendaklah mereka (yang memaafkan) untuk mengawini mereka.

question_en: Explain the meaning of the verse: 'Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearl-like star lit from a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, its oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.'
answer_en: God is the light of the heavens and the earth. He arranges their affairs and guides their people. He is the light, and His light is a guide. By His light, the heavens and the earth are illuminated, and so is the Qur'an and His guidance. Without His light, darkness would accumulate. His light is like a guiding beacon, and faith and the Qur'an in a believer's heart are like a niche, a glass, a lamp within it, giving light from all sides. The lamp is fed with oil from a blessed tree, the olive tree, which is neither eastern nor western, but in a middle land. Its oil is so pure that it seems to glow by itself before the fire touches it. When the fire does touch it, it gives off a brilliant light, one light from the oil and another from the fire. This is like the guidance that illuminates the heart of a believer. God guides and helps whomever He wills to follow the Qur'an, and He uses parables to help people understand. He is all-knowing, and nothing is hidden from Him.
question_id: (Perumpamaan cahaya Allah) sifat cahaya Allah di dalam kalbu orang Mukmin (adalah seperti misykat yang di dalamnya ada pelita besar. Pelita itu di dalam kaca) yang dapat dijadikan sebagai cahaya (kaca itu seakan-akan) cahaya itu (bintang yang bercahaya seperti mutiara) kalau dibaca Diriyyun atau Duriyyun atau Duriyyun (yang dinyalakan) kalau dibaca Jazm berarti berasal dari kata Ad Dar'u yang artinya dinyalakan dengan minyak yang sangat panas (yang dinyalakan) kalau dibaca Jala berarti berasal dari kata Ad Dar'u yang artinya dinyalakan dengan minyak zaitun.
answer_id: (Allah menerangi langit dan bumi dengan cahaya-Nya) dengan cahayanya (dan dengan cahaya-Nya) dengan cahaya itu Dia menjadikan kesemuanya itu sebagai cahaya (yang menerangi) menjadikannya sebagai pelita yang menerangi (langit dan bumi, dan dengan cahaya-Nya Dia memberi petunjuk kepada siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya) untuk mendapat petunjuk (dan cahaya) untuk membedakan antara yang benar dan yang salah (serta cahaya) untuk menjelaskan kepada jalan petunjuk (yang terang) dari Alquran (dan mereka tidak mengetahui) yakni orang-orang yang ingkar kepada Alquran dan orang-orang mukmin (kecuali) melainkan mereka tidak mengetahui (bahwa ia) Alquran itu (adalah cahaya) artinya cahaya yang diturunkan (yang terang) yang diturunkan dari sisi Allah, maka mengapa Alquran itu diturunkan dari sisi Allah supaya mereka mendapat petunjuk? question_en: What is the meaning of the light in the verses of the Quran?
answer_en: Those who disbelieve in their Lord and deny His messengers, their deeds which they thought would benefit them in the Hereafter are like a mirage, which seems to be water, but when one reaches it, he finds it not. The disbeliever thinks that his deeds will benefit him, but on the Day of Judgment, he will not find any reward for them. Allah, the Exalted, will be there to recompense him fully for his deeds. Allah is swift in reckoning, so the ignorant should not delay this promise, for it will surely come. Or their deeds may be like darkness in the depths of the sea, above which waves upon waves rise, and above them thick clouds, darkness upon darkness, so that when a man stretches out his hand, he cannot see it for the thickness of the darkness. Such are the disbelievers, upon whom darkness of disbelief and misguidance, and corruption of deeds have accumulated. And whoever Allah does not give light from His Book and the Sunnah of His Prophet, he has no guide.
question_id: (Apakah) huruf Maa di sini bermakna Istifham yakni kata tanya, maksudnya, apakah (yang dimaksud) Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir atau menetapkan (adalah ayat-ayat Alquran) yakni bagian daripada Alquran (?)
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang kafir kepada Rabbnya dan kepada rasul-rasul-Nya, mereka mengira) mereka menduga (akan mendapat manfaat dari perbuatannya di akhirat) karena mereka menyekutukan-Nya dengan selain-Nya (dan mereka menyangka) mereka menduga bahwa hal itu adalah bentuk takhfif daripada anna (akan berguna bagi mereka pekerjaan mereka di dunia) sebagai imbalan dari apa yang telah mereka kerjakan di akhirat kelak. (Maka apabila dia telah sampai ke lembah) tempat tinggal mereka di dalam neraka (niscaya mereka tidak akan mendapat manfaat kecuali) mereka tidak akan dapat menyelamatkan orang-orang yang telah beriman kepadanya (Allah melupakan) dari azab-Nya (apa yang telah mereka kerjakan) dengan dibaca yudhillu dan tasydid; artinya Allah memberikan balasan kepada orang-orang yang dikehendaki-Nya berupa pahala (dan memberi petunjuk kepada orang-orang yang kafir) kepada orang-orang yang kafir (dalam kesesatan) karena kekafiran mereka berpaling dari keimanannya (dan tidak beriman kepada cahaya) kepada dirinya sendiri.

question_en: Mention some signs of Allah's power in the universe and in His creatures.
answer_en: Have you not seen that Allah, the Exalted, drives the clouds to wherever He wills, then gathers them after scattering them, then makes them accumulate, so that rain comes down from between them. And He brings down from the clouds, which are like mountains in their grandeur, hail, striking with it whomever He wills among His servants and turning it away from whomever He wills, according to His wisdom and decree. The flash of that lightning in the clouds is so intense that it nearly blinds the eyes of those who watch it. And among the signs of Allah's power is that He alternates night and day, one coming after the other, differing in length and duration. Indeed, in that is a sign for those who have insight. And Allah, the Exalted, created every moving creature on the earth from water. From these creatures are those that crawl on their bellies like snakes and the like, those that walk on two legs like humans, and those that walk on four legs like animals and the like. Allah, the Exalted, creates whatever He wills, and He is capable of all things.
question_id: Dan ceritakanlah (hai Muhammad kepada mereka), kisah Allah di antara tanda-tanda kekuasaan-Nya di muka bumi dan di dalam hamba-hamba-Nya.
answer_id: (Apakah kamu tiada melihat) tiada mengetahui (bahwasanya Allah Yang Maha Tinggi) yakni Allah swt. (mengembangkan awan) menggiringnya (ke mana saja Dia kehendaki).

question_en: What is the condition set by Allah for those who believe to be succeeded and strengthened on earth, as was done for those before them?
answer_en: God has promised victory to those who believe among you and do righteous deeds, that He will grant them inheritance of the lands of the disbelievers and make them successors therein, as He did for their predecessors from the believers. He will also establish their religion, which He has chosen for them - Islam - as a religion of honor and might, and will change their state from fear to security, provided that they: worship none but God, remain steadfast in His obedience, and associate nothing with Him. And whoever rejects this succession and security, and denies the favors of God after that, they are the ones who disobey God.
question_id: Bagaimanakah keadaan orang-orang yang beriman dan mengadakan kerusakan di muka bumi dan mengadakan perbaikan? Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang sebelum mereka benar-benar beriman, akan memperoleh kemenangan atas orang-orang kafir.
answer_id: (Allah menjanjikan kepada orang-orang yang beriman dan mengerjakan amal yang saleh) suatu janji yang baik (bahwa Dia akan menempatkan mereka di negeri-negeri orang-orang kafir) yakni di negeri tempat tinggal mereka (di muka bumi) di negeri Syam (dan menjadikan mereka berkuasa) memberikan pertolongan kepada orang-orang kafir (di muka bumi) atas orang-orang kafir (sebagaimana Dia telah berjanji) yaitu Allah telah menjanjikan kepada mereka (atas orang-orang mukmin) melalui lisan Nabi saw. sebagaimana yang telah disebutkan dalam surah Al-Anfal Al-An'am (dan) sebagaimana Dia telah menjanjikan kepada orang-orang mukmin (siapa yang lebih dahulu beriman) di antara orang-orang mukmin (dan mengadakan perbaikan) terhadap amal perbuatan mereka (maka barang siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya di antara mereka, niscaya dia akan termasuk orang-orang yang lalim) yakni orang-orang yang kafir.

question_en: What are the daily leave-taking times in homes? And why?
answer_en: There are three times when privacy is emphasized and modesty is required: before dawn prayer, during the siesta in the afternoon, and after night prayer. At these times, seek permission before entering upon your believing men, women, or those in your households who have not yet reached puberty. This is to be done in three specified times of the day: before dawn prayer, when you remove your clothes at noon, and after night prayer. Allah wants ease for you, not hardship, and He wants to cleanse you and complete His favor upon you, so that you may be grateful.
question_id: Apa yang harian cuti kali di rumah?
answer_id: (Dan) hal itu dilakukan-Nya (di waktu kalian berada di petang hari) di kala kalian memasuki petang hari; di dalam waktu ini terdapat dua salat, yaitu di waktu salat subuh (dan di waktu kalian berada di waktu subuh) sewaktu kalian memasuki waktu salat subuh; yang dimaksud adalah salat Zuhur.

question_en: What is the ruling on children asking for permission to enter homes?
answer_en: Children should always ask for permission before entering, except when they reach the age of puberty and are accountable for Islamic rulings, in which case they should ask for permission like adults.
question_id: Apa keputusan tentang anak - anak yang meminta izin untuk memasuki rumah?
answer_id: Anak-anak hendaknya selalu meminta izin sebelum masuk Islam. Tetapi, apabila mereka telah sampai umur balig, maka hendaklah mereka meminta izin dalam urusan harta.

question_en: What is the ruling regarding elderly women and their clothing?
answer_en: And the elderly women who have given up on enjoying and desiring sexual relations due to their age, neither do they hope to marry men, nor do men hope to marry them. It is not blameworthy for these women to wear some of their clothes, like a cloak that covers their clothes without displaying or showing off, as this is a covering and a protection for them. And Allah is All-Hearing and All-Knowing.
question_id: Apa keputusan tentang wanita lanjut usia dan pakaian mereka?
answer_id: (Dan perempuan-perempuan tua yang telah terhenti) dari haid dan dari mempunyai anak disebabkan telah lanjut umurnya (yang tiada ingin kawin lagi) bagi yang demikian itu (tiadalah atas mereka dosa menanggalkan pakaian mereka) yakni jilbab mereka, atau selendang mereka, atau penutup yang ada di atas kerudung mereka (dengan tidak bermaksud menampakkan) yakni menonjolkan (perhiasan) -nya yang tersembunyi seperti kalung, gelang tangan dan gelang kaki (dan berlaku terhormat) tidak melepaskannya (adalah lebih baik bagi mereka. Dan Allah Maha Mendengar) perkataan kalian (lagi Maha Mengetahui) apa yang tersimpan di dalam kalbu kalian.

question_en: If the believers gather for a great cause that benefits everyone, is it permissible for one of them to leave this gathering without permission from the one in charge, if an urgent matter arises? Please mention the verse that supports this.
answer_en: Indeed, the believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and do not leave him when they are with him in a matter concerning which they should consult one another, and whoever leaves without seeking permission is indeed a wrongdoer. Those who seek your permission, O Prophet, - they are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, so if they ask your permission for some affair of theirs, grant permission to whomever you will among them, and seek forgiveness for them from Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.
question_id: Ayat ini diturunkan ketika orang-orang Yahudi berkata kepada Nabi saw., "Jika kamu benar-benar seorang nabi, pergilah kamu ke negeri Syam karena negeri itu adalah negeri para nabi."
answer_id: Sesungguhnya orang-orang Mukmin yang sebenarnya adalah orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya, dan apabila mereka berada bersama-sama Rasulullah dalam sesuatu urusan yang memerlukan pertemuan, mereka tidak meninggalkan (Rasulullah) sebelum meminta izin kepadanya. Mereka itulah orang-orang yang meminta izin kepadamu, maka berilah izin kepada siapa yang kamu kehendaki di antara mereka, dan mohonkanlah ampunan untuk mereka kepada Allah.

question_en: Do not make the invocation of the Prophet (pbuh) among you like the invocation of one another. Indeed, Allah is All-Aware of those who sneak around among you, spreading mischief. So, let those who oppose his command beware lest they be afflicted by a trial or struck by a painful punishment. (63) Al-Nur (The Light), Surah 24, Ayah 63. Please explain the meaning of this verse.
answer_en: Do not say, O believers, when calling out to the Messenger of Allah, 'O Muhammad' or 'O Muhammad, son of Abdullah', as some of you say to each other. Instead, honor him and say, 'O Prophet of Allah, O Messenger of Allah.' Allah knows the hypocrites who secretly leave the gathering of the Prophet (peace be upon him) without his permission, huddling together. Let those who disobey the command of the Messenger beware, lest they face a severe trial or painful, grievous punishment in the hereafter.
question_id: (Sesungguhnya Allah mengetahui orang-orang yang diam-diam pergi di antara kalian dengan sembunyi-sembunyi) mereka keluar dari mesjid pada waktu Nabi mengucapkan khutbahnya tanpa terlebih dahulu meminta izin kepadanya, secara diam-diam sambil menyembunyikan diri di balik sesuatu. Huruf Qad di sini menunjukkan makna Tahqiq yang artinya sesungguhnya (maka hendaklah orang-orang yang menyalahi perintah-Nya merasa takut) menyalahi perintah Allah dan Rasul-Nya (akan ditimpa cobaan) malapetaka (atau ditimpa azab yang pedih) di akhirat kelak.
answer_id: (Janganlah kamu katakan) hai Muhammad (kepada orang-orang mukmin, "Hai Rasulullah! Sesungguhnya Allah mengetahui orang-orang munafik yang diam saja) yakni orang-orang kafir Mekah (di antara kamu) yakni orang-orang Yahudi (tanpa izin) atau kehendak (dan suruhlah orang lain bertakwa) kepada Allah dengan mengerjakan taat dan meninggalkan maksiat (sesungguhnya orang-orang yang menyalahi perintah Rasul) mereka (akan ditimpa cobaan) berupa malapetaka (atau ditimpa azab yang pedih di akhirat) yaitu azab yang menyakitkan di dunia dan di akhirat nanti.

question_en: What is the meaning of 'al-'alamin' in the verse: 'Blessed is He who sent down the criterion [al-Furqan] upon His servant that he may be a warner to the worlds.' (Quran 25:1)
answer_en: Man and Jinn
question_id: (Maha Suci) Allah swt. (yang telah menurunkan Alfurqan) yakni Alquran, ia dinamakan Alfurqan karena kandungannya membedakan antara perkara yang hak dan perkara yang batil (kepada hamba-Nya) yakni Nabi Muhammad (agar dia menyampaikannya kepada seluruh alam) yaitu kepada bangsa manusia dan bangsa jin, selain bangsa malaikat (sebagai pemberi peringatan) kepada mereka, dengan memperingatkan mereka akan azab Allah.
answer_id: Manusia dan jin.

question_en: What did the disbelievers say about the Quran and Muhammad (peace be upon him)?
answer_en: The disbelievers said about the Quran: 'This is nothing but a lie and falsehood that Muhammad invented, and others helped him in that. They have indeed done a great injustice and have been obvious liars. The Quran is not something that a human could invent.' They said about the Quran: 'It is the stories of the ancients, written in their books, which Muhammad has copied, and it is recited to him in the morning and evening.' Say, O Messenger, to those disbelievers: 'That which has revealed the Quran is Allah, who encompasses all knowledge of the heavens and the earth. He was indeed Ever-Forgiving for those who repent from sins and wrongdoings, and Most Merciful to them, though He did not delay them in punishment.' The pagans said: 'Why has not this one who claims to be the Messenger of Allah (meaning Muhammad, peace be upon him) been sent with an angel to witness his truthfulness, or a treasure from the sky, or a great garden from which he could eat its fruits?' These wrongdoers said: 'You, O believers, only follow a man whom magic has overcome his mind.' Look, O Messenger, how the liars have spoken about you with these strange words that resemble parables in their absurdity; they strive to disprove you. But by doing so, they are far from the truth, and they will not find a way to it, so that they may correct what they have said against you in lies and slander.
question_id: Tentang al-Qur'ân, mereka juga mengatakan, "Sesungguhnya al-Qur'ân itu adalah wahyu dari Allah yang diturunkan kepada Muhammad saw." Katakan kepada mereka, wahai Muhammad, "Tuhan telah menjanjikan keselamatan kepada kami dan memberikan keselamatan kepada kami.
answer_id: Orang-orang kafir melontarkan tuduhan terhadap al-Qur'ân dengan mengatakan, "Sesungguhnya al-Qur'ân itu adalah suatu kebohongan yang dibuat-buat oleh Muhammad dan diatasnamakan Allah. Untuk mewujudkan itu, Muhammad telah dibantu oleh kelompok lain yang terdiri atas Ahl al-Kitâb."

question_en: On the Day of Judgment, will the fire of Hell be seen by the disbelievers and deniers of Muhammad (peace be upon him), and will they feel its heat, causing them to boil with anger? What will their feeling be?
answer_en: When they see the Fire, the liars will call out to be thrown into it to escape from it. They will hear it raging and roaring from a distance. And when they are thrown into a narrow part of Hell, bound together, they will call out to be killed to escape from it. But they will be told, 'Do not call for death repeatedly; it will only increase your punishment; there is no escape for you.'
question_id: (Dan diperlihatkan dengan jelas neraka Jahim) yakni ditampakkan (kepada orang-orang kafir) kekafiran (dan dirasakan pula oleh orang-orang yang kafir) mereka dihinakan oleh karenanya mereka dimasukkan ke dalamnya (dan akan ditimpakan atas mereka nyala apinya) yaitu nyala apinya yang sangat panas (dan nyala apinya) yakni nyala api yang sangat panas itu (apa lagi yang mereka kerjakan).
answer_id: Apabila mereka melihat neraka, dan neraka itu memanggil orang-orang yang zalim untuk lari dari padanya, dan mereka mendengar kegeramannya, dan (ketika) mereka masuk ke dalamnya, dan (dikatakan kepada mereka): "Janganlah kamu memekik minta tolong, melainkan harapkanlah siksaanmu. Sesungguhnya kamu tidak dapat melepaskan diri (dari azab) ."

question_en: And on the Day when He will gather them, and that which they worship besides Allah, He will say, 'Did you mislead My servants or did they stray from the path?' They will say, 'Glory be to You! It was not befitting for us to take anything besides You as allies. But You provided them and their fathers with ease until they forgot the reminder and became a lost people.' He said, 'You have indeed denied My signs, and you were not able to prevent them or help yourselves. And whoever commits injustice among you, We will certainly make him taste a great punishment.' (Al-Furqan 25:17-19). Explain these verses.
answer_en: On the Day of Judgment, Allah will gather the polytheists and whatever they worshipped besides Him, and He will say to those worshipped beings: 'Did you mislead these servants of Mine from the right path, and did you command them to worship you, or did they go astray and worship you of their own accord?' The worshipped beings besides Allah will say: 'Far be it from You - our Lord - that we should do such a thing. We cannot take anyone but You as our allies or as allies to be worshipped.' But these polytheists and their forefathers enjoyed worldly wealth and prosperity through them, until they forgot Your remembrance and associated others with You. They were a people who perished, overcome by misfortune and loss. It will be said to the polytheists: 'Those whom you worshipped have indeed misled you in their claims. Now you are the ones who cannot avert the punishment from yourselves, nor can you receive any help.' Whoever associates anything with Allah has indeed wronged himself, and whoever dies in that state will face a severe punishment from Allah.
question_id: Dan (ingatlah) akan hari (yang di waktu itu) Allah menghimpun mereka beserta apa yang mereka sembah selain Allah, lalu Allah berkata (kepada yang disembah); "Apakah kamu yang menyesatkan hamba-hamba-Ku itu, ataukah mereka yang sesat dari jalan (yang benar)?" Mereka menjawab: "Maha Suci Engkau, tidaklah patut menjadi sekutu bagi kami dan tidak (pula) menimpakan sesuatu kemudharatan kepada kami, akan tetapi Engkau memberi mereka dan bapak-bapak mereka rezeki sampai mereka lupa kepada kami"; mereka berkata: "Sesungguhnya kamu telah mendustakan ayat-ayat-Ku dan kamu tidak dapat melepaskan diri (dari azab itu) ."
answer_id: Dan (ingatlah) akan hari (yang ketika itu) Allah mengumpulkan orang-orang musyrik dan apa yang mereka sembah selain Allah, dan Allah akan berkata kepada orang-orang yang menyembah sembah selain Allah: "Apakah kamu yang menyesatkan hamba-hamba-Ku itu dari jalan-Ku dan kamu jadikan berhala-berhala itu sekutu-sekutu bagi Allah?." Dan orang-orang yang mempersekutukan (sesuatu) dengan Tuhan mereka berkata: "Kami tidak menyembah selain Allah dan tidak mempersekutukan sesuatupun dengan (Allah) ."

question_en: What is the meaning of 'And We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you be patient?' (25:20, Al-Furqan)
answer_en: We have made some of you a trial for others, O people, through guidance and misguidance, wealth and poverty, health and sickness. Will you be patient and do what Allah has commanded you, and be grateful to Him? Then your Lord will reward you. Or will you not be patient and deserve punishment?
question_id: (Dan apakah patut) Hamzah atau kata tanya di sini mengandung pengertian ingkar, sedangkan Wawu 'Athafnya menunjukkan 'Athaf jumlah kepada jumlah yang lain.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya Kami telah menguji kamu) Kami telah menguji kamu (sebagian kamu dengan petunjuk) dari kesesatan (dan kebajikan) maksudnya dengan petunjuk itu (serta penyakit) lemah-lembutan dan lain-lainnya (apakah kamu bersabar) bersabar di dalam menghadapi cobaan itu (dan bersyukur) atas nikmat-nikmat-Nya (dan bersyukur) atas nikmat-Nya (Rabbmu akan memberikan pahala kepadamu) di akhirat kelak (ataukah kamu tidak bersabar) di dalam menghadapi gangguan-gangguan yang kamu lakukan terhadap dirimu. Istifham atau kata tanya mengandung makna Taqrir, makna Taqrir, yakni tidak ada halangan bagi kamu untuk melakukan hal tersebut dan tidak pula melampaui batas.

question_en: And those who do not hope for Our meeting say, 'Why are not the angels sent down to us, or we see our Lord?' They have become arrogant within themselves and have committed great insolence. On the Day when they see the angels, there will be no good tidings for the criminals that Day. And they will say, 'A barrier (hijr) is thrown away.' And We will certainly come to their deeds, then We will render them scattered dust.
answer_en: Those who do not believe in meeting their Lord after death, due to their denial of Him, say: 'Would that angels were sent down to us, to inform us that Muhammad is truthful, or that we see our Lord face to face, to inform us of His truthfulness in His message.' They have become arrogant and proud, transgressing in their tyranny and disbelief. On the day when they see the angels at the time of death, and in the grave, and on the Day of Resurrection, in a form that they did not expect, not to give them good tidings of Paradise, but to say to them: 'Allah has made Paradise forbidden for you.' And We have certainly come to their deeds, whatever morsels of good they did, and made them futile. It will not benefit them at all, like scattered dust that is seen in the sunlight; for indeed, deeds will not benefit in the Hereafter unless they are accompanied by faith in Allah, sincerity to Him, and following His messenger, Muhammad, peace be upon him.
question_id: (Berkatalah orang-orang yang tidak menanti-nanti pertemuannya dengan Kami,) yakni orang-orang yang tidak takut kepada adanya hari berbangkit dan hari pembalasan ("Mengapakah tidak) (diturunkan kepada kita malaikat) yang menjadi Rasul-rasul kepada kita (atau kita melihat Rabb kita?") kemudian dikatakan kepada mereka, ("Sesungguhnya mereka telah menyombongkan diri) yaitu orang-orang yang kafir (dalam kesombongannya) yaitu sombong tidak mau beriman kepada adanya hari berbangkit (dan mereka telah menyombongkan diri) tidak mau beriman (terhadap malaikat-malaikat) disebabkan mereka tidak mau beriman kepada rasul-rasul mereka (dan mereka mengatakan, "Berhala-berhala itu tidak lain) yakni berhala-berhala yang kalian sembah (adalah pelindung) yang kalian sembah (yang akan Kami datangkan kepada mereka.")
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang kafir kepada Rabb mereka) disebabkan mereka ingkar kepada Nabi Muhammad saw. (mereka mengatakan, "Mengapa tidak) (diturunkan kepada kami malaikat) yakni malaikat (tatkala mereka melihat Malaikat) yaitu malaikat Jibril (tatkala mereka melihat malaikat-malaikat) yakni malaikat-malaikat Jibril (di waktu mereka berada dalam kubur) sewaktu mereka melihat malaikat-malaikat itu dalam tiupan sangkakala malaikat Jibril untuk membinasakan kami (dan di hari kiamat mereka tidak mengharapkan) mereka tidak takut kepada azab Allah (bahwa mereka akan dapat memberi kabar gembira dengan surga) artinya, mereka tidak takut kepada azab-Nya (kecuali) melainkan (dengan izin-Nya) dengan kehendak-Nya (dan karena sesungguhnya telah nyata bagi mereka apa yang telah mereka perbuat) berupa kekafiran (dalam kitab-kitab Allah, lalu mereka tidak beriman melainkan) mereka benar-benar beriman karena mereka benar-benar beriman.

question_en: What is the sign of the descent of the angels to surround the creatures on the Day of Judgment?
answer_en: The sign of the descent of the angels is that the heavens will split open, and white, thin clouds will appear from its openings. And on the day when the heavens will be split open with clouds, and the angels will descend in a descent: The Quran 25:25
question_id: Dan apakah patut Al Quran itu menjadi pelajaran bagi para malaikat di hari kiamat?
answer_id: (Dan pada hari ketika langit pecah) yaitu semua langit (mengeluarkan kabut) seraya mengeluarkan kabut yang berwarna putih (dan diturunkan Malaikat) dari setiap lapisan langit (bergelombang-gelombang) pada hari kiamat itu. Dinashabkannya lafal Yauma karena pada sebelumnya diperkirakan ada lafal Udzkur.

question_en: Those who disbelieved said, 'Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?' Thus, we may strengthen your heart with it. But we have sent it down to you in stages. (25:32) The Torah, the Gospel, and the Psalms were revealed all at once, but the Qur'an was revealed piecemeal. What is the wisdom behind this?
answer_en: Allah has revealed the Quran in parts, to strengthen your heart and increase your reassurance, so remember it and bear it, and We have made it clear in explanation and reminder.
question_id: Berkatalah orang-orang yang kafir: "Mengapa Al Quran itu tidak diturunkan kepadanya sekali turun saja?"; demikianlah supaya Kami perkuat hatimu dengannya dan Kami turunkan kepadamu Al Quran itu secara berangsur-angsur, sedang Al Quran itu Injil dan Al Quran itu tidak lain hanyalah wahyu yang diwahyukan (kepadanya).
answer_id: Allah menurunkan al-Qur'ân secara berangsur-angsur agar hatimu menjadi teguh karena dapat menghafalnya. Maka ingatlah, wahai orang-orang yang beriman, bahwa al-Qur'ân itu telah Kami turunkan dengan jelas, agar kamu dapat mengambil pelajaran dan melaksanakannya.

question_en: And indeed they came to the city which was showered with the worst rain. Did they not see it? Or were they not expecting a resurrection? (Al-Quran 25:40) What is the name of this city?
answer_en: The town of Lot's people, which is the town of Sodom, was destroyed by stones from the sky.
question_id: (Dan sesungguhnya mereka telah melalui) yakni orang-orang kafir Mekah itu sering melewati (sebuah negeri yang dihujani dengan hujan yang sejelek-jeleknya) lafal As Sau' adalah bentuk Mashdar dari lafal Saa-a. Maksudnya mereka telah dihujani dengan batu-batu; negeri tempat tinggal mereka adalah suatu kota yang paling besar bagi kaum Nabi Luth, kemudian Allah membinasakan mereka sebab mereka gemar melakukan perbuatan yang keji.
answer_id: Kota Lot, kota Sodom, dihancurkan oleh batu - batu dari langit.

question_en: Have you not considered your Lord's way of stretching the shadow, and if He had so willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun a guide to it. Then We folded it up gradually. What are the signs of Allah in the shadow?
answer_en: Did Allah not cause the shadow to spread from sunrise to sunset? And if He had willed, He could have made it permanent and unchanging, not to be removed by the sun. Then He made the sun a sign by which to gauge His own states. Then the shadow gradually diminished, so that as the sun rose higher, the shadow decreased. This is among the signs of Allah's power and greatness, and that He alone is worthy of worship, unique and unlike any other.
question_id: (Apakah kamu tidak memperhatikan) yakni tidak melihat (kepada) ciptaan (Rabbmu, bagaimana Dia memanjangkan bayang-bayang) mulai dari tenggelamnya matahari sampai dengan hendak terbitnya (dan kalau Dia menghendaki) yakni Rabbmu (niscaya Dia menjadikan bayang-bayang itu tetap) artinya tidak hilang sekalipun matahari terbit (kemudian Kami jadikan matahari atasnya) yakni bayang-bayang atau gelap itu (sebagai petunjuk) karena seandainya tidak ada matahari maka niscaya bayang-bayang atau gelap itu tidak akan dikenal. (Maka apakah ada tanda-tanda Allah) yang menunjukkan akan kekuasaan-Nya (dalam bayang-bayang itu?) yaitu gelapnya malam hari.
answer_id: (Bukankah Allah telah menjadikan) Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir atau menetapkan (bayangan matahari terbenam) yakni mulai dari terbenamnya matahari hingga terbenam (dan kalau Dia menghendaki) yakni Rabb Nabi saw. (niscaya Dia menjadikan bayang-bayang itu tetap) artinya tidak hilang sekalipun matahari terbit (dan Dia menjadikan bayang-bayang itu tetap) yakni bayang-bayang atau gelap itu (sebagai petunjuk) karena seandainya tidak ada matahari maka niscaya bayang-bayang atau gelap itu tidak akan dikenal. (Dan yang demikian itu) hal yang telah disebutkan itu (adalah sebagian dari tanda-tanda kekuasaan Allah) bukti-bukti yang menunjukkan kekuasaan-Nya (dan yang besar) bukti-bukti yang menunjukkan akan kekuasaan Allah swt.

question_en: What is the wisdom behind Allah's sending down of rain among people (i.e., the rain falling on one land and not another)?
answer_en: Let those upon whom We have bestowed rain remember it as a favor from Us, and let them be grateful. And let those who have been deprived of it hasten to seek Allah's forgiveness, that He may have mercy on them and provide them with rain. But most people are ungrateful and deny Our favors, saying, 'We have rain by our own effort.'
question_id: Dan Allah, sungguh, tidak berkehendak menakdirkan suatu ayat dalam al-Qur'ân.
answer_id: (Dan hendaklah orang-orang yang Kami berikan hujan) yang dimaksud adalah orang-orang Mukmin (kepada mereka sebagai nikmat dari Kami dan agar mereka bersyukur) atas nikmat Kami; lafal ayat ini dapat dibaca Tahqiq dan Tas-hil (dan agar mereka mendapat ampunan dari Allah) dari kemusyrikan (dan Kami memberi rezeki kepada mereka) dengan air hujan itu (tetapi kebanyakan manusia) yaitu orang-orang kafir (tidak bersyukur) kepada Allah (lagi ingkar) akan nikmat-nikmat-Nya.

answer_en: God created from the loins of Adam and Eve offspring, both male and female, and thus originated the ties of kinship and marriage.
question_id: - Ya.
answer_id: Allah menciptakan Adam dan Hawa dari keturunan Adam, laki-laki dan perempuan. Dengan demikian, hubungan kekerabatan dan hubungan kekerabatan menjadi terputus.

question_en: What is the general role of the Messengers to their respective peoples?
answer_en: And they are heralds of good news for the believers and warners for the disbelievers. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a herald of good news and a warner.
question_id: Apa peranan umum para utusan bagi bangsa mereka masing - masing?
answer_id: (Dan Kami tidak mengutus kamu) hai Muhammad (melainkan sebagai pembawa berita gembira) bagi orang-orang yang beriman (dan pemberi peringatan) terhadap orang-orang kafir, bahwa mereka akan masuk surga. (Dan tidak lain) (Kami tidak mengutus kamu) hai Muhammad (melainkan sebagai pembawa berita gembira) kepada orang yang percaya akan adanya surga (dan pemberi peringatan) terhadap orang yang ingkar kepada adanya neraka.

question_en: Recite the qualities of the servants of the Most Merciful.
answer_en: The righteous servants of the Most Merciful are those who: 1- walk on earth humbly and modestly. 2- respond to the ignorant who address them with harm, with kindness, and speak to them in a way that avoids sin. 3- frequently perform night prayers, sincerely devoted to their Lord, bowing and prostrating. 4- fear God and invoke Him to save them from the torment of Hell, which is everlasting. 5- spend their wealth moderately. 6- worship only God and do not associate anything with Him. 7- do not take a life that God has made sacred, except in justice. 8- do not commit fornication, but protect their private parts, except with their spouses or those they rightfully possess. 9- do not bear false witness or attend gatherings of falsehood. 10- when they pass by people engaged in idle talk, they move on, disapproving and avoiding it. 11- when reminded with verses of the Quran and signs of God's oneness, they do not turn away. 12- pray to God, saying: 'Our Lord, grant us from our spouses and offspring comfort for our eyes and make us leaders of the righteous.' Those who possess these qualities among the servants of the Most Merciful will be rewarded with the highest ranks in Paradise, by God's mercy and due to their patience in doing good deeds. They will be greeted and given peace by the angels, and will live in bliss, free from afflictions, forever, in a pleasant abode where they will reside and dwell.
question_id: (Bacalah) maksudnya mulailah membaca dan memulainya (dengan menyebut nama hamba-hamba Allah Yang Maha Pemurah) yakni hamba-hamba-Nya yang beriman. Lafal ayat ini diathafkan kepada lafal sebelumnya.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya jawaban yang tepat dari orang-orang yang berbuat baik) yakni orang-orang yang taat (ialah orang-orang yang berjalan di muka bumi dengan merendahkan diri) merendahkan diri (dan merendahkan diri) tidak mau bersujud (kepada orang-orang yang tidak tahu menyangka bahwa mereka) dengan lafal ayat ini berkedudukan menjadi badal atau kata ganti dari lafal wazannya yang sebelumnya dengan memperkirakan adanya huruf jarr-nya (akan menyelamatkan mereka dari siksa neraka) dapat dibaca nashab dan dapat pula dibaca rafa' sehingga bacaannya menjadi yakhrujuuna (yang akan mereka nafkahkan) dapat dibaca tu'adzdzakkar dan yadzkuruuna. (Sesungguhnya mereka) yakni orang-orang yang mengerjakan salat di malam hari yang salat di malam hari secara musyrikin (dan tidak mempersekutukan) mereka (melainkan) mereka mengerjakan hal-hal yang menyebabkan mereka mengerjakan hal-hal tersebut (dirikan) yakni mereka mengerjakan hal-hal yang telah disebutkan (di sisi Allah, dan di sisi-Nya belaka.

question_en: Are you despairing that they will not become believers? What is the meaning of (بَاخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ)?
answer_en: Destroy yourself.
question_id: Apakah Anda putus asa bahwa mereka tidak akan menjadi orang percaya?
answer_id: Hancurkan dirimu sendiri.

question_en: Why did Allah command Moses and Aaron (peace be upon them) to go to Pharaoh?
answer_en: So come to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of all the worlds. Send the Children of Israel with us.'
question_id: Mengapa Allah memerintahkan Musa dan Harun untuk pergi kepada Fir'aun?
answer_id: Maka datanglah kamu berdua kepada Fir'aun dan katakanlah olehmu: "Sesungguhnya Kami adalah Rasul Tuhan semesta alam, maka lepaskanlah Bani Israil (pergi) bersama kami."

question_en: And that was a favor which you granted me that I worshipped the children of Israel.
answer_en: You consider that upbringing in your home is a blessing from you upon me, yet you made the Israelites slaves, slaughtering their sons and dishonoring their women. Why did you not enslave me like them?
question_id: (Budi yang kamu limpahkan kepadaku itu) asal lafal Tamunnuhaa adalah Tamunnu Bihaa, maksudnya, yang telah kamu limpahkan kepadaku itu (adalah disebabkan kamu telah menyeru Bani Israel) untuk menyembahku.
answer_id: Kaupikir pendidikan di rumahmu adalah berkat dariku, tapi kau menjadikan orang Israel budak, membunuh putra-putra mereka dan menghina wanita mereka. Kenapa kau tidak memperbudak aku seperti mereka?

question_en: The sorcerers gathered for an appointed day, which is a known day. What is that known day?
answer_en: It is the time of Dhuhr, the day of Eid, when they are free from their work, gather and adorn themselves to meet Moses.
question_id: Lalu dikumpulkanlah ahli-ahli sihir pada hari yang ditentukan, yaitu pada hari yang sudah ditentukan, yaitu hari kiamat. Hari apakah itu?
answer_id: Ini adalah waktu Dhuhr, hari Idul Fitri, ketika mereka bebas dari pekerjaan mereka, mengumpulkan dan menghiasi diri untuk bertemu Musa.

question_en: After the magicians believed in the Lord of the Worlds, Pharaoh threatened them with torture. What was the magicians' response?
answer_en: The sorcerers said to Pharaoh: 'No harm will come to us from your punishment in this world, for we are returning to our Lord to grant us the eternal bliss. We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, especially those of associating others with Him; for we were the first to believe among your people.'
question_id: (Maka tatkala ahli-ahli sihir itu beriman kepada Rabb semesta alam) yaitu dengan percaya kepada Nabi Musa (ia berkata, "Hai Firaun!
answer_id: Ahli-ahli sihir berkata kepada Fir'aun: "Kami sekali-kali tidak akan ditimpa azab terhadap kamu selama-lamanya, dan sesungguhnya kami akan kembali kepada Tuhan kami, supaya Tuhan kami memberi ampunan kepada kami. Sesungguhnya kami adalah orang-orang yang pertama-tama beriman di antara kaummu."

question_en: Who said this verse: 'No, indeed! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.' (Quran 26:62) And why did they say it?
answer_en: The one who said this statement is Musa (Moses) peace be upon him, and he said it when the people of Musa said, 'Pharaoh is over us and doomed to us.'
question_id: (Yang berkata,) kepadaku dengan nada yang mengejek, ('Sebenarnya Rabbku besertaku) yakni Alquran (akan memberi petunjuk kepadaku") maksudnya, Dia tidak akan memberi hidayah kepadaku jika memang demikian. (Maka mengapa mereka) yakni orang-orang kafir Mekah (mendustakannya?)
answer_id: (Dan) ingatlah (ketika Musa berkata) Nabi Musa adalah anak lelaki Imran (kepadanya, "Hai Musa! Sembahlah Allah) artinya esakanlah Dia (sekali-kali tidak ada Tuhan bagimu selain Dia.

question_en: How did Moses (peace be upon him) and his companions escape from Pharaoh?
answer_en: God commanded Moses to strike the sea with his staff, and when he did, the sea parted into twelve paths, corresponding to the number of tribes of the Israelites, with each part appearing like a great mountain. We brought Pharaoh and his people close, causing them to enter the sea, and we saved Moses and all those with him. The sea remained parted until they had crossed to the other side, and then we drowned Pharaoh and his followers by causing the sea to collapse upon them as they pursued Moses and his people. Indeed, this event is a remarkable sign of God's power, yet most of Pharaoh's followers remained unbelieving despite this clear sign. Your Lord is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful.
question_id: Bagaimana Mûsâ dan pengikutnya bisa selamat dari siksaan itu?
answer_id: Dan Allah memerintahkan Musa untuk memukul lautan dengan tongkatnya. Maka tatkala Musa dan pengikut-pengikutnya masuk ke dalam laut, Kami selamatkan Musa dan orang-orang yang besertanya semuanya (juga) dari laut; dan terbelahlah lautan itu hingga mereka berdua bertemu, kemudian Kami tenggelamkan Fir'aun dan pengikut-pengikutnya ke dalam laut, sebagaimana mereka mengikuti Musa dan (juga) kaumnya.

question_en: Who is the author of these verses (26:78-82) from the Quran?
answer_en: Abraham (peace be upon him).
question_id: Siapakah yang menurunkan kitab suci dari Allah yang berisi keterangan bahwa al-Qur'ân itu diturunkan dari sisi Allah?
answer_id: (yaitu) "Kesejahteraan dilimpahkan atas Ibrahim."

question_en: Who is the reciter of this supplication? Explain the verses. (Surah Al-Shu'ara', verses 83-89)
answer_en: Ibrahim (peace be upon him) said, 'My Lord, grant me knowledge and understanding, and admit me among the righteous. Gather me with them in Paradise, and make my mention good and my remembrance excellent among those who come after me until the Day of Resurrection. Make me one of Your servants who will inherit Paradise. This is the prayer of Ibrahim (peace be upon him) that Allah may save his father from misguidance to guidance, forgive him and have mercy on him, as Ibrahim (peace be upon him) had promised his father to pray for him. But when it became clear to him that his father was persistent in disbelief and associating partners with Allah until he died, Ibrahim (peace be upon him) disowned him and said, 'Do not associate me with the disgraced on the day when people will come out of their graves for reckoning and recompense, the day when wealth and children will not benefit anyone except those who come to Allah with a pure heart, free from disbelief, hypocrisy, and immorality.'
question_id: Siapakah yang membacakan kalimat-kalimat (kalimat) yang mengandung hikmah-hikmah, seperti al-Qur'ân, kitab suci yang diturunkan sebelumnya, kitab-kitab suci dan kitab-kitab suci yang diturunkan sebelumnya,
answer_id: (Ibrahim berdoa): "Ya Tuhanku, berikanlah kepadaku ilmu dan masukkanlah aku ke dalam golongan orang-orang yang saleh, dan masukkanlah aku ke dalam surga serta ucapkanlah salam yang baik kepadaku, yaitu: "Ya Tuhanku, jadikanlah aku termasuk orang-orang yang datang sesudahku sampai hari kiamat, maka jadikanlah aku termasuk orang-orang yang mempusakai surga dan masukkanlah ke dalam surga itu, supaya aku dapat mengikuti bapaknya dari sisi Engkau; dan (jadikanlah) bapaknya itu buah-buahan, dan janganlah ia termasuk golongan orang-orang yang zalim."

question_en: So they will enter it, and the deviators and the soldiers of Iblis, all gathered together. (Interpret the noble verses.)
answer_en: Gather and throw them into hell, along with those who misled them and the helpers of Iblis who adorned evil for them.
question_id: (Maka mereka masuk ke dalamnya) bersama-sama orang-orang yang mendustakan (dengan orang-orang yang sesat) yakni orang-orang kafir (dan para pembesar) dari kalangan orang-orang kafir, karena mereka telah mengatakan, bahwa para malaikat itu adalah anak-anak perempuan Allah. Lafal ayat ini menjadi Mubtada, sedangkan Khabarnya adalah Khabar dari Mubtada (semuanya) lafal ayat ini di'athafkan kepada lafal Kaana, dan lafal sebelumnya sama dengan lafal Khaalidiina dengan lafal Khaalidiina sebagai Khabar kedua dari lafal yang diperkirakan keberadaannya, yaitu lafal Idz ini berkedudukan menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada.
answer_id: Kumpulkanlah, hai para malaikat-Ku, orang-orang yang menzalimi diri mereka sendiri dengan kekafiran bersama istri-istri mereka yang kafir dan tuhan-tuhan selain Allah yang selalu mereka sembah seperti berhala dan sekutu! Tunjukilah mereka jalan ke neraka untuk mereka lalui!

question_en: What is that loaded ship?
answer_en: The ship filled with various creatures that he brought with him.
question_id: Kapal apa itu?
answer_id: Kapal itu dipenuhi dengan berbagai makhluk yang dibawanya.

question_en: To whom do the previous verses of the Quran, 'Do you build upon every high place a sign, playing around?' (128) 'And take for yourselves houses to last forever?' (129) 'And when you attack, you attack as if you are tyrants?' (130), address? Who is the addressee? Explain.
answer_en: To the tribe of 'Ad, and their prophet Hood, peace be upon him, said, 'Do you build high towers on every high place, and when someone passes by, you scoff at them? That is futile and extravagant, it will not benefit you in this world or the hereafter. You build fortresses and castles, as if you will live forever in this world and never die. And when you kill or strike someone from the creation, you do so tyrannically.'
question_id: Untuk siapa ayat-ayat sebelumnya Al-Quran, 'Apakah Anda membangun di setiap tempat tinggi, bermain-main?' (128) 'Dan mengambil sendiri rumah-rumah untuk selamanya? " (129) " Dan ketika Anda menyerang, Anda menyerang seolah-olah Anda adalah tiran?' (130), alamat? Siapa alamat?
answer_id: (Dan) ingatlah (kaum Ad) yakni kaum 'Ad (dan nabi mereka) yang dimaksud adalah Nabi Hud, yang dimaksud adalah Nabi Hud, kaum 'Ad, kaum Nabi Hud, kaum Nabi Hud, kaum Nabi Hud, kaum Nabi Hud dan kaum Tsamud, mereka tinggal di sekitar kota Madyan (dalam keadaan sejahtera) lafal ini menjadi Hal atau kata keterangan keadaan dari lafal yang tidak disebutkan, maksudnya sedang kamu merasa damaikan mereka. (Berkatalah kamu, "Apakah kamu mendirikan benteng-benteng dan istana-istana di bumi) yakni istana-istana (yang tinggi) bangunan-bangunan yang tinggi (dan kamu sekali-kali tidak akan mati) tidak akan pernah mati (jika kamu membunuh atau membunuh seseorang dari ciptaan Allah) dengan cara membunuh seseorang yang telah disebutkan tadi (maka tidaklah kamu melakukan itu) yang demikian itu (suatu kebaikan pun) artinya keaniayaan (bagi orang-orang yang lalim.") yaitu orang yang berbuat aniaya tidak akan menjadi mukmin.

question_en: To whom do the previous verses of the Quran address their speech? And who is the addressee? Explain.
answer_en: Does your Lord not suffice you in the enjoyment of the greenery you find, secure in your dwellings, and before the punishment comes, which will indeed come?
question_id: (Maka siapakah) maksudnya, tiada seorang pun (yang dapat menjelaskan) menerangkan (ayat-ayat Allah sebelum itu) sebelum diturunkannya Alquran.
answer_id: (Dan apakah tidak cukup bagi kalian) Allah swt. memberikan izin kepada kalian (Rabb kalian tentang tumbuh-tumbuhan yang hijau) yang dimaksud adalah tumbuh-tumbuhan baru (yang kalian dapati) kalian telah bersenang-senang dengannya (di tempat-tempat tinggal mereka) di dunia (dan di tempat-tempat kediaman kalian) di akhirat nanti (dan di tempat-tempat tinggal yang baik) tempat-tempat tinggal yang kalian tempati di dunia, yaitu tempat-tempat tinggal yang kalian lalui (Dan apakah Rabb kalian tidak cukup bagi kalian) huruf min di sini adalah zaidah (untuk makan dan bermukim di tempat-tempat tersebut?) tempat-tempat bersenang-senang (sebelum datang azab kepada kalian; maka tibalah waktu itu) yaitu saat kematian kalian.

question_en: What is the miracle of Saleh (peace be upon him) for his people?
answer_en: God made a she-camel come out of the rock for him, with a share of water for her on a specified day, and a share for them on another day. They cannot drink on the day that is her share, nor can she drink on the day that is theirs.
question_id: Apakah (patut Al Quran) dalam bahasa 'Ad merasa aman (dari datangnya azab itu) kepada kaumnya?
answer_id: (Dan Allah telah mendatangkan unta betina dari batu itu) yakni dari batu besar itu (sebagai mukjizat) sebagai mukjizat (baginya, di hari kiamat) maksudnya pada hari itu pun (bahwasanya unta itu) yakni unta betina itu (terdapat minum dari gunung-gunung) lafal ayat ini dinashabkan oleh Fi'ilnya yang keberadaannya diperkirakan sebelumnya, sedangkan huruf Jar-nya adalah Zaidah (dan sekali-kali tidak dapat minum) minuman keras itu (barang sedikit pun di hari itu bagi mereka) yang dimaksud adalah hari penghisaban amal perbuatan mereka.

question_en: What did the Thamud do with Allah's camel, and what was the consequence of that?
answer_en: They slaughtered the camel, but Allah struck them with His punishment. They regretted it, but they had already been afflicted with the punishment. Indeed, in that is a sign, yet most of them were not believers.
question_id: Bagaimanakah mereka dapat mengambil unta betina dari Allah, padahal sebelumnya mereka adalah orang-orang yang zalim?) karena mereka telah menjadikan berhala-berhala sebagai sekutu Allah.
answer_id: Sesungguhnya pada yang demikian itu benar-benar terdapat tanda (kekuasaan Allah), tetapi kebanyakan mereka tidak beriman.

question_en: Who is speaking in these verses from the Quran (Surah Al-Shu'ara, verses 165-166)? To whom are they speaking? What was the deed of the people of Lot?
answer_en: Lot, peace be upon him, is the speaker, addressing his people and calling them to stop their practice of having sexual relations with men.
question_id: (Siapakah yang) Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir, maksudnya tidak ada orang-orang (di dalam Alquran ini) yakni Alquran (yang berbicara dengan mereka apa yang tidak) apa-apa (diturunkan dari Rabb mereka) yang menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (dan mereka) lafal ayat ini berkedudukan menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (tentang apa) yang menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (di antara berbuat terhadap kaum Luth) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (?) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada yang kedua, maksudnya, tiada seorang pun yang mengetahuinya selain mereka.
answer_id: Lot, kedamaian ada di atasnya, yaitu sang pembicara, berbicara kepada umat - Nya dan memanggil mereka untuk menghentikan kebiasaan mereka melakukan hubungan seks dengan pria - pria.

question_en: What was the reason for the destruction of the people of Lot (peace be upon him)?
answer_en: And Allah sent upon them stones of clay, raining upon them, and He made them like scattered straw.
question_id: Mengapa kamu menyalahkan dan mencelakakan Lûth? Bagaimana kamu melakukan hal itu, padahal Kami telah membinasakan umat-umat terdahulu yang mendustakan para rasul?
answer_id: (Dan Allah mendatangkan kepada mereka batu-batu dari tanah yang keras yang hancur) yang dibakar oleh api.

question_en: Who is the speaker in the blessed verses, and to whom are they speaking?
answer_en: The speaker was Shu'ayb, and he spoke to his people, the owners of the Grove, which is a land full of twisted trees.
question_id: Siapakah yang berbicara dalam ayat - ayat yang penuh berkat, dan kepada siapa mereka berbicara?
answer_id: Sang pembicara adalah Syu'ayb, dan ia berbicara kepada umat-Nya, pemilik Grove, yang merupakan negeri yang penuh dengan pohon-pohon yang rindang

question_en: What was the reason for the destruction of the people of Shoaib (peace be upon him), the owners of the orchard?
answer_en: A severe heat struck them, and they sought a shelter to take refuge in. A cloud shaded them, and they found coolness and a breeze. But when they gathered underneath it, fire blazed upon them and burned them. Thus, their destruction was complete on that terrible day. They denied him, so the punishment of the Day of the Shadow seized them. Indeed, it was a severe punishment on that great day.
question_id: (Mengapa tidak) (mendatangkan perdamaian) yakni perdamaian (kepada penduduk Aikah?) yakni penduduk kota Mekah yang mulia, seperti kaum Ad dan kaum Tsamud serta lain-lainnya.
answer_id: (Maka tatkala mereka masuk ke dalamnya) masuk ke dalamnya (api yang menyala-nyala) yaitu api yang sangat panas. (Demikianlah) azab itu (hari yang besar) yang sangat keras (disebabkan kekafiran mereka) oleh sebab kedustaan mereka terhadap Nabi saw. (maka pada hari itu mereka ditimpa azab) yaitu pada hari kiamat (di hari yang besar) yakni hari kiamat.

question_en: And indeed, it is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds. By it, the trustworthy spirit descended. Upon your heart, that you may be of the warners. In a clear Arabic tongue. And indeed, it is in the scriptures of the ancients. O Poets! Who is the trustworthy spirit? And what did it descend with? And in what language? And did the previous scriptures of the prophets mention it?
answer_en: Gabriel, peace be upon him, descended with the Quran in the clear Arabic language, and indeed, the remembrance of this Quran was already established in the previous books of the prophets, who had foretold and believed in it.
question_id: (Dan sesungguhnya Alquran itu) Alquran itu (benar-benar diturunkan oleh Rabb semesta alam) kepadamu (dan sesungguhnya Alquran itu) Alquran itu (benar-benar diturunkan kepada kamu) yakni Alquran (dalam bahasa Arab) atau memakai bahasa Arab (yang terang) yang jelas. (Dan sesungguhnya Alquran itu) yakni Alquran itu (adalah dalam kitab-kitab orang-orang dahulu) seperti kitab Taurat dan kitab Injil (dan sesungguhnya) lafal Alquran itu (adalah turun dengan bahasa yang dapat dipercaya) artinya jelas dan dapat dipercaya.
answer_id: (Maka keselamatan bagi Jibril) dari siksaan (dalam bahasa Arab yang terang) ayat-ayat itu diterangkan dengan jelas, sehingga diturunkanlah Alquran dari sisi Allah kepada rasul-Nya (dan sesungguhnya telah terdahulu) yakni Muhammad (Alquran itu) yakni Alquran itu (membenarkan kitab-kitab sebelumnya) kitab-kitab yang diturunkan sebelumnya (dan membenarkan) kitab-kitab yang diturunkan sebelumnya (serta menjadi saksi atas yang demikian itu) bagi orang-orang yang mendustakannya.

question_en: And what has come down to him is not from the devils, nor is it fitting for them, nor are they able to do it. Indeed, they are far removed from hearing it. (Explain the meaning of these verses from the Quran, Surah Al-Shu'ara'.)
answer_en: The claim by the disbelievers that the Quran was sent down to Muhammad by the jinn is false, as they are unable to do so and are blocked from hearing the Quran from the sky, being struck by shooting stars.
question_id: (Dan apa yang diturunkan kepadanya) yakni Alquran (dari setan-setan) di antara makhluk-makhluk yang lainnya (tidaklah) dihalalkan (dan tidak pula mereka dapat memahaminya) artinya, kitab yang diturunkan kepadanya itu tidak bertentangan dengan kitab-kitab Allah swt. (Sesungguhnya mereka) yakni orang-orang Yahudi dan Nasrani (benar-benar dalam kesesatan yang nyata) nyata kesesatannya, karena mereka dalam hal ini mereka mengatakan, bahwa Nabi saw. tidak beriman kepada Nabi saw., dan Alquran adalah benar-benar dari sisi Allah swt.
answer_id: Orang-orang kafir mendakwakan kepalsuan dengan menyatakan bahwa al-Qur'ân yang diturunkan kepada Muhammad itu benar-benar bohong belaka, dan mereka tidak mampu melakukannya. Mereka juga tidak dapat mendengar al-Qur'ân dari langit yang diturunkan kepada nabi-nabi dan rasul-rasul sebelum mereka.

question_en: From whom do the jinn descend?
answer_en: False accusers, who are guilty of many sins, are visited by demons who eavesdrop on them, snatching them away from the highest assembly and casting them among the false accusers. Most of these are liars, and even if one of them speaks the truth, he adds a hundred lies to it. Do you know upon whom the demons descend? They descend upon every sinful liar.
question_id: Siapakah gerangan yang telah menurunkannya kepada umat-umat yang terdahulu sebelum mereka?
answer_id: (Orang-orang yang melontarkan tuduhan-tuduhan palsu) yaitu tuduhan-tuduhan bahwa mereka telah berbuat zina (dan dituduh) membuat-buat dusta (oleh setan-setan yang mencuri-curi minuman itu) dengan memakai alat-alat penelusuran (lalu merampasnya) mengambilnya (dari tempat-tempat yang tinggi) tempat-tempat yang tinggi di dalam surga (dan melemparkan tuduhan-tuduhan itu) tuduhan-tuduhan yang dilontarkan oleh para penipu itu (sebagian besar dari orang-orang yang berdusta) yang mengatakan bahwa mereka telah berdusta kepadanya. (Dan jika salah seorang di antara mereka mengatakan yang benar) di dalam pengakuannya (maka setan-setan itu menambah seratus orang-orang yang berdusta) di dalam hal ini.

question_en: What did Allah (SWT) say in Surah Ash-Shu'ara (The Poets)? Please explain the verses.
answer_en: And the poets - it is those straying who follow them. Have you not seen that they roam every valley, and that they say what they do not do? Except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and remember Allah often, and defend themselves after being wronged. And they will know who has gone astray from the path.
question_id: (Apakah yang dikatakan oleh Allah) apakah Alquran itu (di dalam surah Syuaib) yakni di surah Al-An'am (yaitu Al-Syu'aib) anak lelaki Nabi saw. (Katakanlah) kepada mereka, ("Terangkanlah kepadaku tentang ayat-ayat Alquran ini) ceritakanlah kepada-Ku (agar aku membacakannya) Alquran itu (kepadanya.
answer_id: (Dan penyair-penyair itu diikuti oleh orang-orang yang sesat) di dalam syair-syair mereka, lalu mereka mengatakannya dan meriwayatkannya dari orang-orang yang sesat itu, maka mereka adalah orang-orang yang tercela (maka apakah kalian tidak memperhatikan) artinya tidak melihat (kepada setiap lembah) di setiap (sedangkan mereka tidak mengetahui) akibat dari perbuatan mereka itu (bahwa apa yang mereka kerjakan) yakni perbuatan baik yang telah mereka lakukan itu (melainkan orang-orang yang beriman dan mengerjakan amal saleh) yakni orang-orang yang kafir (mengadakan mereka) di dalam Alquran (dan berzikir kepada Allah) maksudnya, mereka selalu merenungkannya (dan ingat kepada Allah) bahwasanya hal-hal tersebut (sesungguhnya mereka telah sesat dari jalan yang lurus) hidayah.

question_en: When Moses said to his family, 'I have seen a fire; I will bring you news from it or a burning torch, so that you may warm yourselves.' (Quran 27:7) - Explain the meaning of this verse.
answer_en: Recall the story of Moses when he said to his family during his journey from Madyan to Egypt: 'I have seen a fire, I will bring you news from it that will guide us on the way, or I will bring you a burning ember to warm you from the cold.'
question_id: Ingatlah (ketika Musa berkata kepada keluarganya) yaitu istrinya sewaktu ia berjalan dari Madyan menuju ke Mesir, ("Sesungguhnya aku melihat) dari jauh (api. Aku kelak akan membawa kepadamu kabar daripadanya) mengenai jalan yang harus kita tempuh, karena pada saat itu Nabi Musa tersesat (atau membawa sesuluh api) yakni obor yang dinyalakan pada sumbu atau kayu (supaya kamu dapat berdiang") maksudnya berdiang padanya.
answer_id: (Dan) ingatlah (ketika Musa berkata kepada keluarganya) yaitu istrinya sewaktu berjalan dari Madyan menuju ke Mesir, ("Sesungguhnya aku melihat) dari jauh (api. Aku akan membawa kepadamu kabar daripadanya) mengenai jalan yang akan kita tempuh, karena pada saat itu Nabi Musa tersesat (atau aku akan membawa kepadamu) dari (suluh api).

question_en: What are those nine signs?
answer_en: The hand, the staff, the locusts, the scarcity of fruits, the flood, the hail, the caterpillar, the frogs, and the blood.
question_id: Apa sembilan tanda itu?
answer_id: Tangan, tongkat, belalang, kekurangan buah, banjir, hujan es, ulat, katak, dan darah.

question_en: What did Solomon inherit from David, peace be upon them both?
answer_en: The Prophethood.
question_id: Apa yang Salomo warisi dari Daud, kedamaian ada di tangan mereka berdua?
answer_id: Pennabian.

question_en: What is the story of the ant with Solomon, peace be upon him?
answer_en: Solomon gathered his troops from the jinn, humans, and birds in a march, they were well-organized. When they reached the valley of the ants, an ant said, 'O you ants, enter your homes, lest Solomon and his troops trample you,' while they were unaware. Solomon smiled at the words of this ant, admiring its understanding and guidance in warning the ants. He felt the blessings of God upon him and prayed, 'My Lord, grant me the ability and guide me to thank You for Your blessings upon me and my parents, and to do good deeds that please You, and to enter, by Your mercy, the gardens of paradise with Your righteous servants whose deeds You are pleased with.'
question_id: Bagaimana kisah semut dengan Salomo? Salam sejahtera untuknya.
answer_id: Dan Sulaiman telah mengumpulkan bala tentaranya dari jin, manusia dan burung lalu mereka diatur dengan tertib (dalam barisan); maka tatkala mereka sampai ke lembah semut-semut itu sambil berkata: "Hai semut-semut! Masuklah kamu ke rumah-rumah kami, agar tidak diinjak-injak oleh Sulaiman dan orang-orang yang ada di sekitarnya.

answer_en: Solomon checked on the birds that were trained for him and the ones that were absent, and he had a special and well-known hoopoe bird, but he could not find it. He said, 'Why don't I see the hoopoe that I usually see? Has it been hidden from me, or is it among the absent ones, and I didn't see it because of its absence?' When it became clear that it was absent, he said, 'I will surely punish this hoopoe with a severe punishment for its absence, either as a deterrent or as a sacrifice for what it has done, for neglecting what it was trained for, or it may bring a clear excuse for its absence.' The hoopoe stayed away for a short time, then it came back, and Solomon rebuked it for its absence and delay. The hoopoe said, 'I have learned something that you did not know, and I have come to you from the city of Sheba in Yemen with important news, and I am certain of it. I found a woman ruling the people of Sheba, and she has everything that this world has to offer, and she has a great throne on which she sits to manage her kingdom. I found her and her people worshipping the sun, turning away from worshipping Allah, and the devil has made their evil deeds seem good to them, and has turned them away from believing in Allah and worshipping Him alone. The devil has made that seem good to them, so that they do not worship Allah, who brings out the hidden and the unseen in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you whisper and what you say openly. Allah, there is no deity worthy of worship except Him, the Lord of the great throne.' Solomon said, 'We will consider the news you have brought us, whether you are truthful or one of the liars. Take this letter of mine to the people of Sheba, give it to them, then move away from them, but stay close enough to hear their conversation, and see what they say among themselves.'
question_id: - Ya.
answer_id: Nabi Sulaiman sengaja melakukan hal ini untuk menguji kecerdasan akalnya, karena menurut kata orang-orang dia berakal cerdas. Maka Nabi Sulaiman berkata kepada mereka, "Sesungguhnya aku telah mengetahui sesuatu yang gaib dari Rabbku dan apa yang diwahyukan kepadaku.

question_en: What is the story of Solomon (peace be upon him) with the Queen of Sheba?
answer_en: The hoopoe went and threw the book at the queen, who read it and gathered her nobles. She said to them, 'A great book has reached me from a person of high standing.' She then explained its contents, saying, 'It is from Solomon, and it begins with 'In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Do not be arrogant, nor be proud of what I have called you to, and come to me in submission to Allah, as Muslims.' She said to her nobles, 'Adviseme in this matter, for I do not decide on any matter without your consultation.' They replied, 'We are strong in numbers and equipment, and brave in war. The matter is yours, and you are the one with the wisdom. So, tell us what you command, and we will obey you.' She warned them against facing Solomon with hostility and explained the futility of war, saying, 'Kings, when they enter a town, ravage it and make its nobles humble. This is their consistent way of instilling fear in people.' She sent a gift to Solomon and his people, and awaited the return of the messengers. When the queen's messenger arrived with the gift, Solomon said, 'Do you try to bribe me with money to please me? What Allah has given me in prophecy, kingship, and abundant wealth is better than what He has given you. Rather, it is you who rejoice in the gift that is given to you, for you are proud of this world and boast about it.' Solomon said to the messenger of the people of Sheba, 'Go back to them, for by Allah, we will send them armies against which they will have no power to resist or confront. We will drive them out of their land in humiliation and disgrace, unless they submit to Allah's religion alone and abandon the worship of anything else.' Solomon asked, 'Which of you will bring me the throne of the queen before they come to me in submission?' A powerful and strong jinn said, 'I will bring it to you before you rise from your seat. I am strong enough to carry it, and I am trustworthy; I will bring it to you as it is, without diminishing or changing anything.' The one who had knowledge of the Book said, 'I will bring it to you before your eyelid drops.' Solomon gave him permission, and he invoked Allah and brought the throne. When Solomon saw it present before him, he said, 'This is from the favor of my Lord to test me: whether I will be grateful for this blessing or ungrateful. Whoever is grateful does so for his own benefit, and whoever is ungrateful, my Lord is Independent, Most Generous. He bestows His bounty on whomever He wills, both in this world and the Hereafter.' Solomon said to those around him, 'Change the queen's throne into a different form when she sees it; let us see if she will recognize it or be one of those who do not recognize it.' When the queen of Sheba came to Solomon in his assembly, she was asked, 'Is this your throne?' She said, 'It is like it.' Solomon knew that she had recognized it and believed in Allah's power and Solomon's prophecy. He said, 'We have been given knowledge before it, and we were Muslims.' What prevented her from worshipping Allah alone was what she used to worship besides Him. She was from a people who were disbelievers. Although she had intelligence and understanding, false beliefs can mislead one's judgment. She was told, 'Enter the glass palace,' and when she saw it, she thought it was water, and she uncovered her legs to wade in it. Solomon said, 'It is a glass floor with water underneath.' She realized the greatness of Solomon's kingdom and said, 'Lord, I have wronged myself, and I submit with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of the worlds.'
question_id: (Apakah) telah (dikisahkan) berita (kepada Sulaiman bahwasanya dia) lafal Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir atau menetapkan; artinya bahwasanya dia (laiman itu adalah ratu negeri Saba) yakni ratu Balqis telah mendustakan Nabi Sulaiman.
answer_id: Lafal 'Ainan berfungsi sebagai Tamyiz yang dipindahkan dari Fa'ilnya, maksudnya selamat bersenang hati dengan anakmu itu. Atau huruf Wau yang ada pada lafal 'Ataa-aalamiina adalah huruf Zaidah.

question_en: How many people did the ram of Abraham (Ibrahim) sacrifice?
answer_en: And in the city were nine groups causing corruption in the land and not setting it right.
question_id: Berapa banyak domba jantan yang dilakukan oleh Abraham (Ibrahim)?
answer_id: (Dan adalah di kota itu) yakni kota kaum Tsamud itu (sembilan orang laki-laki) dari kalangan kaum laki-laki (yang gemar membuat kerusakan di muka bumi) dengan melakukan perbuatan-perbuatan maksiat antara lain mereka merentenkan uang-uang Dirham (dan mereka tidak berbuat kebaikan) tidak pernah melakukan ketaatan.

question_en: What is the meaning of: 'But their knowledge has not benefited them at all in the Hereafter' (66) The Ant?
answer_en: If they complete their knowledge in the hereafter, they will be certain of the hereafter and its terrors when they witness them.
question_id: (Apakah) huruf Maa di sini bermakna Istifham yakni kata tanya, maksudnya, apakah (dapat menjamin mereka apa yang mereka ketahui tentang kehidupan akhirat?) makna yang dimaksud ialah bahwa yang dikatakan oleh orang-orang kafir itu tidak akan bermanfaat sama sekali.
answer_id: Dan sesungguhnya jika mereka dapat mengetahui dengan pengetahuan yang sempurna tentang akhirat, niscaya mereka akan meyakininya dengan yakin, tentang akhirat akhirat dan ketakutannya, sedang mereka menyaksikan (akibat perbuatannya).

question_en: What is the meaning of: (رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ الَّذِي تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ) in verse 72 of Surah An-Naml?
answer_en: Some of what you hasten is approaching from the punishment of Allah.
question_id: Apa arti dari: dalam ayat 72 dari Surah An-Naml?
answer_id: (Dan sebagian dari apa yang kalian kerjakan) yang kalian kerjakan (dengan cepat) kalimat ayat ini berkedudukan menjadi mubtada, sedangkan khabarnya ialah (azab Allah akan menimpa kalian) kelak di hari kiamat yaitu dengan azab neraka.

question_en: And when Our command comes, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, that the people were, concerning Our verses, not certain. (Interpret the verse from Surah An-Naml, verse 82)
answer_en: And when the punishment reaches them, they will not be able to delay it, for their sins have become too great, and they have turned away from Allah's law and His commandments, becoming the worst of His creation. At the end of time, we will send them a sign from the earth, one of the greatest signs of the Hour, which is the Dajjal. We will make them hear that those who deny the resurrection will not believe in the Quran, or Muhammad, peace be upon him, and his religion, nor will they act upon it.
question_id: Dan apabila perintah Kami datang kepada mereka, Kami keluarkan sejenis binatang melata dari bumi yang akan mengatakan kepada mereka, bahwa sesungguhnya manusia dahulu tidak yakin kepada ayat-ayat Kami.
answer_id: Dan apabila mereka ditimpa azab, mereka tidak dapat mengundurkannya barang sesaat pun dan tidak dapat (pula) mendahulukannya, karena sesungguhnya dosa-dosa mereka adalah lebih besar (dosanya) dari yang telah ditetapkan Allah, dan mereka berpaling dari hukum-hukum Allah dan kalimat-kalimat-Nya, hingga apabila telah datang ajal mereka, Kami datangkan kepada mereka keterangan-keterangan yang nyata dari sisi Kami, bahwasanya orang-orang yang kafir itu tidak akan beriman kepada Al Quran dan tidak (pula) kepada agamanya.

question_en: And on the day when the trumpet is blown, those who are in the heavens and those who are on the earth will be terrified, except for those whom Allah wills. And all will come to Him in humility. (Interpret the verse from Surah An-Naml, verse 87).
answer_en: On the day when the first blast of the Horn is blown by Israfil, those in the heavens and those on earth will be terrified, except those whom Allah wills. They will be the angels, Michael, Gabriel, Israfil, the Angel of Death, and the Prophet's companion, Ibn Abbas. The martyrs will be alive with their Lord, receiving sustenance. All will come to Him humbled on the Day of Judgment, and the expression 'coming' in the past tense is used to emphasize its occurrence.
question_id: Dan ungkapan dalam ayat ini dipakai Fi'il Madhi untuk menggambarkan kepastian terjadinya hal ini (kecuali siapa yang dikehendaki Allah) yaitu malaikat Jibril, malaikat Mikail, malaikat Israfil dan malaikat Maut. Tetapi menurut suatu riwayat yang bersumber dari sahabat Ibnu Abbas disebutkan, bahwa mereka yang tidak terkejut adalah para Syuhada, karena mereka hidup di sisi Rabb mereka dengan diberi rezeki.
answer_id: (Ingatlah) suatu hari (ketika) ditiup sangkakala (dengan tiupan) sangkakala itu, maka terkejutlah orang-orang yang di langit dan di bumi, kecuali siapa yang dikehendaki Allah. Mereka itu adalah malaikat-malaikat yang dimurkai Allah, Jibril, Jibril dan malaikat Jibril yang meyakini (kebenaran) tanda-tanda kekuasaan-Nya.

question_en: Are the mountains we see everywhere fixed or moving, but we don't feel it?
answer_en: You see the mountains, you think they are standing still, yet they pass by like clouds driven by the wind. This is from God, who has perfected all things. Indeed, God is aware of what His servants do, and He will hold them accountable for it.
question_id: Apakah gunung-gunung kita lihat di mana-mana tetap atau bergerak, tapi kita tidak merasakannya?
answer_id: (Dan kamu lihat gunung-gunung itu) yakni kamu saksikan gunung-gunung itu sewaktu terjadinya tiupan malaikat Israfil (kamu sangka dia) (tetap) diam di tempatnya karena besarnya (padahal ia berjalan sebagai jalannya awan) bagaikan hujan yang tertiup angin, maksudnya gunung-gunung itu tampak seolah-olah tetap, padahal berjalan lambat saking besarnya, kemudian jatuh ke bumi lalu hancur lebur kemudian menjadi abu bagaikan bulu-bulu yang beterbangan. (Yang demikian itu) apa yang telah disebutkan tadi (dari Allah, sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mengetahui apa yang dilakukan oleh hamba-hamba-Nya) Dia tidak ada sesuatu pun yang dapat menghalang-halangi-Nya untuk beriman (dan sesungguhnya Allah benar-benar Maha Kuasa atas segala sesuatu.)
