question_id: Bagaimana pendapatmu jika Al Quran itu datang dari sisi Allah, padahal kamu mengingkarinya dan seorang saksi dari Bani Israil mengakui (kebenaran) yang serupa, lalu kamu beriman? Mengapa kamu menyombongkan diri, padahal Allah tidak memberi petunjuk kepada orang-orang yang zalim, dan mereka adalah saksi dari Bani Israil, dan Allah menjadi saksi terhadap mereka.
answer_id: Saksi dari Bani Israil (yaitu) Al Quran, seorang yang menjadi saksi di antara Bani Israil, dan dia membenarkan kitab yang sebelumnya. Dan adalah dia seorang yang membenarkan dan membenarkan kitab yang sebelumnya.

question_en: What is the total duration of pregnancy and breastfeeding? What is the age of the perfection of intellect, strength, and sight?
answer_en: The duration of pregnancy and breastfeeding together is thirty months, and the full term of one's life span, strength, and intellect is forty years. We have directed the human being to treat his parents kindly. His mother carried him with hardship and gave birth to him with hardship. And the period of his bearing and weaning is thirty months. And when he reaches the age of maturity and reaches forty years, he says: 'My Lord, grant me the ability to be grateful for Your favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to do righteous deeds that please You, and to rectify my descendants. Indeed, I have turned to You in repentance, and indeed, I am of those who submit to You.' (Al-Ahqaf 15)
question_id: Berapa lama total masa kehamilan dan menyusui? Apakah usia kesempurnaan kecerdasan, kekuatan, dan penglihatan?
answer_id: Dan telah Kami perintahkan kepada manusia (berbuat baik) kepada dua orang ibu-bapaknya; ibunya telah mengandungnya selama tiga puluh bulan dan umurnya sampai tiga puluh bulan. Dan telah Kami perintahkan kepada manusia supaya berbuat baik kepada dua orang ibu-bapaknya, ibunya telah mengandungnya dengan susah payah dan menyapihnya dengan baik.

question_en: What are the Ahqaf?
answer_en: Al-Ahqaf are the vast sand dunes in the south of the Arabian Peninsula, and they were inhabited by the people of Hud, peace be upon him, who were the tribe of Ad.
question_id: Apakah Ahqaf itu?
answer_id: Di sebelah selatan Semenanjung Arab, ada bukit pasir yang luas. Di situ orang-orang Hud tinggal dengan aman di situ. Mereka adalah suku Ad

question_en: What does 'tā'fikanā' (تأفِكَنَا) mean in Surah Al-Ahqaf (22)?
answer_en: Any of our actions.
question_id: Apa arti 'Tā'fikanā' (a) di Surah Al-Ahqaf (22)?
answer_id: Setiap tindakan kita.

question_en: What is the punishment of the people of Hud?
answer_en: A wind in it is a painful, hurting, destructive torment that destroys everything it passes, sent for its destruction by the command of its Lord, and so they saw nothing in their land except their dwellings that they used to live in.
question_id: (Mengapa tidak) (diturunkan kepadanya) kepada Nabi Hud (azab kaumnya?) maksudnya siksaan apakah yang akan ditimpakan kepada mereka, atau azab akan ditimpakan kepada mereka karena mereka mendustakan Nabi Saleh.
answer_id: Angin itu meniupkan angin yang sangat dingin ke dalam bumi untuk menghancurkan apa yang ada di dalamnya sehingga tidak ada sesuatu pun yang dapat menyelamatkan mereka dari azab Allah. Dengan demikian, mereka tidak merasakan kesewenang-wenangan di muka bumi.

question_en: And indeed, We have destroyed what is around you of the towns. And We alternated the signs perhaps they would return. (27) Al-Ahqaf. To whom is the address in this verse? And what are the towns that Allah has destroyed?
answer_en: The speech is directed to the people of Mecca from the disbelievers, and the towns that God Almighty destroyed around Mecca are the towns of 'Ad and Thamud.
question_id: (Dan sesungguhnya Kami telah membinasakan negeri-negeri di sekitar kalian) yakni penduduk-penduduknya, seperti kaum Tsamud, kaum Ad dan kaum Luth (dan Kami adakan tanda-tanda kebesaran Kami) maksudnya Kami telah mengulang-ulang hujah-hujah Kami yang nyata (supaya mereka kembali.)
answer_id: (Yang demikian itu) yakni hal-hal yang telah disebutkan tadi; lafal dzaalika berkedudukan menjadi mubtada sedangkan khabarnya ialah (adalah telah ditetapkan) telah diputuskan (oleh kaum Ad dan Tsamud) kaum Nabi Saleh.

question_en: What is the story of the people who listened to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) from the jinn?
answer_en: And remember, O Messenger, when We sent to you a group of jinn who listened to the Qur'an. When they came to you, and the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was reciting, some of them said to others, 'Listen; let us listen to the Qur'an.' When the Messenger finished reciting the Qur'an, and it had been revealed and had an effect on them, they returned to their people, warning and admonishing them with the fear of Allah, saying, 'O our people, we have heard a scripture sent down after Moses, confirming what came before it of the books of Allah, which He sent down to His messengers, guiding to the truth and the right path.' They said, 'O our people, respond to the Messenger of Allah, Muhammad, to what he calls you to, and believe in him and work according to what he has brought to you, Allah will forgive you your sins and save you from a painful, severe punishment.' And whoever does not respond to the Messenger of Allah in what he calls to, Allah will not guide him on earth, and he will have no helpers to protect him from His punishment. Those are clearly astray from the truth.
question_id: (Bagaimanakah) (mereka dapat menerima peringatan) maksudnya, iman tidak akan bermanfaat buat mereka bila azab diturunkan (dari) yakni dari (umat-umat yang telah mendengarkan) perkataan Nabi saw. kepada orang-orang mukmin (yaitu jin) lafal ayat ini menjadi Badal dari lafal Idzaa dan Jawabnya; dimaksud supaya mereka dapat mengambil pelajaran daripadanya.
answer_id: Dan (ingatlah) ketika Kami hadapkan serombongan jin kepadamu yang mendengarkan Al Quran, maka tatkala rasul (Muhammad) datang kepada kamu, mereka mengucapkan: "Hai kaum kami, kami telah mendengarkan Al Quran ini dan Rasul telah datang kepadamu dengan nyata, membenarkan kitab-kitab yang sebelumnya dan memberi petunjuk kepada kaumnya dan mereka berkata: "Hai kaum kami, kami telah mendengarkan ayat-ayat Allah dan kami telah mendengar ayat-ayat Allah dan kami tinggalkan untuk siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya di antara rasul-rasul-Nya di antara kamu dan untuk memberi petunjuk kepada jalan yang lurus (Allah) ."

question_en: So be patient, as were the steadfast among the messengers, and do not hasten for them. On the Day they see what they are promised, it will seem to them that they have not remained [in this world] except for an hour of the day. But is there any that will perish except the wicked people? (Interpret the verse).
answer_en: Be patient, O Messenger, with the harm caused by your disbelieving people, as were patient the steadfast among the messengers before you - such as Noah, Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and you are among them. Do not hasten the punishment for your people; for when it comes, they will seem as if they stayed in the world for no more than an hour of the day. This is a reminder for them and for others. Only those who defy Allah's command and obedience will be destroyed by His punishment.
question_id: (Maka bersabarlah kamu) di dalam menghadapi perlakuan kaummu yang menyakitkan itu (sebagaimana orang-orang yang mempunyai keteguhan hati) yaitu orang-orang yang teguh dan sabar di dalam menghadapi cobaan dan tantangan (dari rasul-rasul) sebelummu, karena itu kamu akan termasuk orang yang mempunyai keteguhan hati. Lafal Min di sini menunjukkan makna Bayan, sehingga pengertiannya menunjukkan, bahwa semua rasul-rasul itu mempunyai keteguhan hati.
answer_id: (Hai rasul-rasul, bersabarlah kamu) khithab pada ayat ini ditujukan kepada Nabi saw. (sebagaimana orang-orang yang sebelum kamu bersabar) dari pendustaan dan perlakuan mereka yang menyakitkan dari orang-orang musyrik (bersama-sama dengan Nuh, Ibrahim, Musa dan kamu berada di tengah-tengah mereka) yakni di tengah-tengah mereka. (Dan janganlah kamu tergesa-gesa) janganlah kamu tergesa-gesa (terhadap) menghadapi (azab kaummu ketika mereka telah menyaksikan azab itu) mereka seperti orang-orang Yahudi dan Nasrani (seperti orang-orang terdahulu) yang terbunuh dalam perang Badar atau kaum musyrikin (yaitu orang-orang) lafal min di sini menunjukkan makna bayan atau penjelasan (yang serupa) menjadi mubtada (dengan orang-orang yang takut kepada Allah) orang-orang mukmin (dan takut kepada azab-Nya) orang-orang kafir.

question_en: If you encounter those who disbelieve, strike their necks until you have caused widespread slaughter, then secure their bonds. Either they will be shown mercy afterwards or ransomed, until war has laid down its burdens. That is if Allah had willed, He could have taken vengeance on them, but He intends to test some of you by means of others. And those who are killed in the way of Allah, He will never let their deeds go to waste. Explain this verse, Muhammad.
answer_en: If you encounter, O believers, those who disbelieve in the battlefields, then fight them, and strike off their heads until you have caused widespread slaughter among them, and bound their necks. Then, either show them favor by releasing them without ransom, or accept ransom from them, or let them go with a price. This is the commandment regarding the trial of the believers against the disbelievers and the conduct of the affairs between them. If Allah had willed, He could have given the believers victory over the disbelievers without fighting, but He has commanded this as a test for you and to establish His religion. As for those who are killed in the way of Allah, their works will not be in vain.
question_id: Jika kamu menemui orang-orang kafir, maka pancunglah batang leher mereka. Sehingga apabila kamu telah mengalahkan mereka maka tawanlah mereka dan sesudah itu kamu boleh membebaskan mereka atau menerima tebusan sampai perang berakhir.
answer_id: (Jika kamu bertemu dengan orang-orang yang kafir di medan perang maka pancunglah batang leher mereka) lafal Dharbur Riqaab adalah bentuk Mashdar yang menggantikan kedudukan Fi'ilnya, karena asalnya adalah, Fadhribuu Riqaabahum artinya, maka pancunglah batang leher mereka. Maksudnya, bunuhlah mereka.

question_en: What is the condition for Allah's victory for the believers?
answer_en: The condition is: victory for the sake of God's religion through jihad in His path, ruling by His book, obeying His commands, and avoiding His prohibitions. God will support you against your enemies and strengthen your feet in battle. O you who believe, if you support God, He will support you and strengthen your feet.
question_id: Mengapa Allah tidak memberikan kemenangan kepada orang-orang Mukmin atas orang-orang kafir itu?
answer_id: (Demikianlah) menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada yang keberadaannya diperkirakan sebelumnya, yakni perintah Allah itu sebagaimana yang telah disebutkan (Allah telah menjelaskan ayat-ayat bagi kalian) yakni Alquran (atas agama-Nya dan Dia telah memastikan) di dalamnya (kebenaran-Nya) di dalam agama-Nya (atas kalian supaya kalian dapat mengalahkan-Nya) melalui hujah-hujah-Nya yang telah kalian katakan itu (dan supaya kalian dapat mengalahkan musuh-musuh kalian) dari agama Islam (dan jika kalian beriman) yakni kepada Islam (niscaya Dia menolong kalian) melalui perang Badar dalam perang Badar (dan meneguhkan telapak kaki kalian) dengan memberikan pertolongan kepada kalian untuk menghadapi musuh-musuh-Nya.

question_en: What are the rivers in Paradise?
answer_en: The likeness of Paradise which the righteous have been promised is that in it are rivers of water unaltered, rivers of milk the taste of which does not change, rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of honey pure and clear. And in it there is every kind of fruit for them and the forgiveness of their Lord. That is the supreme triumph.
question_id: Apakah sungai - sungai di Firdaus itu?
answer_id: (Perumpamaan) gambaran tentang (surga yang dijanjikan kepada orang-orang yang bertakwa) dan yang menjadi milik bersama bagi orang-orang yang memasukinya. Lafal ayat ini menjadi Mubtada, sedangkan Khabarnya ialah (yang di dalamnya ada sungai-sungai dari air yang tiada berubah rasa dan baunya) dapat dibaca Aasinin atau Asinin, jika dibaca Aasinin wazannya sama dengan lafal Dhaaribin, jika dibaca Asinin Wazannya sama dengan lafal Hadzirun.

question_en: Why do those who believe say, 'Why hasn't a surah been sent down?' And when a surah that is precise and within which fighting is mentioned is revealed, you see those in whose hearts is disease looking at you with a look of one fainting to death. For them, it would have been better. Explain this verse, O Muhammad.
answer_en: Those who believe in Allah and His messenger say: 'Why hasn't a chapter been revealed from Allah commanding us to fight the disbelievers?' When a clear and comprehensive chapter is revealed, mentioning jihad, I see that those with doubt in their hearts about their faith and hypocrisy look at you, O Prophet, with a gaze veiled by fear of death. It is most fitting for these people with sickness in their hearts to obey Allah.
question_id: Dan mengapa orang-orang yang beriman berkata: "Mengapa tiada diturunkan suatu surat?" Dan apabila diturunkan suatu surat (yang dibawa oleh) yang tertulis di dalamnya (kitab-kitab Allah), niscaya kamu melihat orang-orang yang ada penyakit di dalam hatinya memandang kepadamu seperti pandangan orang yang pingsan karena takut akan mati, dan kalau demikian tentulah yang lebih baik bagi mereka.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya, mereka berkata, "Mengapa tidak) (diturunkan kepada kami suatu surah) yang di dalamnya dijelaskan masalah jihad (yang diwahyukan kepada orang-orang yang kafir) kepada Nabi Muhammad saw. yaitu Nabi Muhammad saw. (yakni suatu surah yang menerangkan hakikatnya) yang memisahkan antara perkara yang hak dan perkara yang batil (yaitu ketika diturunkan suatu surah yang jelas) yang membedakan antara perkara yang hak dan perkara yang batil (diturunkan kepada mereka) kepada orang-orang yang beriman (yaitu ketika) kepada Alquran (diturunkan kepada mereka Alquran yang mukmin dan yang ada dalam surah) yang di dalamnya terkandung makna dan hal-hal yang di dalamnya, yaitu termasuk hal-hal yang di dalamnya terkandung di dalam kalbu mereka, hal-hal tersebut demikianlah menurut keterangan yang telah disebutkan tadi. (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang di dalam hati mereka itu menuruti kemauan mereka) di dalam hal-hal tersebut (dengan apa yang nyata) yakni yang telah mereka katakan tentang apa yang telah mereka katakan itu.

answer_en: Indeed, this worldly life is but a game and a delusion. But if you believe in Allah and His Messenger, and fear Allah by fulfilling His obligations and avoiding His prohibitions, He will reward you for your deeds. He does not ask you to give away all your wealth in charity, but only a portion of it. If He asks you for your wealth, He will press upon you and put you to hardship, and you will be stingy with it and turn away from giving it, and what is in your hearts will become apparent. O you who believe, you are invited to spend in the cause of Allah's war against His enemies and the defense of His religion. Among you are those who are stingy with spending in Allah's cause, and whoever is stingy, he is only stingy to his own detriment. Allah is the Rich, and you are the poor. If you turn away from faith in Allah and obedience to His command, He will destroy you and bring forth another people in your place who will not be like you in turning away from Allah's command, but they will obey Him and His Messenger and strive in His cause with their wealth and lives.
question_id: - Ya.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya kehidupan dunia) maksudnya, menyibukkan diri dalam kehidupan dunia (hanyalah permainan dan senda gurau. Dan jika kalian beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya), yakni Alquran (dan takutlah kepada Allah), yakni takutlah akan azab-Nya (dan takutlah kepada-Nya), yakni takutlah akan azab-Nya (karena melaksanakan perintah-Nya) maksudnya menjauhi larangan-Nya (dan takutlah kepada azab-Nya) merasa takutlah akan azab-Nya (dan jika kalian berpaling) memalingkan diri (niscaya Dia akan mengazab kalian) membinasakan kalian (dan akan mengazab kalian dengan azab yang lain) dosa-dosa kalian.

question_en: We have certainly granted you, [O Muhammad], a clear victory. What is that clear victory?
answer_en: He is the one who made the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah or the Conquest of Mecca.
question_id: (Dan sesungguhnya Kami telah memberi kemenangan kepadamu) maksudnya Kami telah memastikan kemenangan bagimu atas kota Mekah dan kota-kota lainnya di masa mendatang secara paksa melalui jihadmu (yaitu kemenangan yang nyata) artinya, kemenangan yang jelas dan nyata.
answer_id: Dia adalah orang yang membuat Perjanjian Hudaybiyyah atau menaklukkan Mekah.

question_en: What is the name of the pledge that the Muslims took with the Prophet (PBUH), and upon what was it made?
answer_en: The Treaty of Hudaybiyyah was concluded, and it was for a truce with the pagans.
question_id: Apakah perjanjian itu atas orang-orang mukmin yang (nama) Rasul dan atas orang-orang yang (nama) mukmin?
answer_id: Perjanjian Hudaybiyyah diselesaikan, dan itu untuk gencatan senjata dengan orang kafir.

question_en: Why did the Bedouins lag behind in joining the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) in his expedition to Mecca?
answer_en: They feared the harm that Quraysh might inflict upon the Prophet (peace be upon him), and it was not as they claimed, 'We were preoccupied with our wealth and families.'
question_id: Mengapa orang-orang Badui tertinggal dalam bergabung Nabi Muhammad dalam perjalanannya ke Mekah?
answer_id: (Dan mereka khawatir) yakni orang-orang Quraisy (bahwa akan menimpakan) mendatangi (kepada nabi) yakni Nabi Muhammad saw. (suatu bencana) berupa kelaparan dan rasa takut serta hal-hal lainnya (karena mereka berkata, "Sesungguhnya kami adalah orang-orang yang disibukkan oleh harta dan keluarga kami") yaitu dengan harta benda dan anak-anak kami.

question_en: The ones who stayed behind will say, 'When you set out to take spoils, let us follow you.' They want to change the words of Allah. Say, 'You will not follow us. Thus Allah has said before.' They will say, 'Rather, you are envious of us.' But they understand little. Say to the desert Arabs who stayed behind, 'You will be called to fight a people of great might. You will fight them or they will submit. If you obey, Allah will give you a good reward. But if you turn away as you turned away before, He will afflict you with a painful punishment.' Al-Fath (The Victory), verse 15-16. Explain these noble verses.
answer_en: The hypocrites will say, 'If you, O Prophet, and your companions set out for the spoils of Khaybar, which Allah has promised you, let us go with you to Khaybar, intending thereby to change the promise of Allah.' Say to them, 'You will not go out with us to Khaybar, for Allah has already decreed that the spoils of Khaybar belong to those who were present at the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah.' They will say, 'This is not what you say.' Say, 'Rather, Allah has commanded this.' They will say, 'You are preventing us from going out with you from envy that we may share the spoils with you.' But they do not understand a thing about Allah except a little. Say to those who remain behind from the bedouins, 'You will be called to fight a people of great might in battle, or they will submit to you. If you obey Allah and His Messenger, He will grant you a great reward. But if you turn away, as you did when you refused to set out with the Messenger of Allah to Mecca, then you will incur a painful punishment.'
question_id: (Orang-orang yang tertinggal itu akan berkata) yakni mereka yang telah disebutkan tadi (apabila kalian berangkat menuju tempat barang rampasan) yang dimaksud adalah ganimah perang Khaibar (untuk mengambilnya, "Biarkanlah kami) maksudnya janganlah kalian halangi kami (mengikuti kalian") supaya kami dapat mengambil sebagian dari ganimah tersebut (mereka bermaksud) dengan sikap mereka yang demikian itu (hendak merubah keputusan Allah) menurut suatu qiraat dibaca Kalimullah artinya, janji atau ancaman-Nya. Maksudnya, mereka mengubah ancaman Allah dengan ganimah Khaibar yang khusus hanya untuk mereka yang ikut dalam baiat Ridwan di Hudaibiyah.
answer_id: (Orang-orang munafik itu berkata) kepada Nabi saw., ("Jika kamu dan orang-orang yang menyertaimu) yaitu orang-orang Mukmin (dan orang-orang mukmin) dari kalangan orang-orang kafir (maka hendaklah kamu mengeluarkan kepada mereka) artinya kepada orang-orang munafik itu (bagian dari apa yang telah dijanjikan Allah kepadamu) berupa ganimah dan lain-lainnya (dengan mengatakan) kepada mereka sebagai cemoohan ("Janganlah kamu berangkat) maksudnya janganlah kamu keluar untuk berjihad (bersama kami) artinya berjihad (dengan membawa barang rampasan." Katakanlah,) kepada mereka ("Hendaklah kamu berperang di jalan Allah) maksudnya dengan cara berjihad melawan musuh-musuhmu itu (padahal kamu sendiri tidak menyukainya.")

question_en: Explain the meaning of the verse: 'Allah was pleased with the believers when they gave their pledge to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with a nearby victory.' (Quran 48:18)
answer_en: God was pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you, O Prophet, under the tree (and this is the Pledge of Ridwan at Hudaybiyyah). God knows what is in the hearts of these believing men: their faith, sincerity, and loyalty. So, God sent down tranquility upon them, strengthened their hearts, and compensated them for what they missed at the Hudaybiyyah truce with the near victory of Khaybar.
question_id: (Dan bacakanlah) hai Muhammad (kepada mereka) yakni orang-orang kafir Mekah (kisah) berita (orang-orang yang beriman) dari kalangan penduduk Mekah ("Sesungguhnya Allah telah rida terhadap orang-orang mukmin) melalui perkataan mereka, bahwa sesungguhnya kamu adalah orang yang berpura-pura beriman (ketika mereka berjanji setia kepadamu) sungguh (di bawah pohon, maka diketahui-Nya apa yang ada di dalam hati mereka) berupa kekafiran dan kedurhakaan. (Maka Allah menurunkan ketenangan kepada mereka) yakni nikmat-nikmat (dan memberikan balasan kepada mereka dengan kemenangan yang dekat waktunya) yaitu surga.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya Allah telah rida terhadap orang-orang mukmin ketika mereka berjanji setia kepadamu) di Hudaibiyah (di bawah pohon) yaitu pohon Samurah, jumlah mereka yang menyatakan baiat itu ada seribu tiga ratus orang atau lebih.

question_en: Remember the various spoils of war mentioned in the noble verses of Al-Fath (The Victory).
answer_en: May Allah hasten the spoils of Khaybar for the Muslims, and Allah has promised you another spoil that you could not attain, and Allah, the Exalted, is capable of it, and it is under His disposal and sovereignty, and it is from Persia and Rome.
question_id: Dan ingatlah apa yang disebut-sebut dalam beberapa ayat tentang harta rampasan perang.
answer_id: Semoga Allah menyegerakan harta rampasan yang telah dijanjikan-Nya kepada orang-orang Mukmin yang ikhlas dan orang-orang yang baik. Hal itu adalah karunia yang besar dari Allah yang Dia karuniakan kepada kalian.

question_en: And if those who disbelieve attack you, they will certainly turn their backs and then they will not find a protector or a helper. That is the way of Allah which has already come to pass before, and you will not find in the way of Allah any change. (22-23) Al-Fath. Recall the way of Allah in these noble verses.
answer_en: The year of Allah that He has decreed before is the defeat of the disbelievers and the victory of the believers in truth.
question_id: Dan jika orang-orang kafir menyerang kamu, niscaya mereka berbalik melarikan diri ke belakang, kemudian mereka tiada memperoleh pelindung dan tidak (pula) penolong bagi mereka selain dari Allah. Itulah sunnah Allah yang telah berlaku terhadap orang-orang yang dahulu, dan kamu sekali-kali tidak akan mendapat perubahan bagi sunnah Allah.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang beriman dan beramal saleh) kalimat ini menjadi mubtada sedangkan khabarnya ialah (alangkah bahagianya) lafal thuubaa mashdar daripada lafal ath-thiib, adalah nama sebuah pohon di surga, seseorang yang berkendaraan tidak akan dapat menempuh naungannya sekali pun berjalan seratus tahun (bagi orang-orang yang beriman) karena sesungguhnya tempat kembali mereka adalah neraka Jahanam.

question_en: And He is the One who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them within Makkah after He had given you victory over them. And Allah is Ever All-Seer of what you do. (24) Al-Fath. Interpret this verse.
answer_en: He is the One who restrained the hands of the disbelievers from you and your hands from them at the heart of Makkah after you had despaired of them. Thus, they were left under your authority. (These disbelievers are those who rebelled against the army of the Messenger of Allah at the Battle of Uhud, but the Muslims captured them, and the Prophet, peace be upon him, forgave them and let them go, which led to a peace treaty. They were about eighty men.) And Allah was with your actions, seeing all that you did, and nothing is hidden from Him.
question_id: Dan Dialah yang menahan tangan mereka dari (membinasakan) kamu dan (menahan) tangan kamu dari (membinasakan) mereka di tengah kota Mekah sesudah Allah memenangkan kamu atas mereka, dan adalah Allah Maha Melihat apa yang kamu kerjakan.
answer_id: Dan Dialah yang menahan tangan orang-orang kafir dari (membinasakan) kamu dan (menahan) tangan kamu dari (membinasakan) mereka di tengah kota Mekah sesudah kamu putus asa dari mereka, maka Dia mengampuni mereka dan melepaskan mereka dari kekuasaan-Nya. Dan Allah Maha Melihat apa yang kamu kerjakan.

question_en: They are the ones who disbelieved and drove you out from the Sacred Mosque and prevented the offering from reaching its destination, had it not been for some believing men and women whom you did not know, you might have trampled them without knowing and thus incurred a sinful act. Allah will admit into His mercy whoever He wills. If they had separated, We would have certainly punished those who disbelieved among them with a painful punishment. When those who disbelieved put arrogance in their hearts, Allah sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and upon the believers and imposed upon them the word of righteousness, and they were more deserving of it and worthy of it. Indeed, Allah is all-knowing of all things. Verily, Allah has fulfilled His Messenger's vision in truth: 'You shall indeed enter the Sacred Mosque, Allah willing, in security, your heads shaved and hair cut short, and you shall not fear.' He knew what you did not know and made for you a near victory.
answer_en: The disbelievers of Quraysh are those who denied the oneness of God, hindered you from entering the Sacred Mosque on the day of Hudaybiyyah, prevented the sacrifice, and detained it from reaching its destination, which is the sacred place. If it were not for some oppressed believers, men and women, living among these disbelievers in Mecca, concealing their faith out of fear for themselves, you would not have known them, lest you attack them with your army and kill them, and thus incur bloodshed, sin, and blame without knowledge. But We have given you power over them. God will show mercy to whomever He wills and guide them to faith after disbelief. If these believers and believing women had distinguished themselves from the polytheists of Mecca and left them, We would have punished those who disbelieved and rejected them with a painful, severe punishment. Those who disbelieved have in their hearts the arrogance of paganism, so they will not accept the message of Muhammad, peace be upon him. Among these things is their refusal to write in the Treaty of Hudaybiyyah 'In the name of God, the Most Merciful, the Most Compassionate,' and their refusal to write what Muhammad, the Messenger of God, had judged. God sent down tranquility upon His messenger and the believers with him and made it obligatory for them to say, 'There is no god but God,' which is the foundation of all piety. The Messenger, peace be upon him, and the believers with him were more deserving of this word of piety than the polytheists, and they were more entitled to it. God is all-knowing; nothing is hidden from Him. God has indeed fulfilled His messenger Muhammad's vision that he and his companions would enter the Sacred House safely, without fear of the polytheists, who would cut off their heads and mutilate them. God knows what is good and beneficial for you (in turning you away from Mecca that year and entering it later), and He has made for you, instead of entering Mecca, a near victory, which is the truce of Hudaybiyyah and the conquest of Khaybar.
question_id: (Merekalah orang-orang yang kafir yang menghalangi kalian dari Masjidilharam) yakni menghalangi kalian untuk memasukinya (dan hewan kurban) diathafkan kepada Dhamir Kum yang ada pada lafal Washadduukum (dalam keadaan tidak beriman) kepada Nabi saw. (kepada orang-orang yang kalian tidak mengetahuinya) yakni orang-orang mukmin yang dimaksud adalah orang-orang mukmin (maka Allah akan memasukkan orang-orang yang dikehendaki-Nya ke dalam rahmat-Nya) lafal ayat ini diathafkan kepada lafal Hum yang terdapat pada lafal Hum yang keberadaannya diperkirakan, sedangkan lafal sesudahnya berkedudukan menjadi Badal atau kata keterangan keadaan. (Dan jika mereka berpisah-pisah) terpisah dari orang-orang mukmin (dengan orang-orang kafir di antara mereka) lafal ayat ini menjadi Mubtada (sesungguhnya Allah Maha Mengetahui segala sesuatu) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar dari Dhamir yang terdapat pada ayat ini dijelaskan oleh firman-Nya: (pastilah Dia akan memasukkan ke dalam hati kalian) ke dalam surga dan janganlah kalian kepada mereka.
answer_id: (Orang-orang yang kafir) dari kalangan penduduk Mekah; lafal ayat ini berkedudukan menjadi Mubtada (adalah orang-orang yang menghalangi kalian) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar Mubtada (untuk memasuki Masjidilharam) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada yang keberadaannya diperkirakan keberadaannya, yaitu lafal ayat berkedudukan menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (untuk menjadikan orang-orang yang dimurkai Allah) menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (sebagai pemimpin) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (bagi orang-orang yang beriman) lafal ayat ini menjadi Khabar Mubtada (dan bagi orang-orang yang kafir) di samping Allah (di antara mereka) yakni bagi orang-orang mukmin (di antara mereka) orang-orang Yahudi dan orang-orang mukmin (adakan yang lebih dekat kepada mereka) yakni Allah swt.

question_en: Explain the verse: 'Muhammad is the messenger of Allah, and those with him are harsh against the disbelievers and merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating, seeking Allah's favor and His pleasure. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration. That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a seed which sends forth its shoot, then makes it strong, it becomes thick and stands straight upon its stalk, delighting the sowers - that He may enrage by them the disbelievers. Allah has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward.' (Quran 48:29)
answer_en: Muhammad is the messenger of Allah, and those who are with him on his religion are stern against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves, you see them bowing and prostrating themselves in prayer, seeking the favor of their Lord, that He may grant them His mercy, and admit them into gardens beneath which rivers flow, and He will be pleased with them. Their mark is on their faces from the trace of prostration, this is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a seed which sends forth its shoot, then makes it strong, and it becomes thick and stands straight on its stem, delighting the sowers, that by it He may enrage the disbelievers through them. And in this is a sign of the disbelief of those who hate the companions - may Allah be pleased with them - because whoever Allah has enraged by the companions, then he has been found guilty of that, and it is disbelief. And Allah has promised those who believed among them, and did righteous deeds, forgiveness and a great reward, which is the Garden. (And Allah's promise is true, and whoever follows the way of the companions - may Allah be pleased with them - he is in their ruling in attaining forgiveness and a great reward, and they have the virtue, the precedence, and the perfection which no one from this nation will attain, may Allah be pleased with them and grant them peace).
question_id: (Dan bacakanlah) hai Muhammad (kepada mereka) yakni orang-orang Yahudi (berita) kabar (bahwa sesungguhnya Muhammad itu adalah utusan Allah) menurut suatu qiraat dibaca An-Naifun dengan dikasrahkan huruf Hamzahnya, sehingga bacaannya menjadi An-Nazzaa (dan orang-orang yang bersama dengan dia) yakni orang-orang musyrik (menjadi keras kepala) artinya mereka selalu bersikap keras (terhadap orang-orang kafir) di antara mereka (lalu kamu lihat mereka rukuk dan sujud) artinya mereka melakukan salat (dan sujud) di tengah-tengah (mencari karunia Allah) maksudnya di tengah-tengah (dan keridaan-Nya) berupa keridaan-Nya karena mengharapkan ampunan-Nya. (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang beriman di antara mereka) yang beriman kepada Allah (serta orang-orang yang mengerjakan amal saleh) yakni orang-orang yang saleh (sebagai pahala yang besar) bagi orang-orang yang mendatangkan ampunan bagi mereka.
answer_id: (Muhammad itu) lafal ayat ini berkedudukan menjadi Mubtada (adalah utusan Allah) menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (dan orang-orang yang bersama dengan agama-Nya) menjadi Khabar dari Mubtada (mereka masuk ke dalam surga yang di bawahnya mengalir sungai-sungai, kalian lihat mereka) diathafkan kepada lafal ayat ini ialah ayat yang disitir oleh firman-Nya, "Ya Rabb kami! Sebaliknya, orang-orang yang ingkar."

question_en: What is the meaning of 'Do not put (anything) before Allah and His Messenger' in verse 1 of Surah Al-Hujurat?
answer_en: Do not innovate in the religion what Allah and His Messenger have not commanded you.
question_id: (Mengapa tidak) (diturunkan kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya) yang menyampaikan Alquran (sebagai perumpamaan) sebagaimana yang telah dijelaskan oleh firman-Nya, "Sesungguhnya aku hanya seorang pemberi peringatan." (Q.S. Al-Anbiya, 98).
answer_id: Dan janganlah kamu mengikuti hawa nafsu dalam urusan agama yang Allah dan Rasul-Nya.

question_en: Recite the verses that emphasize lowering one's voice in the presence of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him).
answer_en: O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet, nor speak loudly to him as you speak to one another, lest your deeds become nullified without you realizing it. Verily, those who lower their voices in the presence of Allah's Messenger, they are those whom Allah has tested their hearts for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and a great reward.
question_id: Bacalah ayat-ayat yang menekankan menurunkan suara seseorang di hadapan Nabi Muhammad SAW.
answer_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman, janganlah kamu meninggikan suaramu melebihi suara Nabi, dan janganlah kamu berkata kepadanya dengan suara yang keras, sebagaimana kerasnya suara sebagian kamu terhadap sebagian yang lain, supaya tidak hapus (pahala) amalanmu, sedangkan mereka tidak menyadari. Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang merendahkan suaranya di sisi Rasulullah, mereka itulah orang-orang yang telah diuji hati mereka oleh Allah untuk bertakwa dan memperoleh pahala yang besar.

question_en: What is the obligation to do when two groups of believers are fighting each other?
answer_en: And if two groups from among the believers fight each other, make peace between them. But if one of them transgresses against the other, fight against the transgressing one until it returns to the command of Allah. Then if it returns, make peace between them with justice and act equitably. Indeed, Allah loves those who act equitably.
question_id: Apa yang harus dilakukan jika dua kelompok orang Mukmin saling berkelahi?
answer_id: (Dan jika ada dua golongan dari orang-orang mukmin) hingga akhir ayat. Ayat ini diturunkan berkenaan dengan suatu masalah, yaitu bahwa Nabi saw. pada suatu hari menaiki keledai kendaraannya, lalu ia melewati Ibnu Ubay.

question_en: O you who believe, do not mock other people, for they may be better than you. Do not mock women, for they may be better than your women. Do not insult yourselves or call each other by offensive names. Bad is the name that is earned after faith. And those who do not repent are the wrongdoers. O you who believe, avoid much suspicion, for indeed, some suspicion is a sin. And do not spy on one another or backbite each other. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would detest it. And fear Allah, for Allah is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.
answer_en: O you who believe in Allah and His Messenger and do righteous deeds: do not make fun of other believers, for he who is made fun of might be better than the one who makes fun. And do not make fun of believing women, for they might be better than you. Do not mock one another. And do not call each other by offensive nicknames. Offensive nicknames are sinful and hateful. Avoid much suspicion of the believers, for some suspicion is a sin. Do not spy on the private affairs of Muslims. And do not backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? You would hate that, so hate to eat his flesh.
question_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman, janganlah kamu saling mengejek dan saling menghinakan. Seburuk-buruk panggilan bagi orang Mukmin adalah apabila mereka dipanggil dengan kata-kata fasik setelah mereka beriman.
answer_id: Hai orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan Rasul-Nya dan mengerjakan amal yang saleh, janganlah kamu saling mengolok-olok dan mengejek orang-orang yang mengolok-olok.

question_en: What is Allah's criterion for distinguishing between people?
answer_en: Indeed, the most honorable among you in the sight of Allah is the most righteous.
question_id: Apakah hukum jahiliah yang telah ditetapkan Allah untuk memutuskan perkara di antara manusia?
answer_id: Sesungguhnya orang yang paling mulia derajatnya di sisi Allah adalah orang yang paling bertakwa di antara kalian.

question_en: What does 'لَا يَلِتْكُم' mean in verse 14 of Surah Al-Hujurat?
answer_en: You lack nothing.
question_id: Apa artinya "Sara Al-Hujurat"?
answer_id: Kau tidak kekurangan apa-apa.

question_en: And the palm-trees, with their clusters of dates hanging down, like tents, full of fruits. (Quran 50:10) - Explain this verse.
answer_en: And He caused us to grow palm trees with long stems, some of which bear fruit above others.
question_id: dan pohon kurma yang mempunyai mayang yang bersusun-susun, dan pohon kurma yang mempunyai mayang yang bersusun-susun,
answer_id: Dan Dia menumbuhkan pohon palem dengan batang panjang, beberapa dari yang menghasilkan buah di atas yang lain.

question_en: Who are the People of the Scripture?
answer_en: They were living there with their cattle, worshipping idols, and their prophet was said to be Hanthalah bin Safwan, or someone else. Before them, the people of Noah, the people of the Rass, and Thamud disbelieved.
question_id: (Dan siapakah) Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir atau menetapkan (golongan yang) yakni orang-orang (nabi-nabi dan orang-orang yang diberi kitab) mereka adalah orang-orang Yahudi dan Nasrani (dan orang-orang yang mendustakan) rasul-rasul mereka.
answer_id: (Dan sesungguhnya mereka telah berdiam di tempat itu) di tempat-tempat tinggal mereka (dengan binatang-binatang ternak mereka) menurut suatu pendapat dikatakan, bahwa yang dimaksud adalah berhala-berhala (untuk berhala-berhala) yang mereka sembah (dan untuk berhala-berhala) sebagaimana yang telah disebutkan tadi (dikatakan kepada nabi mereka) sewaktu mereka menyekutukan Allah swt.: ("Hendaklah kamu menjadi saksi.") sebagaimana yang telah diungkapkan oleh ayat yang lain, yaitu, firman-Nya, "Sesungguhnya kamu adalah orang-orang yang lalim." (Q.S. Al-Ahqarah, 31).

question_en: Who are the people of the cave and those with them?
answer_en: The people of Aykah and the people of Tubba' - each rejected the messengers, so the decree has become due upon them.
question_id: Siapa orang-orang dari gua dan orang-orang yang bersama mereka?
answer_id: Sebelum mereka, telah banyak umat yang mendustakan para rasul, seperti kaum Nabi Nûh, penduduk Rass, kaum Tsamûd, kaum 'Ad, Fir'aun, kaum Nabi Lûth, penduduk Aykah, dan kaum Tubba'. Mereka semua telah mendustakan para rasul yang diutus kepada mereka.

question_en: Is it not clear to us that the first creation is better, or are they in confusion about a new creation?
answer_en: Did we not create the first man from clay, then we made him a sperm in a firm lodging? So, we are able to bring him into a new creation, but they are in doubt about the resurrection.
question_id: Dan apakah tidak jelas bagi kami bahwa penciptaan yang pertama adalah lebih baik, ataukah mereka dalam keadaan ragu-ragu tentang penciptaan yang baru?
answer_id: (Bukankah Kami telah menciptakan manusia pertama dari tanah) yakni dari tanah liat (kemudian Kami jadikan dia berada di tempat yang tetap) di muka bumi (maka sesungguhnya Kami akan mengembalikannya) mengembalikannya (kepada penciptaan yang baru) yaitu pada hari berbangkit (dan sesungguhnya mereka) orang-orang yang kafir itu (benar-benar dalam keraguan yang menggelisahkan terhadap adanya hari berbangkit) artinya, kami benar-benar ragu terhadap adanya hari berbangkit.

question_en: Please explain the meaning of these verses.
answer_en: Indeed, We have created man and We know what his own self whispers to him, and We are closer to him than his jugular vein. When the angels, recording, sit on his right and his left, recording his deeds. That on his right records his good deeds, and that on his left records his sins. Whatever he speaks, an angel is present, recording it, an angel appointed for that purpose. And the intense horror of the Day of Judgment has come, the truth that cannot be turned away or escaped. That which you, O man, have been fleeing from. The trumpet will be blown for the second blast, that blast on the Day of Promise, which Allah promised the disbelievers. And every soul will come with it two angels, one driving it to the gathering, and the other testifying against it for what it did in the world, good or evil. Indeed, you were heedless of this, O man, but We have removed your cover from you, so today your sight is strong. And the recording angel will say, 'This is what I have of his record, and it is with me, preserved, present.' Allah will say to the driving and recording angels, after they have separated the people, 'Throw every stubborn disbeliever into the Hellfire, the one who disbelieved and turned away from the truth, who withheld what was due to others, transgressed against Allah's servants and His limits, doubted His promise and threat, who associated others with Allah, so worshipped with Him another besides Him, created from His creation, so throw him into the severe punishment of the Hellfire.' His companion, who was with him in the world, will say, 'Our Lord, we did not guide him, but he was in a far astray.' Allah will say, 'Do not dispute with me today, the Day of Reckoning and Account, for there is no benefit in that. I have already warned you in the world with the threat for those who disbelieved in me and defied me. My decision will not be changed, and I do not punish anyone for the sin of another. No, I punish only when the proof against him is established.' Remember, O Messenger, to remind your people on the Day when We will say to the Hellfire, 'Have you been filled?' And it will say, 'Are there more to come?' Then the Lord, the Exalted, will place His foot into it, and it will shrink back from it, and it will say, 'Enough, enough.'
question_id: Tolong jelaskan arti ayat - ayat ini.
answer_id: Sesungguhnya Kami telah menciptakan manusia dan mengetahui apa yang dibisikkan oleh hatinya, dan Kami lebih dekat kepadanya dari pada urat lehernya sendiri, sedang malaikat itu memberitahukan kepada (pembicaraan) malaikat-malaikat (yang diutus) untuk menyampaikannya kepada manusia (Muhammad) di hari kiamat. Dan tidak ada yang dapat menghilangkan rahmat-Nya dari kamu dan (tidak pula) melainkan dia sendiri.

question_en: What are the two necessary and interconnected things required for entering paradise?
answer_en: Fear of Allah in this world and the meeting with Him on the Day of Judgment with a repentant heart from sins. And Paradise will be brought near for the righteous, not far. This is what you are promised for every repentant, watchful one. He who fears Allah in secret and comes with a heart that returns [to Him]. Enter it in peace, that is the Day of Eternity.
question_id: Apa dua hal yang diperlukan dan saling berkaitan yang dibutuhkan untuk memasuki firdaus?
answer_id: Dan bertakwalah kepada Allah di dunia ini dan pada hari kiamat; dan pada hari itu Allah menerima taubatnya; dan pada sisi-Nya ada surga yang dekat (kitab-Nya) bagi orang-orang yang bertakwa. Itulah hari yang dijanjikan kepada orang-orang yang bertaubat, dan barangsiapa yang bertakwa kepada Allah dengan hati yang bersih, maka masuklah ia ke dalam surga itu dengan aman sentosa.

question_en: What is the 'more' mentioned in the verse?
answer_en: More is: Looking towards the face of the Most Merciful.
question_id: Apa 'lebih' yang disebutkan dalam ayat itu?
answer_id: (Ingatlah), ketika melihat wajah Tuhan Yang Maha Pemurah,

question_en: And how many generations have We destroyed before them, who were stronger than them in prowess? Do they not traverse the land to see the fate of those who were before them? Indeed, in that there is a clear reminder for anyone who has a heart or who listens while being attentive. (Q.69:36-37) What is the meaning of these noble verses?
answer_en: Indeed, the destruction of past generations serves as a lesson for those who possess a heart that understands, or ears that listen, being present-minded, neither heedless nor neglectful.
question_id: Dan berapa banyaknya umat-umat yang telah Kami binasakan sebelum mereka yang mereka itu lebih besar kekuatannya daripada mereka ini, maka apakah mereka tidak mengadakan perjalanan di muka bumi lalu memperhatikan betapa kesudahan orang-orang yang sebelum mereka.
answer_id: Memang, kehancuran generasi - generasi yang lalu menjadi pelajaran bagi orang yang memiliki hati yang memahami, atau telinga yang mendengarkan, yang berpikir sekarang, tidak lalai dan tidak melalaikan.

question_en: Recite the noble verse that proves the validity of glorifying Allah after prayers.
answer_en: And from the night, glorify Him and [at] the ends of prostration.
question_id: Bacalah ayat-ayat al-Qur'ân yang menerangkan hukum-hukum syariat Allah setelah diikrarkan dan ditutur-Nya. Sucikanlah Allah dari segala sifat yang tidak layak bagi diri-Nya sejak dini hari hingga akhir malam.
answer_id: (Dan pada sebagian malam hari bertasbihlah) pengertian bertasbih di sini adalah tasbih hakiki yaitu membaca, 'Subhaanallaah Wa bihamdihii' (dan pada bagian siang hari) lafal Idbaar adalah bentuk Mashdar, yakni lakukanlah salat subuh (dan pada waktu-waktu di waktu fajar) yakni mulai dari malam hari (bertasbih pulalah) yaitu salat Magrib dan salat Isyaklah kamu.

question_en: And listen on the day when the announcer will call out from a nearby place. What is this day? Who is the announcer? Where is this nearby place? And what is the announcement?
answer_en: It is the Day of Judgment, and the announcer is the King, Israfil (peace be upon him). The place is the Rock of Jerusalem, the closest place on Earth to Heaven. The call is for Israfil (peace be upon him) to say, 'O you bones, and scattered ashes, and dispersed spirits, Allah commands you to gather for the reckoning.'
question_id: (Dan dengarkanlah) hai orang yang diajak bicara akan seruan-Ku ini (pada hari penyeru menyeru) yakni malaikat Israfil (dari tempat yang dekat) dari langit, yaitu dari atas Kubbah Shakhr di Baitulmakdis, karena tempat itu yang paling dekat dengan langit. Ia menyerukan kata-kata, "Hai tulang-belulang yang telah hancur dan sendi-sendi yang telah bercerai-berai dan daging-daging yang telah tercabik-cabik dan rambut-rambut yang telah berantakan!
answer_id: (Dikatakan kepada mereka): "Hendaklah kamu menjadi orang-orang yang aman sentosa di muka bumi, kecuali jika kamu benar-benar orang-orang yang bertakwa.

question_en: What does Allah swear by in these noble verses? And the bearers of burdens (dhariyat), [they bear them] with difficulty (dharr), {1} And those [pregnant] who carry [the fetus] with ease, {2} And those who are responsible for distributing [provisions], {4} The bearers of burdens.
answer_en: By Allah, the Exalted, I swear by the winds that stir the dust, by the clouds that carry a great weight of water, by the ships that sail through the seas with ease, and by the angels who carry out Allah's commands in His creation.
question_id: (Mengapa Allah bersumpah dengan memakai tanda-tanda yang nyata) yakni dengan memakai bahasa Arab, ada pula yang mengatakan dengan memakai bahasa Arab, ada pula dengan memakai bahasa Arab, ada pula jamak, ada pula yang dengan memakai ya, ada pula yang dengan memakai alif dan ada pula yang dengan memakai alif dan ada pula yang tidak. (Demikian itu) maksudnya apa yang telah disebutkan itu (adalah karunia Allah yang diberikan-Nya kepada siapa yang dikehendaki-Nya) untuk menerima tobatnya (dan mereka) artinya orang-orang yang mempunyai sifat-sifat demikian itu (tidak akan memikul dosa sedikit pun kecuali orang-orang yang berdosa) yakni orang-orang yang berdosa tidak akan memikul dosa-dosa orang-orang yang akan memikul dosa orang-orang yang berdosa, yaitu orang-orang yang berdosa, oleh sebab orang-orang yang berdosa tidak akan memikul dosa orang-orang yang berdosa.
answer_id: (Demi Allah yang Maha Tinggi) dari main-main dan hal-hal lainnya yang tidak layak bagi kebesaran-Nya (demi angin yang mengandung hujan) yakni angin yang membawa air hujan (lebih besar dari itu) daripada bintang-bintang itu (dan yang berlayar di lautan) sehingga permukaannya menjadi debu yang beterbangan. (Dan malaikat-malaikat) yakni malaikat-malaikat yang berada di langit (dengan perintah Allah) dengan perintah-Nya (dengan perintah-Nya) dengan perintah dari-Nya (dan dengan perintah-perintah-Nya) dengan perintah-Nya.

question_en: What is the meaning of: (وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ) ?
answer_en: Indeed, reckoning and reward are inevitable for one's deeds.
question_id: Apa arti dari: (terjemah)?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya pembalasan itu) yakni pembalasan sesudah hisab (hanyalah bagi orang-orang yang bertakwa) bagi orang-orang yang takut akan azab Allah swt.

question_en: And the sky, with its curves. What is the meaning of: (Al-Hubuki)?
answer_en: A woman's path is like a path in the desert, with no clear way or guide in creation.
question_id: (Dan langit serta pembinaannya.)
answer_id: Jalan seorang wanita seperti jalan di padang pasir, dengan cara yang tidak jelas atau panduan dalam penciptaan.

question_en: Indeed, you are in a differing statement. He who is misled is misled by it. 'The ravagers were killed.' Those who are in heedlessness, lost. Explain these blessed verses from the chapter Al-Dhariyat.
answer_en: You, O liars, are indeed in a state of confusion regarding this Quran and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). Those who turn away from the Quran and the Messenger (peace be upon him) have indeed turned away from faith in them, due to their disregard for the clear proofs and evidences of Allah, and thus they have not been guided to goodness. Cursed are the liars, the unjust who deviate from the truth, they are heedless and excessive in their disbelief and misguidance.
question_id: (Sesungguhnya kamu) khithab ini ditujukan kepada Nabi saw. (benar-benar dalam keadaan berbeda pendapat) yakni terkadang kamu menjadi orang-orang yang musyrik (dan sesungguhnya telah disesatkan oleh orang-orang yang melampaui batas) yakni orang-orang kafir.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang berpaling dari Alquran) dari beriman kepada Nabi Muhammad saw. (dan rasul) diathafkan kepada lafal alladziina pada ayat selanjutnya (benar-benar berada dalam kesesatan yang nyata) yakni jelas sesatnya. (Demikianlah) sebagaimana disesatkan-Nya orang yang berpaling itu (orang-orang yang lalim itu) yakni orang-orang yang kafir (berada dalam kesesatan yang jauh) yakni kesesatan yang jauh (dan mereka sesat dari jalan yang lurus) yakni tuntunan yang benar.

question_en: What does 'يَهْجَعُونَ' mean in Surah Adh-Dhariyat (The Winds), verse 17?
answer_en: They are sleeping.
question_id: Apa arti dari Surah Adhariyat (Angin), ayat 17?
answer_id: Mereka sedang tidur.

question_en: Upon what does the word (he) in the verse refer?
answer_en: God Almighty has promised people that they will be held accountable for their deeds.
question_id: Istifham atau kata tanya di sini mengandung makna Taqrir. Kemudian Allah menjelaskannya melalui firman berikutnya:
answer_id: Allah telah menjanjikan kepada manusia bahwa mereka akan ditanya tentang apa yang mereka kerjakan.

question_en: Who is the knowledgeable boy that the angels announced to Ibrahim (peace be upon him) from the Dhariyat?
answer_en: He is Isaac, peace be upon him.
question_id: Siapakah yang melahirkan anak laki-laki yang cerdas seperti al-Qur'ân, ketika menyampaikan pesan-pesan sucinya kepada Ibrâhîm?
answer_id: Dia Isaac, kedamaian baginya.

question_en: Then his wife approached in tears, and she wiped her face and said, 'An old, barren woman!' (Interpret the verse from Surah Al-Dhariyat, verse 29).
answer_en: When Sarah heard the news of the angels' message, she approached them in surprise, slapped her face in disbelief, and said, 'How can I give birth when I am an old woman who has never conceived?'
question_id: (Kemudian istrinya datang) yakni Siti Sarah (seraya memekik) karena tercengang, berkedudukan menjadi Hal; yakni Siti Sarah datang seraya memekik karena kaget (lalu menepuk mukanya sendiri) menampar mukanya sendiri (seraya berkata, "Aku adalah seorang perempuan tua yang mandul") yang tidak dapat melahirkan anak sama sekali, pada saat itu umur Sarah mencapai sembilan puluh sembilan tahun, sedangkan Nabi Ibrahim seratus tahun; atau umur Nabi Ibrahim pada saat itu seratus dua puluh tahun, sedangkan umur Siti Sarah sembilan puluh tahun.
answer_id: Maka tatkala (para malaikat) mendengar kabar gembira itu, dia datang kepada mereka (Muhammad) dengan membawa (membawa) tanda-tanda (mukjizat) dan dia berkata: "Bagaimana aku akan melahirkan seorang perempuan tua, padahal aku belum pernah melahirkan seorang perempuan?"

question_en: What does 'مُسَوَّمَةً' mean in the verse: 'So send against them a rain of clay [bricks] from which they will be created like scattered moths (33) by your Lord for the transgressors (34) [from Surah Al-Dhariat]?'
answer_en: Anything thrown with it is marked with its name.
question_id: Apa maksudnya "Apa arti dari ayat itu," "Jadi kirimkan hujan dari tanah liat yang akan mereka ciptakan seperti ngengat yang tersebar (33) oleh Tuhanmu untuk para pelanggar (34) [dari Surah Al-Dhariat]? "
answer_id: Apa pun yang dilemparkan dengan itu ditandai dengan namanya.

question_en: Was anyone from the people of Lot (peace be upon him) safe except for his household?
answer_en: We found in the city only the house of Lot (peace be upon him), for indeed, there was no household that believed among his people except his household, and his wife was among those who disbelieved.
question_id: (Apakah) lafal Am di sini bermakna Istifham, maksudnya, apakah (dia) yakni Nabi Luth tidak mengapa (diselamatkan) dapat dibaca Tahqiq dan Tas-hil, artinya selamat (oleh tamu-tamu) Nabi Luth (selain dari tamu-tamunya) selain Nabi Luth dan kedua orang putrinya.
answer_id: (Dan Kami tidak mendapati negeri itu, kecuali rumah-rumah kaum Luth) yang dimaksud adalah rumah-rumah para penduduknya, mereka adalah kaum Nabi Luth (yang telah beriman kepadanya. Tidak ada yang beriman kepadanya kecuali pengikut-pengikutnya.

question_en: In Surah Al-Zukhruf, Allah says about Pharaoh: 'So We took him and his hosts and threw them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.' What is the meaning of: '(وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ)'?
answer_en: Indeed, it is He who sends down to you [O Muhammad] the Qur'an. Those who disbelieve in Allah's signs will have a severe punishment, and Allah is not unaware of what they do.
question_id: Di Surah Al-Zukhruf, Allah berkata tentang Firaun: 'Jadi kami membawa dia dan pasukannya dan melemparkan mereka ke laut, dan dia patut disalahkan.' Apa artinya:'?
answer_id: Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang kafir kepada ayat-ayat Allah akan memperoleh siksa yang berat; dan Allah sekali-kali tidak lengah dari apa yang mereka kerjakan.

question_en: The word 'firah' usually means fleeing or moving away from something, except for fleeing to Allah in the verse: 'So flee to Allah. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.' (50: The Throngs). But how do we flee to Allah?
answer_en: One of those who have turned from the wrath of Allah to His mercy by believing in Him and His Messenger, and following His commands and acting in obedience.
question_id: (Sesungguhnya aku seorang pemberi peringatan yang nyata dari Allah untuk kalian) aku adalah seorang pemberi peringatan yang jelas lagi gamblang.
answer_id: Dan barangsiapa yang menukar Allah dengan rahmat-Nya dan Rasul-Nya dengan orang-orang yang beriman kepada Allah dan taat kepada-Nya, maka mereka itu adalah orang-orang yang mendapat kemurkaan dari Allah dan mereka itulah orang-orang yang mendapat petunjuk.

question_en: What is the purpose behind the creation of humans and jinn?
answer_en: Worshipping Allah alone is the true purpose of life, as guided by the Messengers, and I have created the jinn and mankind only to worship Me.
question_id: Apa tujuan di balik penciptaan manusia dan jin?
answer_id: (Dan Aku tidak menciptakan jin dan manusia melainkan supaya mereka menyembah-Ku) pengertian dalam ayat ini sama sekali tidak bertentangan dengan kenyataan, bahwa orang-orang kafir tidak menyembah-Nya. Karena sesungguhnya tujuan dari ayat ini tidaklah memastikan keberadaannya.

question_en: Explain the meanings of the verses: 'Indeed, those who have wronged will have a punishment similar to that of their peers; so do not rush them. Woe to those who disbelieved from the day they were promised!' (The Dhaariyat, verses 59-60)
answer_en: Indeed, those who wronged by disbelieving in the Messenger Muhammad (peace be upon him) will have a share of Allah's torment, which will come upon them like the share of those who passed before them. They should not hasten the torment, for it will certainly come to them. Woe and sorrow await those who disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger on the day they were promised the torment, which is the Day of Resurrection.
question_id: Maka janganlah kamu tinggalkan sikapmu yang berbeda dengan orang-orang yang mendustakan. Mereka menginginkan agar kamu sedikit bersikap lunak terhadap mereka sehingga mereka pun akan bersikap lunak terhadapmu sebagai balasan atas sikapmu.
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang lalim terhadap rasul) seperti Abu Jahal dan lain-lainnya (mereka mendapat bagian dari siksa Allah) yaitu dengan dibunuh dan ditawan (dan bagi orang-orang yang kafir) yang dimaksud adalah umat-umat terdahulu (seperti keadaan orang-orang yang telah terdahulu) seperti orang-orang Yahudi dan Nasrani (dari umat-umat terdahulu) dari kalangan orang-orang Yahudi (maka janganlah mereka meminta disegerakan azab, karena sesungguhnya telah datang kepada mereka azab kepada mereka) dengan segera (dan kecelakaan yang besar) azab yang keras (disebabkan kekafiran mereka) oleh sebab keingkaran mereka terhadap Nabi saw. (pada hari kiamat.

question_en: What is the stage that Allah (SWT) swore by?
answer_en: He is the mountain that God, the Exalted, spoke to Moses on.
question_id: Apakah (patut) untuk Allah Yang Maha Tinggi?
answer_id: (Dan sesungguhnya dia) yakni Alquran itu (benar-benar gunung yang di dalamnya terdapat Tuhan Yang Maha Esa dan Tuhan Yang Maha Suci) dari semua apa yang tidak layak bagi keagungan dan kebesaran-Nya (lagi Maha Tinggi) di atas semua makhluk-Nya.

question_en: In the holy verses, what has Allah sworn by in the phrase 'Wa al-Touri' and what is the answer to the oath?
answer_en: I swear by Allah, the Exalted, by Mount Sinai, by the revealed Book, by the distant House, by the sky, and by the guarded sea. And the answer to the oath is that the punishment of your Lord, O Messenger, will indeed come upon the disbelievers.
question_id: Dalam ayat-ayat al-Qur'ân ini, Allah sungguh Maha Mengetahui segala kesungguhan dan ketentuan hukum yang terkandung di dalamnya.
answer_id: (Demi Allah Yang Maha Tinggi) lafal Al-Wail ini adalah Mashdar yang berfungsi mengukuhkan makna jumlah kalimat sebelumnya, yaitu (demi Thursina) nama sebuah bukit tempat Allah swt. (yang menurunkan Alkitab) yakni Alquran (dari Alquran) yakni Lohmahfuz (berupa rumah yang jauh) jauh dari rahmat-Nya (di langit dan di laut) laut, yang dimaksud adalah rumah Allah swt. (dan yang berkuasa atasnya) atas demikian pula bagi orang-orang kafir (maka sesungguhnya azab Rabbmu pasti akan dijatuhkan kepada orang-orang yang kafir) yakni Allah pasti akan mengazab orang-orang kafir.

question_en: And those who believe, and their descendants follow them in faith, We will join with them their descendants, and We will not decrease any of their deeds. Every person is held responsible for what they have earned. Explain the verse 21 of Surah At-Tur.
answer_en: And those who believe, and their descendants follow them in faith, We will join them with their descendants in their homes of bliss. Even if their parents did not do good deeds, We will not reduce the reward of their deeds in the least. Every person is responsible for his own actions, and no burden is shared by another.
question_id: Dan orang-orang yang beriman dan berhak untuk memperoleh derajat yang tinggi lalu diikuti oleh anak cucu mereka dalam beriman, dan anak cucu itu belum mencapai derajat yang dicapai oleh bapak-bapak mereka, maka Kami akan menghubungkan mereka dengan anak cucu mereka itu, agar mereka dapat bergembira dengan anak cucunya. Kami tidak akan mengurangi pahala perbuatan mereka sedikit pun, dan bapak tidak akan membawa kesalahan anak cucu mereka sedikit pun, karena setiap manusia bertanggung jawab atas perbuatannya sendiri dan orang lain tidak akan dihukum karenanya.
answer_id: (Dan orang-orang yang beriman) berkedudukan menjadi Mubtada (dan mereka diikuti) menurut suatu qiraat dibaca Wa-atba'naahum yakni, Kami ikutkan kepada mereka, Di'athafkan kepada lafal Amanuu (oleh anak cucu mereka) menurut suatu qiraat dibaca Dzurriyyatahum, dalam bentuk Mufrad; artinya oleh keturunan mereka, baik yang masih kecil maupun yang sudah dewasa (dalam keimanan) maksudnya, diikuti oleh anak cucu mereka keimanannya. (Dan Kami hubungkan anak cucu mereka dengan mereka) ke dalam surga, dengan demikian maka anak cucu mereka memiliki kedudukan yang sama dengan mereka, sekalipun anak cucu mereka tidak mempunyai hubungan dengan mereka.

question_en: Do the people of Paradise drink wine?
answer_en: Yes, but this drink is unlike the wine of the world, it does not intoxicate the mind, nor does it lead to foolishness or sinful speech.
question_id: Ataukah penghuni surga yang kenikmatannya abadi dan telah dijanjikan untuk orang-orang Mukmin yang bertakwa sebagai surga dan tidak akan terputus?
answer_id: Ya, tetapi minuman ini tidak seperti anggur di dunia, ia tidak memabukkan pikiran, dan juga tidak mengarah ke kebodohan atau tutur kata yang berdosa.

question_en: What is the reason for the bliss of the people of Paradise?
answer_en: They were in the world fearful of God Almighty, dreading His punishment and retribution on the Day of Judgment. God showed them mercy by guiding them and sparing them the torment of Hellfire, which is its fire and heat. Previously, they used to supplicate to God alone, asking Him to protect them from the torment of Hellfire and grant them Paradise. He answered their prayers and granted their request, for He is indeed the Most Merciful. Whoever attains His mercy and kindness will gain His pleasure and enter Paradise, and will be spared from His wrath and the Fire. Some of them turned to each other, asking (25) 'We were previously in our families, fearful (26) But God has shown us mercy and saved us from the torment of Hellfire (27) We used to invoke Him, for He is indeed the Most Merciful.' - Al-Tur.
question_id: Mengapa orang-orang yang berbuat kebatilan di dunia telah mendustakan rasul-rasul?
answer_id: (Sesungguhnya Allah telah memasukkan orang-orang yang takut kepada siksa-Nya di dunia dengan rasa takut akan siksa-Nya) yaitu dengan dibunuh dan ditawan (dan siksa-Nya di akhirat) yaitu api neraka (dan memasukkan mereka ke dalam rahmat-Nya) yaitu surga. (Dan barang siapa yang mendapat) di antara mereka (ke dalam keridaan-Nya, niscaya Dia akan memasukkannya) dapat dibaca Tahqiq dan Tas-hil (ke dalam surga) yakni ke dalam surga (dan melepaskan amarah-Nya, dan melepaskan diri daripadanya serta mengeluarkan mereka) dari azab-Nya (sesungguhnya Allah telah memperkenankan doa mereka) di dunia (dan Dia Maha Penyayang kepada kami) sehingga Dia tidak menyegerakan hukuman-Nya kepada kami (lagi Maha Penyayang) terhadap mereka.

question_en: Or do they say, 'A poet, we await for him a fortune by chance'? (Quran 26:226) What is the meaning of this noble verse?
answer_en: Do the pagans say to you, O Messenger, 'He is a poet, we are waiting for his death'?
question_id: (Bahkan) lebih dari itu (mereka mengatakan,) "Dia (adalah seorang penyair yang kami tunggu-tunggu kecelakaan menimpanya") malapetaka menimpanya lalu ia binasa sebagaimana nasib yang dialami oleh para penyair lainnya.
answer_id: (Apakah orang-orang kafir berkata kepadamu, Muhammad, bahwa ia) yakni Nabi Muhammad saw. (adalah seorang penyair yang kami tunggu-tunggu kematiannya.

question_en: What does 'their dreams' (أَحْلَامُهُم) mean in the verse 'Or do you command them with your dreams, or are they a transgressing people?' (Al-Tur 52:32)?
answer_en: Their minds.
question_id: Apa arti 'mimpi mereka' (Al-Tur 52:32) atau mereka adalah orang-orang yang melanggar?' (Al-Tur 52:32)?
answer_id: Pikiran mereka.

question_en: Explain these verses from the Quran, Surah At-Tur (The Mount):
answer_en: Remind, O Messenger, those to whom the Quran was sent, for you are not a sorcerer who reveals the unknown without knowledge, nor a madman who speaks without understanding, as they claim. They say, 'He is a poet, we await his death.' Do their minds command them with this contradictory statement? For the qualities of sorcery, poetry, and madness cannot coexist. Do these pagans claim that Muhammad fabricated the Quran himself? Or were these pagans created without a Creator or Maker, or are they the creators of themselves? Or did they create the heavens and the earth in this magnificent manner? Or do they have treasures of your Lord that they control? Or are they the mighty ones who overpower God's creation by force and dominance? Or do they have a ladder to heaven to listen to the revelation and confirm that what they are upon is true? Or does God, the Exalted, have daughters and you have sons, as you falsely claim? Or do these pagans demand a fee for delivering the message, as they find it difficult to fulfill the obligation they are asked to bear? Or do they have knowledge of the unseen, which they write down and inform people about? Or do they intend deceit and trickery against the Messenger and the believers, for those who disbelieve, their plots and tricks will only rebound upon themselves? Or do they have a deity worthy of worship besides God? Far removed and exalted is He from what they associate. And even if these pagans see the torment descending upon them from the sky, they will not deviate from their disbelief, and they will say, 'This is but clouds piled up one upon another.'
question_id: Wahai Muhammad, terangkan kepada mereka ayat-ayat Allah yang menjelaskan berbagai hukum dan nasihat yang terkandung di dalamnya. Kitab-kitab suci yang diturunkan kepada para nabi adalah al-Qur'ân yang mengandung peringatan bagi orang yang menjadikannya sebagai petunjuk, dan bukan yang lain.
answer_id: (Apakah orang-orang kafir itu mengatakan, "Dia adalah seorang penyair yang kami tunggu-tunggu kematiannya.") hancur berantakan (Jawab mereka, "Apakah) menurut qiraat yang lain lafal A-innaa dibaca A-innaa (di antara mereka) apa yang mereka kehendaki tentang Alquran yang diturunkan kepada mereka, maksudnya apakah mereka dapat mendahuluinya (padahal Alquran ini) yakni di dalam Alquran itu (adalah benar-benar diturunkan dari Rabbmu) kepada orang-orang yang mengingkarinya (ataukah orang-orang musyrik itu) yakni penduduk Mekah (di antara mereka) yakni penduduk Mekah (yang mengaku-ngaku) yakni mereka mengatakan bahwa Alquran itu (sebagai tuhan, padahal mereka tidak mendatangkan keterangan-keterangan yang nyata) yakni hujah yang menunjukkan kepada keesaan Allah, karena mereka tidak mau beriman.

question_en: Do the disbelievers face punishment before the punishment of the Day of Judgment?
answer_en: Yes, indeed, those who are lost have a punishment in this world before the punishment of the Day of Judgment, including killing, enslavement, and the torment of the barrier, and other than that. And indeed, for those who wronged, there is a punishment besides that, but most of them do not know. (Tor 47)
question_id: Apakah orang-orang kafir juga akan mendapat siksa sebelum datangnya hari kiamat?
answer_id: (Sebenarnya orang-orang yang lalim itu) yakni orang-orang kafir (akan memperoleh azab, selain azab yang membinasakan mereka di dunia) berupa azab, tumbuh-tumbuhan dan lain-lainnya (tetapi kebanyakan mereka tidak mengetahui) akibat dari kedustaan mereka.

question_en: And be patient for the judgment of your Lord, for indeed, you are within Our sight, and glorify the praise of your Lord when you arise. And during the night, praise Him and at the setting of the stars. Surah At-Tur. Explain these verses.
answer_en: Be patient, O Messenger, with the judgment and command of your Lord regarding the burden of the message He has laid upon you, and with the harm caused by your people. Indeed, we are with you, watching over and caring for you. Glorify your Lord with His praise when you rise for prayer, and when you rise from sleep, and during the night. And do so again at the time of the morning prayer, just before the disappearance of the stars. In this verse, the attribute of the eyes is affirmed for the Exalted Lord, befitting His majesty, without any resemblance to His creation or likening to His essence. Glory be to Him, and all praise is due to Him, as this has been established in the tradition and agreed upon by the early generations. The word is used here in the plural form for the sake of magnification.
question_id: (Dan bersabarlah dalam menunggu ketetapan Rabbmu) yaitu dengan ditangguhkannya mereka dan janganlah dadamu merasa sempit karenanya (maka sesungguhnya kamu berada dalam pengawasan-Ku) yaitu selalu dalam lindungan dan pengawasan-Ku (dan bertasbihlah) seraya (memuji Rabbmu) yaitu katakanlah, 'Subhaanallah Wa Bihamdihii' (ketika kamu bangun berdiri) dari tidurmu atau dari tempat majelismu.
answer_id: (Hai Rasul, bersabarlah kamu) khithab atau perintah ini ditujukan kepada Nabi saw. (bersama-sama dengan kalimat Rabbmu) yakni Alquran (dan perintah-Nya) yang membenarkan-Nya (di waktu kamu bangun) dari tidur (untuk salat dan di malam hari) saat-saat malam hari (serta lakukanlah salat pada waktu fajar) yakni salat subuh (sesungguhnya sebelum bintang-bintang tenggelam) artinya sebelum bintang-bintang tenggelam (dan telah nyata bagi kamu) di dalam bintang-bintang itu terdapat tanda-tanda bagi kekuasaan Allah swt. (bagi Tuhanmu) yang menunjukkan kepada keesaan-Nya (Maha Suci dan Maha Suci Allah) kalimat ini memahasucikan-Nya dari mempunyai sifat yang disucikan-Nya (dari apa yang mereka sifat-sifatkan).

question_en: And the star when it falls, Your companion has not strayed, nor has he erred, Nor does he speak of his own desire. It is only a revelation that is revealed. He was taught by one mighty in power. One standing, while he was on the highest horizon. Then he approached and descended, until he was two bow lengths or closer, or even nearer. He revealed to His servant what he revealed. His heart did not lie about what he saw. Will you dispute with him about what he sees? And indeed, he saw him in another descent, At the lotus tree of the boundary, Near it is the garden of the abode, When there covered the lotus tree what covered it. His sight did not waver, nor did it stray. Indeed, he saw of the signs of his Lord, the great. Do you interpret the noble verses?
answer_en: I swear by Allah, the Most High, by the stars when they set, that Muhammad (peace be upon him) did not deviate from the path of guidance and truth, nor did he go astray, but rather he was in the utmost state of uprightness, balance, and righteousness, and his speech was not based on his own desire. The Quran and the Sunnah are nothing but a revelation from Allah to His Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him). Allah taught Muhammad (peace be upon him) an angel of great strength and beautiful appearance, who is Gabriel (peace be upon him). Gabriel appeared to the Prophet (peace be upon him) in his true form at the highest horizon, which is the horizon of the sun at its rising. Then Gabriel approached the Prophet (peace be upon him), coming closer and closer, until he was as close as two bow-lengths or even closer. Then Allah, the Most High, revealed to His servant Muhammad (peace be upon him) through Gabriel (peace be upon him). Muhammad's heart did not belie what his eyes saw. Do you deny Muhammad (peace be upon him) and argue with him about what he sees and observes from the signs of his Lord? Muhammad (peace be upon him) saw Gabriel in his true form again, at the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary, which is a tree in the seventh heaven, where all that is raised from the earth ends, and where all that is cast down from above ends. There is a great matter at the Lote Tree from Allah, the description of which is known only to Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. The Prophet (peace be upon him) was in a state of great steadfastness and obedience, so he did not move his gaze to the right or left, nor did he exceed what he was commanded to see. Muhammad (peace be upon him) saw the Night of Ascension from the great signs of his Lord, indicating Allah's power and greatness, including Paradise, Hellfire, and other things.
question_id: (Dan tiadalah) Maa bermakna Nafi (kecuali) (apa yang telah diwahyukan kepadanya) yaitu Alquran yang diwahyukan (dengan sebenar-benarnya) yang tidak diwahyukan kepadanya, maka mengapa kamu tidak berbantah-bantahan tentang apa yang ia lihat (padahal dia berada di ufuk yang tinggi) lafal Alquran ini menjadi Hal atau kata keterangan keadaan dari dhamir yang terkandung di dalam lafal 'Amilnya yang terkandung di dalam lafal Takhfif atau lafal 'Indahuu. Makna ayat, dia adalah Alquran yang mengandung makna Bayan, dan lafal Alquran adalah bentuk jamak dari lafal Bashirah yang artinya; lafal Alquran itu terang; lafal Alquran adalah bentuk jamak dari lafal Dzirah yang mengandung makna Mubtada (dan tidak lain) yakni Nabi Muhammad saw. (apa yang telah diwahyukan kepadanya) yakni apa yang telah diwahyukan kepadanya, yaitu berupa Alquran dan apa yang diwah (apa yang diwahyukan Rabbnya) yang diwahyukan telah diwahyukan Allah, dan apa yang diwahyukan-Nya, yaitu Alquran.
answer_id: Lafal ayat ini berta'alluq kepada lafal yang menjadi Ta'alluq atau gantungan bagi Khabar, yaitu lafal Kaainatan. Makna yang dimaksud ialah, bukanlah Alquran dan hukum-hukum yang diturunkan terhadap Nabi Muhammad saw. yaitu, bahwasanya Alquran itu diturunkan oleh Allah dari sisi-Nya.

question_en: What was the name of the god that the Quraysh used to worship?
answer_en: Have you considered Lat, Uzza, and Manat, the third, the other?
question_id: Apa nama dewa yang Quraisy digunakan untuk menyembah?
answer_id: Apakah kalian mengetahui hal itu sehingga memikirkan Lât, 'Uzzâ dan, ketiga, Manât yang kalian jadikan tuhan-tuhan sembahan kalian?

question_en: What does 'ضِيزَى' mean in the verse 'That, then, is a division, ignoble' from Surah An-Najm (53:22)?
answer_en: This is an unfair and unjust division.
question_id: Apa artinya "Nejm" dalam ayat 'Itu, kemudian, adalah sebuah divisi, tercela' dari Surah An-Najm (53:22)?
answer_id: Pembagian itu sungguh merupakan pembagian yang tidak adil, karena kalian telah menjadikan sesuatu yang tidak kalian sukai untuk Allah.

question_en: What are the conditions for intercession?
answer_en: God alone grants permission for intercession, and He is pleased with those whom He wills. And how many angels are there in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all, except by the permission of Allah and His pleasure.
question_id: Bagaimana kondisi perantaranya?
answer_id: Dan berapa banyaknya malaikat di langit, syafa'at mereka sedikitpun tidak berguna, kecuali dengan izin Allah dan keridhaan-Nya.

question_en: Who are those who avoid the major sins and the forbidden acts, except for minor ones? Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He is the most knowing of you, when He created you from the earth and when you were in the bellies of your mothers. Therefore, do not claim purity for yourselves. He is the most knowing of who is righteous. (32) Al-Najm (The Star). Explain this verse.
answer_en: They are those who stay away from major sins and indecencies, except for minor sins that one does not persist in or that a servant commits rarely. If they fulfill their duties and avoid prohibited acts, God will forgive these and cover them up. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He knows your conditions best, from when He created your father Adam from clay, and when you were in the bellies of your mothers. Do not boast about yourselves and do not claim righteousness, for He knows best who truly fears His punishment and avoids His disobedience among His servants.
question_id: (Yaitu orang-orang yang menjauhi dosa-dosa besar dan perbuatan-perbuatan keji selain dari kesalahan-kesalahan kecil) yang dimaksud dari lafal Al Lamam adalah dosa-dosa kecil seperti, melihat wanita lain, menciumnya dan menyentuhnya.
answer_id: (Mereka itulah orang-orang yang menjauhi dosa-dosa besar dan perbuatan keji selain dari kesalahan-kesalahan kecil) yang dimaksud dari lafal Al Lamam adalah dosa-dosa kecil seperti, melihat wanita lain, menciumnya dan menyentuhnya.

question_en: Have you considered the one who turns away (from the truth), and gives a little, and hoards? Does he have knowledge of the unseen so that he sees (the truth)? Explain these verses.
answer_en: Have you seen the one who turned away from faith when he was reminded and said, 'I fear the punishment of Allah,' so we relieved him of the burden to carry the punishment of Allah.
